story:
Short Summary

 GreenTREE Yoga is an established charity nonprofit with the mission of bringing the benefits of yoga to underserved populations and the people who work with them (greentreeyoga.org). Our program focus is trauma-sensitive yoga, so we work in Title One schools, with veterans, and in shelters.  We also do professional development for social workers, nurses, health care professionals, and teachers. 

We have developed a trauma-sensitive yoga program that allows us to share yoga with veterans at the Salt Lake Veterans Administration (VA).  We provide two weekly classes for women only and two classes for both men and women.

GreenTREE is in the third year of a five year contract for trauma-sensitive yoga at the VA.  We've expanded to FIVE classes a week!  We also provide professional development for clinicians on how to use simple yoga for trauma and vicarious trauma – for self-care and with their clients. Teaching veterans how to feel safe in their bodies and how to manage their stress (and to share these ideas with others) is one of the most rewarding things I do.

Yoga offers a body-based intervention for trauma survivors, using both the mind and body to promote healing.  Trauma-sensitive, body-based yoga helps people with PTDS to feel their bodies, to learn to befriend their bodies, and to self-regulate. This all supports neuronal rewiring of the brain so that people may regain a positive approach to life and to find enjoyment in their days.

All of your contributions would go directly toward providing free DVDs/CDs to veterans, to provide more free community trauma-sensitive yoga classes to veterans, and to fund an 'Art and Yoga' program at the Women Veterans’ Retreat at The National Ability Center in Park City in July, 2015. 

What We Need & What You Get

We want to raise $1,500 for our veterans’ program: (1)for our popular CD/DVDs “Yoga for Caregivers’ to donate to veterans taking our yoga classes  (2) for journals and art materials for our journaling classes we offer after our yoga classes ; 3) Materials for our Art and Yoga Program offered at VA retreats for women with military sexual trauma;  and, 4) free, community-based, trauma-sensitive yoga classes for veterans - we will work with Team Red White and Blue.

The Art and Yoga program is our successful program in which we help children address trauma by combining the benefits of yoga and artistic expression. They do the yoga and art with their mothers and receive free materials and yoga games to support using yoga breaks to self-regulate at home.

We will apply ALL of the funds we receive toward the program implementation. 

Perks:  See product details at greentreeyoga.org. 
Receive a special letter of thanks to your Veteran in recognition of service.

$20.00: Shanti the Monkey Poster (11 x 17 inch color print)

$30.00:  LittleTREE Yoga CD/DVD for ages 3-8.  It's a great way to introduce yoga to kids or to do yoga with your family.  It also is used in schools and shelters OR the Yoga for Caregivers DVD/CD. 

$50.00  LittleTREE Yoga CD/DVD and a Shanti the Monkey coloring book

$100.00  LittleTREE Yoga CD/DVD, a Shanti the Monkey coloring book, and the book Yoga Makes Me Feel ...

$500.00:  Shanti the Monkey micropile cushion (12x18"); Shanti the Monkey coloring book; and the book, Yoga Makes Me Feel…

Please enjoy FREE yoga breaks on our website -- greentreeyoga.org.  Go to the FREE link - there are office yoga breaks (2 and 5 minutes) and free yoga breaks for kids.

  •  

The Impact

GreenTREE Yoga has established strong working relationship with the Salt Lake VA over the past 3 years.

Research* has shown that a body-based, somatic approach to healing trauma is an important first step. A trauma-sensitive yoga practice can help people learn to befriend their bodies and to feel safe. Only after feeling the body and learning to feel safe in the body can one learn to regulate core arousal systems, to relax, through simple breathing techniques.  If a person can’t feel his body, if the limbic system is in overdrive (Daniel Siegel calls it “limbic lava”), then he is not able to benefit from talking, a higher level cognitive function.  A highly stressed person is not open to processing language, to what therapists have to say.  First, you have to get a person calm, then one can access the functions in the prefrontal cortex.  Trauma-sensitive yoga provides tools for each of these three steps:  first feeling the body, then feeling safe in the body, and then regulating core arousal systems.

  The last piece of the healing puzzle is that this process of body-based healing helps people to rewire the brain, to use the brain’s strong abilities to undergo neuroplasticity so that people may find joy in their lives again. 

*Bessel van der Kolk,MD; Pat Odgen, PhD, Peter Levine, PhD, Stephen Porges, PhD. 

  •  

Risks & Challenges

GreenTREE Yoga programs have value for several key reasons.

1. Community Support

GreenTREE Yoga has many community partners, including ABLE-Differently, The Children’s Center, InBody Outreach, RISE, Utah PTA, and the Utah State Office of Education.

We have long standing partnerships with The Children's Center (a nonprofit school that serves children with emotional challenges) and InBody Outreach, a yoga volunteer nonprofit.

We have worked with veterans for several years and done many professional development trainings for the professionals who work with veterans.

2.  Professional Development

  In addition, GreenTREE does professional development trainings for teachers, social workers, and nurses for continuing education credits.  We also present at many annual conferences on the topics of yoga and trauma, yoga and compassion fatigue, and yoga in the schools. Our programs are presented nationally and internationally. A list is provided on our website, greentreeyoga.org.

3.  Commitment to the Cause

GreenTREE Yoga has continually demonstrated its commitment to helping people of all ages and abilities to improve the quality of their lives through using yoga to learn to self-regulate, to heal, and to maintain health.  In addition to years of successful programing, we continue to develop more support materials.  We have developed trauma training kits, school kits and curricula, books, dvds, cds, and other support materials.  Our new projects include yoga for the special needs child.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are supportive of our cause, there are other ways that you can show your support.

Please let your friends know about this fundraising campaign. 

You can also use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about our programs.

There are FREE yoga breaks on our website -- greentree yoga.org   FREE link.  Enjoy!

story:
Our Story

Hello, I have put this fundraiser together for a very important person in my life, my cousin Gloria Martinez. She is from Texas and currently lives in Katy. She is receiving treatment at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston. She was diagnosed with BONE CANCER in her jaw, June of 2010. Gloria Received her first surgery in July  to remove the cancer from her lower jaw and her road to recovery began. Several months after the surgery she found out the cancer was back, and aggressive. She has now gone through several rounds of chemo and has one more round left, then another surgery in March. Hoping for the best from here.


The Impact

Gloria is a mother of 4 and has a career in the medical field. Since this struggle began last year she has not worked and missed out on lots of good time with her children. When you make a donation you will be helping Gloria pay for some of these medical bills that are pilling and living expenses also. If this benefit doesn’t succeed who knows what road lies ahead. She could lose a house that she has worked so hard for and maybe even her vehicle. No doubt in my mind she would do the same for someone else in her position unacceptable.


 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is $5,000 and pray that everything works out and we do. If not we will start working on other options for another benifit. We have had 2 BBQ benifits but I would like to make more for Gloria as the medical bills and living expences dont stop. Gloria's mortgage alone is $1300. Update:(2/25/2011) Gloria has had to change medical insurance, which means that she now has deductables and has recieved a few bills already. One that is $6000+ and another that's $5000+... To reach our goal all we need is 50 donations of $100. Does'nt seem like much when you think about it that way but, it's still a difficult task to get people or companies to donate. If anyone has any good ideas on some good perks I can add give me a shout and email me, kmhall_28@yahoo.com


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell friends and family about us on INDIE GOGO!

story:
SoleMate: Digital Foot Measuring Device

SoleMate is a digital foot measurement device that will measure your feet in seconds. Just step on the digital device and your shoe size is calculated in both US and Euro sizes.  The foot measuring device is combined with a common bathroom weight scale for ease of home use.  It takes the guess work of ordering shoes online at home and at the retail stores.


SoleMate's Campaign Participated in International Women's Day 2014


SoleMate was selected to be a part of the International Women's Day.   We were selected since the idea for the innovation was founded by a woman.   A woman who wanted a modern way for foot measurement.

This innovation is a international product.   SoleMate sizes the foot for both US and Euro measurements. Both US and European shoe manufacturers could potentially sell more shoes in each other countries, if the consumer is more aware of their shoe size in other measurements.


Museum of History & Industry

The Museum of History and Industry in Seattle, in conjunction with the opening of their Bezos Center for Innovation, recently held a Napkin Sketch contest. This contest invited the public to sketch an innovative invention on a napkin and tweet a picture of it with the hashtag #innovationMOHAI. Out of the 30 entries of innovative ideas, SoleMate was selected as a runner up.

The Digital Device

The idea was created while shopping at a big box store in 2005.   I found myself with a two year old screaming, who didn't want to try on shoes anymore.  I was a tired mom just wanting to get the right fit and get out of the store!  I thought, why cant they just invent something my son could just stand on.    Something that could tell me his general shoe size, in a digital format with US and Euro sizes.

In our research, we found that a child 1-6 years old, grows a shoe size every 1-2 months, ages 6-10 years old growths every 2-3 months and ages 10-12 years old every 3-4 months. The Sole Mate would help assist parents and take the guess work out of the children’s shoe sizing.  Besides the children's foot, your adult foot changes over time.  The SoleMate calculates both children and adults shoe sizes.   Getting the correct fit is our priority with the creation of SoleMate.

Patent Pending Status

We received our patent pending status with our provisional patent. 

Why Support This Project?

Getting the correct fit for your feet, with good fitting shoes has always been a challenged for many people.    Especially for children, it could cause problems down the road if the correct fit is not worn.   Yet in today's fast pace world, do we take the time to measure our feet?   In retail stores today the old metal device is still the only resource to measure our feet.   But will young people today take the time to measure themselves on such a ancient device?

We need a quick and easier way to measure our feet!   All the articles say in order to get the proper fit you need to be measured.   Yet when online ordering for shoes the merchants suggests you get out a ruler to measure your feet and then use a conversion chart to figure out your size.   We say consumers don't want to bother with this and we need a new way to measure your feet.

Our SoleMate was created to make this a quick and simple measurement for the consumer to get the right fit.  You will still need to try on the shoe since different manufacturers have different styles, but finding the general size for you or your growing child is our priority. 

We have heard of story after story of those who didn't get the right fit and had foot problems.  We want to take those problems and simply the process for the consumer.  As online shoe ordering is on the rise, it has changed the way we purchase shoes.   But the consumer should not have to compromise on getting the right fit for their feet.  

Where is the Money Going?

As a contributor to this project, the first step will provide the a basic conceptual platform, 3D modeling, and engineering plan.

With your support of this project, we will receive a giant step towards getting in front of a large manufacturer by Summer 2014!

story:
**NOTE**    6.17.2014
We have dropped our goal to $5,000!  We are confident that we can open our doors on $5,000 and would love for you to help us reach that landmark!
We aren't able to change our goal in the Indiegogo books officially, but we wanted to share with you that this goal is DEFINITELY attainable and we need your help!
Thanks in advance for your support and love!


Who we are:

The vision of Zen Den came from the minds and hearts of two dreamers: Lolly Nicol and Amy Rodriguez.  These ladies believe strongly in the value of having a retreat to escape from the day to day hustle and bustle of the world in order to take a breath of peace and regroup.  Self care and personal well-being are invaluable in the grand scheme of living a happy and balanced life, which is why we are proud make Zen Den a reality and bring it to you!

Lolly is a licensed cosmetologist with a Hospitality and Tourism degree and extensive event planning experience.  Her compassion for the earth and its beings flow into her everyday life, and push her to help create a peaceful, healing haven for people to come enjoy themselves and feel their best.  Lolly has had her hands in hair since childhood, and grew up in a home that supported feminism, cloth diapers, and the arts.  Her journey to Zen Den was one that she didn’t realize she had been on… everything in her life thus far has culminated to reveal that this is what she’d been walking towards all along.

Amy is a former business owner, licensed cosmetologist, and radio broadcaster. Her love of others and desire to heal and re-energize people drives her to give back with as much of herself as she is able.  Amy is also a cancer survivor, mother, and wife; these aspects of her journey have pushed her compassion to a  whole new level and have lead her to explore new healing arts on her path to Zen Den.

What we will offer:

Part of what makes Zen Den so special is that it will be a collaborative studio filled with the love, light, and knowledge of many different wellness and self care artists and professionals!  We are excited to welcome friends and fellow community members to join our network and share our space as their paths cross ours with common goals and related skill sets!

 Some of the amazing services that we'll be offering are:

  • Massage & Reiki
  • Exclusively Organic Hair Services (including Bridal Services)
  • Exclusively Organic Makeup Services (including Bridal Services)
  • Various Healing Sessions
  • Yoga, Zumba, and other Movement Classes
  • Meditation
  • Aromatherapy
  • A Retail Area (supporting local artisans and filled with goodies to help you live a balanced life)
  • A Relaxation Space (a Den so to speak, that is filled with lush couches, coziness, relaxing music, and good vibes)
  • Extended Education Classes and Special Events

Steps we've taken:

We have been working tirelessly to bring this dream to fruition, and in the many hours devoted to Zen Den we have laid the groundwork for the business.  

So far, we have:

  • Drafted a detailed business plan
  • Conducted market research
  • Established Zen Den LLC as a legal business entity
  • Consulted with business advisors, accountants, and lawyers in order to lay the foundation for the legal and financial structure of our business
  • Found our dream location and have been discussing with the landlord
  • Established a social networking presence
  • Established www.zendenct.com which we plan to develop into a streamlined website that enables our guests to book online, keep up to date with news and events, and keep involved with our community
  • Executed and enjoyed our first promotional event as Zen Den at Re:Create CT in Elizabeth Park in West Hartford on May 4, 2014

What we need:

Well, to be honest, in our dream scenario, we would love to start with $100K to be able to create the rockinest facility that you ever did see!  But we got a reality check from our dear friend and accountant who urged us to re-evaluate our initial budget.

Our crowdfunding goal is $20K and we'd love for you to help us reach this goal and be a part of our future!  By all means, if we surpass this goal, we'd be thrilled - and would put the extra money to good use to expand our center for you!

With $20,000 we'll be able to get things off the ground and prepare Zen Den for opening.  Your donation will go toward:

  • Furnishing our location
  • Stocking supplies and tools (massage, hair, yoga, etc.)
  • Marketing and Web development

How You Can Help

We see this www.indiegogo.com campaign as not only a way for us to raise funds to open Zen Den, but also as an invaluable forum to raise awareness and broaden our community of supporters both near and far.  We appreciate any amount of support you may give, whether financially or through sharing our project with your friends and family.

  • Please "like" us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/ctzenden
  • Follow us on Instagram: @zendenct
  • Follow us on Twitter: @zendenct
  • Visit our website (and check out our blog): www.zendenct.com
  • Email us: zensational333@gmail.com


We would like to express our deepest gratitude for all contributions to our campaign in support of Zen Den!  Not only will we be acknowledging your generous contributions on our website, we will also be commemorating them in an art piece to be displayed at Zen Den.  Additionally, we will include you on our mailing list so that you can stay up to date on everything that your donations have made possible!

Many of our sponsorship levels should be considered pre-payment for our services at a deep discount - and all sponsorship levels should be considered a step on your path to wellness and a balanced lifestyle. Every penny that is donated here will go toward building the foundation of Zen Den.

Thank you so much for taking time to visit our page, learn more about Zen Den, contribute to our campaign, and be a part of our future! 


Love  & Light,
Lolly & Amy

Be Zensational!



**Three Perk Levels include Zen Den Memberships... if you're wondering what that consists of... Here it is!**


A Membership Includes:
-unlimited yoga, zumba, and movement classes
-monthly massages
-monthly organic hair services
-monthly healing sessions of your choice
-free or discounted entrance to special events
- & 15% retail discount which may be combined with other studio promotions!
story_txt:
**NOTE**    6.17.2014We have dropped our goal to $5,000!  We are confident that we can open our doors on $5,000 and would love for you to help us reach that landmark!We aren't able to change our goal in the Indiegogo books officially, but we wanted to share with you that this goal is DEFINITELY attainable and we need your help!Thanks in advance for your support and love!Who we are:The vision of Zen Den came from the minds and hearts of two dreamers: Lolly Nicol and Amy Rodriguez.  These ladies believe strongly in the value of having a retreat to escape from the day to day hustle and bustle of the world in order to take a breath of peace and regroup.  Self care and personal well-being are invaluable in the grand scheme of living a happy and balanced life, which is why we are proud make Zen Den a reality and bring it to you!Lolly is a licensed cosmetologist with a Hospitality and Tourism degree and extensive event planning experience.  Her compassion for the earth and its beings flow into her everyday life, and push her to help create a peaceful, healing haven for people to come enjoy themselves and feel their best.  Lolly has had her hands in hair since childhood, and grew up in a home that supported feminism, cloth diapers, and the arts.  Her journey to Zen Den was one that she didn’t realize she had been on… everything in her life thus far has culminated to reveal that this is what she’d been walking towards all along.Amy is a former business owner, licensed cosmetologist, and radio broadcaster. Her love of others and desire to heal and re-energize people drives her to give back with as much of herself as she is able.  Amy is also a cancer survivor, mother, and wife; these aspects of her journey have pushed her compassion to a  whole new level and have lead her to explore new healing arts on her path to Zen Den.What we will offer:Part of what makes Zen Den so special is that it will be a collaborative studio filled with the love, light, and knowledge of many different wellness and self care artists and professionals!  We are excited to welcome friends and fellow community members to join our network and share our space as their paths cross ours with common goals and related skill sets! Some of the amazing services that we'll be offering are:
Massage & Reiki
Exclusively Organic Hair Services (including Bridal Services)
Exclusively Organic Makeup Services (including Bridal Services)
Various Healing Sessions
Yoga, Zumba, and other Movement Classes
Meditation
Aromatherapy
A Retail Area (supporting local artisans and filled with goodies to help you live a balanced life)
A Relaxation Space (a Den so to speak, that is filled with lush couches, coziness, relaxing music, and good vibes)
Extended Education Classes and Special Events
Steps we've taken:We have been working tirelessly to bring this dream to fruition, and in the many hours devoted to Zen Den we have laid the groundwork for the business.  So far, we have:
Drafted a detailed business plan
Conducted market research
Established Zen Den LLC as a legal business entity
Consulted with business advisors, accountants, and lawyers in order to lay the foundation for the legal and financial structure of our business
Found our dream location and have been discussing with the landlord
Established a social networking presence
Established www.zendenct.com which we plan to develop into a streamlined website that enables our guests to book online, keep up to date with news and events, and keep involved with our community
Executed and enjoyed our first promotional event as Zen Den at Re:Create CT in Elizabeth Park in West Hartford on May 4, 2014
What we need:
Well, to be honest, in our dream scenario, we would love to
start with $100K to be able to create the rockinest facility that you ever did
see!  But we got a reality
check from our dear friend and accountant who urged us to re-evaluate our
initial budget.
Our crowdfunding goal is $20K and we'd love for you to help
us reach this goal and be a part of our future!  By all means, if we surpass this goal, we'd be thrilled -
and would put the extra money to good use to expand our
center for you!With $20,000 we'll be able to get things off the ground and prepare Zen Den for opening.  Your donation will go toward:
Furnishing our location
Stocking supplies and tools (massage, hair, yoga, etc.)
Marketing and Web development
How You Can HelpWe see this www.indiegogo.com campaign as not only a way for us to raise funds to open Zen Den, but also as an invaluable forum to raise awareness and broaden our community of supporters both near and far.  We appreciate any amount of support you may give, whether financially or through sharing our project with your friends and family.
Please "like" us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/ctzenden

Follow us on Instagram: @zendenct
Follow us on Twitter: @zendenct
Visit our website (and check out our blog): www.zendenct.com

Email us: zensational333@gmail.com
We would like to express our deepest gratitude for all contributions to our campaign in support of Zen Den!  Not only will we be acknowledging your generous contributions on our website, we will also be commemorating them in an art piece to be displayed at Zen Den.  Additionally, we will include you on our mailing list so that you can stay up to date on everything that your donations have made possible!Many of our sponsorship levels should be considered pre-payment for our services at a deep discount - and all sponsorship levels should be considered a step on your path to wellness and a balanced lifestyle. Every penny that is donated here will go toward building the foundation of Zen Den.Thank you so much for taking time to visit our page, learn more about Zen Den, contribute to our campaign, and be a part of our future! Love  & Light,Lolly & AmyBe Zensational!**Three Perk Levels include Zen Den Memberships... if you're wondering what that consists of... Here it is!**A Membership Includes:-unlimited yoga, zumba, and movement classes-monthly massages-monthly organic hair services-monthly healing sessions of your choice-free or discounted entrance to special events- & 15% retail discount which may be combined with other studio promotions!

story:
What is the Project?

The Weema Project is a health project of Kyampisi Childcare Ministries, Uganda. With 3 health outreaches in one project (Health Centre, Mobile Clinics & public health outreaches) – it is our objective to increase access to essential health care in the Kyampisi community, with a particular focus on maternal and child health and preventive health care (health promotion).

We are currently in the development stage, and have a committed team in Uganda, Australia and other countries working hard to get this project off the ground - but we are completely donor funded and we need your help. We hope to open our doors mid 2014, and the community is excited and anticipating what is to come to their community.

Why are we fundraising?

We are completely donor funded at this stage of the project and as the construction continues, we need to establish electricity in the Weema Health Centre. We have received a quote from a trusted electrician and he is ready to begin work as soon as funds are available! The quote is for 4,345.13AUD / 3,886.28USD. Taking into account fees of this website, we have rounded our goal to $4800AUD / $4300USD. If there are any remaining funds, they will be used with full accountability towards our next endeavour - to fund the plumbing system for the health centre. 

Your donation will be directly used for the electricity installation and full accountability can be given to all donors, together with photos of the continuing work in Kyampisi - work which your donation has made possible!

The community is very excited for the Weema Project to open its doors and they'd like to say thank you for contributing and making this possible. For those who donate:

  • Up to 49USD, you'll get a personal email (make sure you share your details with us) from the Weema Project development team, saying thanks so much! We value your donation towards Weema, whether small or large!
  • 50USD - 200USD the children in Kyampisi will pose for a photo, just for you! Saying thanks so much!- and we will send it directly from Uganda to you.
  • 201USD-999USD, you will receive your photo from the children, plus a letter from someone in the community  - saying 'Thankyou!'. 
  • 1000USD plus - we will plant a pine tree in the Weema Health Centre gardens on your behalf, and recognise your contribution to the development of Weema with a plaque and your name below the tree. You will forever be a part of the Weema Project! You will a receive a photo of the tree planting as a keepsake, plus a photo of the children saying thanks, and a letter from the community.

Please note that we are fundraising in USD, however for those from Australia who donate - gifts will be given for the same dollar amounts, i.e. 200USD = 200AUD (for the purpose of this campaign). 

How will your donation help? 

Kyampisi is a village typical of Africa. High rates of poverty, HIV/AIDs, malaria and largely preventable illness, yet the health system in failing the area. The Weema Project has a vision of changing that, of bringing reliable, quality and compassionate health care the the region, which is also financially and geographically accessible. With your generous donation, we will be step closer to opening our doors and serving the community in this practical and essential way. 

How else can you help if you cannot donate?

We understand that not all people are able to donate, so we ask if that is you, please spread the work for the Weema Project in Uganda!  Help us to reach our goal and even surpass it for the continued construction work taking place. If you're a tradesman (electrician, plumber, carpenter) and would like to volunteer with the Weema Project in Uganda - you are also welcome! Visit http://weemaproject.org/ways-to-help/ and fill out the online volunteer application form and we'll be in touch with you ASAP. Also, we are seeking volunteers for other areas, and eventually health volunteers so keep in touch and see what incredible things are taking place in Kyampisi, Uganda.

story:
Pinkmail.org Free Email System & Auction 4 Breast Cancer Awareness

www.pinkmail.org

My name is Michael Brock and I built Pinkmail.org to Help Save Lives with Each Email Sent on our system and bring Awareness to Breast Cancer becuase my sister lost her breast to this horrible disease and I never want another woman or man to go through what she went through....and yes men are being Diagnosed with Breast Cancer! 

40,000 women was expected to DIE in 2013 with 300,000 New cases from Breast Cancer alone in the United States and 2000 men being diagnosed with Breast Cancer not including the other countries!!!!!

 I've built lots of websites to date ( www.lasvegascomplaints.com ) included and have owned many companies. Pinkmail.org is by far the best and most helpful !!!! Help Pinkmail.org grow and survive Today. It's for a Great Cause!!!!!

Pinkmail.org is a Free Email System (like Gmail & Yahoo mail) only when You Send and Recieve Emails on Pinkmail.org You Help Save Lives and Bring Awareness to Breast Cancer. When you Auction a product off and it completes You Help Raise Money for Yourself, Breast Cancer Awareness & Research!

If your going to use a FREE Email Systems why not one that has a Cause.....Pinkmail.org is the Only Free Email System with a Cause (To Beat Breast Cancer Today) and it's Own Auction to Help Raise Money for Breast Cancer Awareness and Research! 

The money raised will be used to hire support staff  and fund the National Launch of pinkmail.org thur online ads and TV ads. Pinkmail.org is gaining users everyday (Over 40,000 so far) and we need this National Launch to be able to Fund our next step of going World Wide Full Blast to Bring Awareness to Breast Cancer, so We Can Beat it TOGETHER!!!!!!


We just added a vocal notification like AOL used to have ( You Have Mail ) which notifies users "You Been Pinkmailed", that they have a NEW email on pinkmail.org system. "Bringing FUN Back To Emailing". We have several new add ons we will use the money for as well as growing our user base and auction!

If you don't help us with the funding at least go to www.pinkmail.org and signup for your own pinkmail.org Free Email Account and Help Save Lives with Each Email You Send and Receive On Our System and be sure to tell all your family, friends and business assoicates about Pinkmail.org and to Signup Today , share this with everyone thur Indiegogo share tools. Thanks For Considering www.pinkmail.org !!!!!

"THINK PINK THINK PINKMAIL.ORG TODAY"

story:
H.E.R.E. (Heal: Embrace. Replenish. Enrich.)

if we are well, we can be well for each other 

Healing yourself begins with embracing who you truly are. Only then can you begin to receive nourishment in a way that is replenishing to your body, mind, emotions and spirit. When we are well, we can be well for others, and serving others enriches our lives and creates a platform for healing in our communities.

H.E.R.E. believes that wellness comes from within. We aim to provide healing opportunities for the people of Ann Arbor and its surrounding areas in ways that will demonstrate to individuals self-care practices that will transform their lives beyond H.E.R.E. Each of us is committed to practicing what we teach, for only if we are well can we be well for each other.

How We Got H.E.R.E.

Andrea Ridgard (Grounded Here LLC) and Sylvia Nolasco-Rivers (Pilar's Tamales) launched a Monday afternoon Yoga class & Coffee hour in the Spring of 2013. Students gathered in the café on a day it was closed for a quiet grounding afternoon of peaceful movement followed by tea and conversation with classmates. Sylvia, her daughter, and Andrea would clear tables and chairs weekly to make space for mats, blocks, blankets and students. Within weeks, the class was growing and summertime hosted many classes in the outdoor space behind the café. In October, Sylvia invited Andrea to expand her business in the room that would become dedicated to healing, in the heart of her Salvadoran family restaurant. To learn more about how Sylvia and Andrea met, watch our video above!

Since October, the room has become quite active with additional yoga classes, retreats, Ayurvedic Lifestyle Consultations, and meditation sessions. Andrea and Sylvia could not do this alone!  (Learn More about Ayurveda, HERE)

Natalie Berry (nattie b. sunshine) is an Artist  and the Kids' Yoga Instructor , teaching a weekly kids class and preparing for an August 2014 Kids Yoga & Cooking Camp with Sylvia! She is also our famed muralist.

Brooke Pickrell leads a monthly Yoga class for area pastors, followed by spiritual study and conversation over delicious tamales.

Nina Levin guides students through what she calls Slow Burn Vinyasa. 

H.E.R.E. is out to make the warmest room in the heart of Pilar's Tamales, safe, comfortable, resourceful, and beautiful. This campaign is important to us because it will allow us to advance our mission of bringing community together on Ann Arbor's westside through healing activities that are affordable and accessible to everyone. You are now a part of this community that has brought us great joy, purpose, and gratitude. Together we can provide these services to folks who would enjoy:

  • Smaller, affordable yoga classes
  • Exploring healing practices in a favorite local hot-spot
  • Sampling healing Ayurvedic menu items alongside familiar foods
  • Building community beyond the yoga mat
  • Receiving diet and lifestyle consultations in an environment where they can put recommendations into practice!


Our Needs, Your Rewards (the fun part!)

Your support will allow H.E.R.E. to: 

  • Install level, safe, beautiful flooring that will provide a softer, warmer ground on which to practice
  • Seed a scholarship fund for H.E.R.E. services and activities
  • Support the first summer Kids' Yoga & Cooking Camp
  • Develop and implement Ayurvedic menu items to support our health as individuals and with the variation of the seasons
  • Complete an original nattie b. sunshine  mural 
  • Purchase ample Yoga props (blocks, blankets, straps, bolsters) and build shelving in which to store them
  • Install murphy desk for Ayurvedic Lifestyle Consultations
  • Create a soothing, quiet environment with a sound proof door, improved audio system, curtains over the doors, twinkle lights, battery-operated candles, and tapestries on the ceiling
  • Provide 1 year of yoga mat cleaning supplies and funds for advertising
  • Purchase a floor rug for events and hooks for personal belongings
Our unique perks will allow you to experience H.E.R.E. throughout the development process, visiting the cafe for a taste of Pilar's Tamales, participating in a yoga class, enjoying a personalized yoga lesson, or brightening your home with a print of the H.E.R.E. mural. Check them out in detail to the right!


Your contribution will make the success of H.E.R.E. possible even if our financial goal is not met in this campaign. Our priorities are installing a safe and beautiful floor and seeding a scholarship fund for the services and activities we provide. The scholarship fund will be sustained by encouraging those who borrow a yoga mat during class to chip in $1 each time.


Your Impact

We believe it takes a community to nourish the soul. Even adults need the loving arms of neighbors, friends and family to encourage their continued growth and healing. Building wellness centers where people can come together with this personal development in mind is where it's at! And by contributing, you are showing the world that you, too, value the integrity of the simplest ways to stay healthy: loving yourself, and loving one another.

Imagine a world in which every community had a place where folks could go to feel whole. A space where health care providers came together to serve their neighbors alongside one another, where individuals built lasting friendships and cultivated a better sense of self. This is the start of a world like that, friends. 

Want to do more than drop a few coins?

  • Share THIS LINK on your social networking sites
  • Download and print THIS FLYER and post it in your workplace
  • Visit Pilar's Tamales, take a yoga class, see what all the hype (soothing, sweet energy) is about, then tell those you know and love to do the same:)
  • LIKE us on Facebook!
  • And that’s all there is to it. We are thrilled you have joined us on this journey!

A space where health care providers came together to serve their neighbors alongside one another, where individuals built lasting friendships and cultivated a better sense of self. This is the start of a world like that, friends. Want to do more than drop a few coins?

Download and print THIS FLYER and post it in your workplace

Visit Pilar's Tamales, take a yoga class, see what all the hype (soothing, sweet energy) is about, then tell those you know and love to do the same:)


LIKE us on Facebook!
And that’s all there is to it. We are thrilled you have joined us on this journey!

story:
NEWS FOR THE DONORS: 

A letter from Brother Joseph

    We are very glad to learn that our dear Xenia Doualle has sent us a sum of 574 euro collected from her friends to help us to install a bore well irrigation system. The inmates, volunteers  and Brothers of the Little House of Divine Providence of Palluruthy, Cochin, India  are extremely grateful to you for your kind and generous help to install a bore well to meet the water scarcity of this Institute.

  We have already started the project.  Thanks to you, we managed to dig a number of bore wells (16 wells) of duel function. Kerala State is well blessed with plenty of rain water.  From June to November, we get an average of 3100 mm. rain every year. Almost 90% of this precious gift of God is wasted, as it is allowed to simply drain to the sea.  Then we have an extremely dry season from January to June, craving for water.

  Now, we have been harvesting all the rain water during the this monsoon season, collecting it in big tanks, and immediately  to discharging it to underground natural reservoir of 12 M. to 50 M. depth, using the bore wells.  When the dry season comes, we can make use of the same bore wells to deliver the stored water for our domestic and agricultural needs.

 Practically, we are storing the rain water for harder times and thus we do not hurt the harmony of the natural equilibrium.  On the other hand, we may contribute to the Earth’s ground water resource, as we do not need to take back the whole amount of rain water we inject into the womb of the Earth during the Monsoon season.

So, your kindness is helping us to furnish an environment friendly agricultural backing to our unfortunate physically and mentally handicapped  inmates, and, at the same time, to enrich the Earth, exploited and polluted at every instant.

Thank you, thank you very much.

Brother Joseph Vengasseril

Rector, Brithers of St. Joseph Cottolengo, Palluruthy, Kochi, India


A LIFELINE FOR A WHOLE COMMUNITY

This is an appeal from the Little House of Divine Providence - Cottolengo, in Kochi, Kerala (India), for assistance to develop its farm, to support the mentally and physically challenged citizens of this area. (More details here)

Agricultural activity plays an essential  and very useful part in our center. Our inmates dedicate most of their time in agricultural works.  We cultivate almost 5 acres of the land with coconut, fruit trees, seasonal vegetables, etc. A dairy farm with a number of animals (cattle, pig, chicken, duck, etc) makes an integral part of our farm activity. 

It is clear that all these activities necessitate plenty of fresh water. But we are surrounded by salt water and we have very little availability of fresh water from the public supply system.

It has become essential to erect a bore well which could provide us with sufficient quantity of water throughout the year.

What we need, what you get

  • This well costs 400 000 Indian Rupees to dig, equivalent on a high-end scenario to 5000 Euros, or 7000 US Dollars.
  • This is charity. Since we can't spare anything, we will thank you by painting the names of our kind donors, starting from 25 euros, on the well. 
  • If we can't make it to the amount we need, your donations will still be an addition to the final objective, hoping we can find private donations in the near future.

A little history

Since 1990, the Little House of Divine Providence is a Roman Catholic organization that has been serving, without fanfare and almost in silence, the cause of  the poor, elderly, mentally retarded, disabled, marginalized and the abandoned.  

We belong to the Indian Chapter of the International Congregation of the Brothers of St. Joseph Cottolengo (Turin, Italy), founded by the well-known, kind hearted, saintly man Joseph Benedict Cottolengo (1786 -1842) who dedicated his whole life to the poor and the marginalized.  

Here, a few committed Brothers and some motivated volunteers are offering their dedicated service to the destitute, throughout their entire life.  

Our organization

The Little House of Providence is a center recognized by the Board of Control for Orphanages and other Charitable Homes (certificate of recognition No. 729) under the Social Welfare Department of the Government of Kerala. 

The Corporation of Cochin is in close collaboration with our center and we cater to the necessities of the disabled who come under the care of the local civic bodies.

Our work with the inmates

The well-being of these people is not restricted to food and clothing. The Little House of Divine Providence provides a safe and comfortable dwelling to its inmates. 

Moreover, health care is guaranteed by eminent physicians. 

No fee or compensation or any type of honorarium is levied or collected from  any of the inhabitants.

At present, 44 inmates are taken care of without any discretion  of caste and creed. Occupational therapy is an integral element of their overall health care. It is essential that these inmates are to be stimulated  and trained continuously  to achieve  a certain development  of their intellectual capacity and eventual autonomy.  

Inmates are also engaged in painting, screen-printing, greeting card designing, statue making, bag making, weaving, candle manufacturing, and agricultural activities.

My story

I'm a 28 year old documentary filmmaker. I live in Paris, France, but my family lives in the US. After accomplishing my first feature documentary, I needed to rest, and went to India for a while.

There, I met the Cottolengo Brothers. Travelling from town to town, I eventually landed in Kochi and fell in love with it. I was invited to have dinner with Dr. Maliyakal and the brothers. It was the beginning of a friendship and they soon brought me to the Little House of Providence.

It wasn't easy to find a way to help them. But we found a camera and I was able to shoot this little video. 

I sincerely hope it will reach enough people to raise the money. When I'm able to put aside a little money I will go back there and show you the benefits of your generosity myself.

Help us!

You can make this possible! Please tell your friends, share the project as much as possible, we can't make it without you!
story_txt:
NEWS FOR THE DONORS: A letter from Brother Joseph
    We are very glad to learn that our dear Xenia Doualle has sent us a sum of 574 euro collected from her friends to help us to install a bore well irrigation system. The inmates, volunteers  and Brothers of the Little House of Divine Providence of Palluruthy, Cochin, India  are extremely grateful to you for your kind and generous help to install a bore well to meet the water scarcity of this Institute.
  We have already started the project.  Thanks to you, we managed to dig a number of bore wells (16 wells) of duel function. Kerala State is well blessed with plenty of rain water.  From June to November, we get an average of 3100 mm. rain every year. Almost 90% of this precious gift of God is wasted, as it is allowed to simply drain to the sea.  Then we have an extremely dry season from January to June, craving for water.
  Now, we have been harvesting all the rain water during the this monsoon season, collecting it in big tanks, and immediately  to discharging it to underground natural reservoir of 12 M. to 50 M. depth, using the bore wells.  When the dry season comes, we can make use of the same bore wells to deliver the stored water for our domestic and agricultural needs.
 Practically, we are storing the rain water for harder times and thus we do not hurt the harmony of the natural equilibrium.  On the other hand, we may contribute to the Earth’s ground water resource, as we do not need to take back the whole amount of rain water we inject into the womb of the Earth during the Monsoon season.
So, your kindness is helping us to furnish an environment friendly agricultural backing to our unfortunate physically and mentally handicapped  inmates, and, at the same time, to enrich the Earth, exploited and polluted at every instant.
Thank you, thank you very much.
Brother Joseph Vengasseril
Rector, Brithers of St. Joseph Cottolengo, Palluruthy, Kochi, India
A LIFELINE FOR A WHOLE COMMUNITYThis is an appeal from the Little House of Divine Providence - Cottolengo, in Kochi, Kerala (India), for assistance to develop its farm, to support the mentally and physically challenged citizens of this area. (More details here)Agricultural activity plays an essential  and very useful part in our center. Our inmates dedicate most of their time in agricultural works.  We cultivate almost 5 acres of the land with coconut, fruit trees, seasonal vegetables, etc. A dairy farm with a number of animals (cattle, pig, chicken, duck, etc) makes an integral part of our farm activity. It is clear that all these activities necessitate plenty of fresh water. But we are surrounded by salt water and we have very little availability of fresh water from the public supply system.It has become essential to erect a bore well which could provide us with sufficient quantity of water throughout the year.What we need, what you getThis well costs 400 000 Indian Rupees to dig, equivalent on a high-end scenario to 5000 Euros, or 7000 US Dollars.This is charity. Since we can't spare anything, we will thank you by painting the names of our kind donors, starting from 25 euros, on the well. If we can't make it to the amount we need, your donations will still be an addition to the final objective, hoping we can find private donations in the near future.

story:
Version en Español del video: 


Soy Nazareno, Cristiano por Iraq, ¿y tu?

Short Summary

Background

Christians and other minorities in Iraq are being persecuted, murdered, made slaves, and driven from the homes they have occupied since the early Christian communities were formed by the Apostles after the resurrection of our Lord Jesus Christ.  Throughout history, many Christians were persecuted and became martyrs as they defended their faith, laying down their lives for the love of Jesus Christ.  History is now repeating itself as the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria (“ISIS” or the “Islamic State”) is making martyrs of the descendents of early Christian communities as well as other innocent religious minorities for the only reason of not thinking exactly the same as them.  The world now watches in horror as Christian are being decapitated, crucified, women raped and made slaves, with the children also being raped and decapitated.  The Islamic State has forced more than 1.2 million Christians, Yazidis, and Shia Muslims from their homes in Iraq, under threat of death or heavy fines if they do not convert. [1] 

The international community has only started to implement a strategy to stop ISIS before their actions become genocide.  In the mean time many Christians, including Catholics, ask themselves what they can do to help those persecuted Christians brothers and sisters and other religious minorities in Iraq beyond intensifying their prayers for them.  Pope Francis has given $1 million as a personal contribution to help Christians and other religious minorities in Iraq who have been forced from their homes.[2]  Other Catholic organizations have also raised over $1 million each for the same objective[3].

Photograph source: Reuters

The Campaign

The question is then, how can common lay people of good faith throughout the world help these martyr communities in Iraq with something more than their valuable prayers?  Knowing that faith without works is dead (James 2:26), the answer is with their pocket, by contributing funds to be used for relief efforts for these communities.  But, then the next question comes up:  How can individuals contribute funds given their limited economic condition where they live and how can they send these funds to aid our Christian brothers and Sisters as well as other religious minorities in Iraq?  The answer is to contribute to the Relief Fund for Christians and Other Minorities in Iraq, with an aim to raise at least $1 million, net of fund raising fees and perk costs.

This campaign is a joint effort of La Filotea Productions, Inc., a lay Catholic organization, and two Catholic religious orders, the Order of the Most Holy Trinity and of the Captives and the Institute of the Incarnate Word.

About the Order of the Most Holy Trinity and of the Captives

The Order of the Most Holy Trinity and of the Captives is a Catholic religious order founded in the year 1198 by St. John de Matha.  The founding purpose of the Order was ransoming Christian captives and performing Works of Mercy.  The Order remains committed to help all who suffer uncommon hardships, especially those who suffer for their faith in Christ or who are poor.  For more information, please visit www.trinitarians.org.

About the Institute of the Incarnate Word

The Institute of the Incarnate Word is a clerical institute (in which religious who are not priests also form a part), whose members aspire to consecrate themselves to God by means of the profession of the evangelical counsels, making public vows, living a fraternal life in common.  The Institute is at the disposition of the Bishops to assist them in their local Churches, providing teachers for seminaries, and priests for the care of parishes and schools of various levels. The Institute of the Incarnate Word is present in all continents and has a mission in Iraq.  For more information, please visit www.verboencarnado.net.

About La Filotea Productions, Inc.

La Filotea Productions, Inc. is dedicated to evangelize through various multimedia channels, mainly in the Spanish language, and to support works of mercy.  La Filotea Productions currently produces “La Filotea – Alma Que Ama A Dios” catholic radio programming that is currently aired weekly on Radio Maria in five markets in the Americas, has an online catholic book store on Amazon (www.amazon.com/shops/lafilotea), and manages an online catholic social network at www.lafilotea.com.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise at least $1 million for this campaign, net of fund raising fees and perk expenses, and with your contributions and prayers, and those of your friends and family members, we can do it.  When we serve one of these suffering brothers and sisters of ours, we are serving our Lord Jesus Christ, as he is once again tortured and crucified in front of our eyes. Please donate!

Your tax deductible donations will be received directly by the Order of The Most Holy Trinity and of the Captives (The Trinitarians) in the USA and distributed in Iraq with the collaboration of the Institute of the Incarnate Word that has a mission in Baghdad.    Both orders are Catholic institutions.  Funds will be used to provide humanitarian aid to the most needed persecuted Christians and other religious minorities in Iraq.  Humanitarian Aid will include food, drinking water, shelter, clothing, medical aid, and other basic necessities. If we do not reach our goal, we will still send the contributions to Iraq, net of processing and perk costs, as any help is in much needed for persecuted Christians and other religious minorities. 

The Perks we are providing are designed to benefit both the souls of those that give as well as those that receive.  The perks we offer range from placing your names on the altar in a mass to be celebrated in the Latin Cathedral in Baghdad, to receiving an Olive Rosary from the Holy Land, to receiving campaign T-Shirts and Polo shirts, to prayer cards, as well as to attending Mass with the Superior of the Institute of Incarnate Word in Rome and a Semi-Private Audience with Pope Francis (pending Pope’s availability).

The Impact

The Institute of the Incarnate Word has already distributed funds to the most needed persecuted Christians and other minorities in Iraq.  Below is a quote from Father Luis Montes, pastor of the Latin Cathedral in Baghdad and a religious member of the Institute of the Incarnate Word:

“A few days ago I gave Father Amir $2000 from your donations to deliver to a refugee center in northern Iraq, where children are sheltered. This center is run by sisters (nuns) and there are 150 children every day at the center. 

Father Amir gave the funds to the sister in charge and her face lit up, saying ‘Father, you do not know how much we need this. We did not have any funds left to buy milk for tomorrow!”

Our Lord Jesus Christ tells us "And whoever gives to one of these little ones even a cup of cold water because he is a disciple, truly, I say to you, he shall not lose his reward." (Mathew 30, 11). God pays us for every good deed we do!

So in the midst of the pain from this senseless violence, we rejoice in those children who had milk thanks to you, and we are glad for you because you will not go unrewarded.

God bless you!

P. Luis Montes, IIW

Risks & Challenges

If we are successful in this campaign, it will be for the Glory of God.  If we fail, it will be for our humiliation.  In either case, it will be good for us. However, we are undertaking this campaign as we hear in our hearts the call from God to do so.  We have done our part, now it is up to our God to do His.  The work depends on us, the results depend on Him.  Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit, Amen.

We are telling the whole world that this campaign is undergoing.  We will keep in constant prayer for its success.  If we come short of our goal, we will still use the funds for humanitarian aid for the benefit of persecuted Christians and other religious minorities in Iraq.  If we exceed our goals, we will consider distributing extra funds for other persecuted brothers and sisters in Christ in Syria.  It is now all up to God. 

We will be in constant prayer for God’s Will to be done, and if it is His Will, this campaign will be successful and exceed our goal.

This campaign is dedicated to Christina, a beautiful 12 year old girl that was the first to die at the hands of ISIS during the Eucharistic Celebration (Holy Mass) in Baghdad, on October 31, 2010.

                  Christina

Photograph source: Friends of Iraq

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute funds, we ask you to please contribute with your valuable prayers for the campaign to be successful and for God’s Mercy for persecuted Christians and other religious minorities in Iraq and Syria.  We also ask you to get the word out and make some noise for this much needed campaign.  We invite you to please use the Indiegogo share tools.

You remain in our prayers and ask God to bless you.

The Order of the Most Holy Trinity and of the Captives

The Institute of the Incarnate Word

La Filotea Productions

"Amen, I say to you, whatever you did for one of these least brothers of mine, you did for me." - Mathew 25, 40.

Prayer for Persecuted Christians (from the Roman Catholic Missal)

O God, who in your inscrutable providence will that the Church be united to the sufferings of your Son, grant, we pray, to your faithful who suffer for your name’s sake a spirit of patience and charity, that they may be found true and faithful witnesses to the promises you have made.  Through our Lord Jesus Christ, your Son, who lives and reigns with you in the unity of the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.

Versión en Español:

Señor Dios, que en tu inescrutable providencia quieres asociar a tu Iglesia a la pasión de tu Hijo, concede a tus fieles que son perseguidos a causa de tu nombre, el espíritu de paciencia y caridad, para que sean hallados testigos fieles y veraces de tus promesas.  Por nuestro Señor Jesucristo, tu Hijo, que vive y reina contigo en la unidad del Espíritu Santo y es Dios por los siglos de los siglos.

Pray for us, O Holy Mother of Good Remedy, that we may deepen our dedication to thy Son, and make the world alive with His Spirit.

Versión de nuestro video en español será incluido en la sección “Gallery” durante la semana del 13 de octubre, 2014.



#iamnazarene

#soynazareno
#SaveMEChristian


[1] Source: Papal envoy: Francis donated $1 million to Iraqi refugees, CNA/EWTN, August 22, 2014

[2] Source: ibid

[3] Source: Catholic aid agencies seek funds to assist minorities in Iraq, Syria, CatholicCarrier.com, August 28, 2014

story:
Short Summary

See the video!  Our team consists of myself, Kathy McCay, a medical knowledgebase writer with a degree in social work/psychology, two physicians, an environmental biologist, and an attorney.  We care profoundly about preventing or reducing the onset of diseases that have typically been called "age-related"  -- diseases which can often be prevented.  In fact, diseases like Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, dementia, and many types of cancer have been shown to be directly related (either in onset or progression) to toxins in our food and environment, as well as stress. It appears that the word is not out! 

In case you haven't heard the argument of “wellness” vs “maintenance” – some physicians dispense medications to treat symptoms and others are into PREVENTION of disease; we fall into the latter camp.

We also know that the "baby boomer" market for affordable Continuing Care Retirement Communities (CCRCs) is huge.  Our idea was born out philanthropy, but will also cater to the financial sense of the investor who understands how unprepared the United States is for baby boomer care.  In Houston, Texas, for example, there is a 39% increase predicted in folks over 65 by the year 2030.  It's huge.

We would like to set up two programs in Houston, Texas, to boost awareness, provide services, and actually provide verifiable data to the national medical community. Both programs will become self-sustaining. One would be a  "field project" - which would be a small "country setting" continuing care retirement community of under 75 lucky folks.  These will be mostly independent living folks (before onset of disease). The second program will be an "in your home" service for folks over 55.  This service would provide meals for "boosting brain health," some custodial care, and environment helps to people in their own homes.  Both programs would employ all of our medically-substantiated wellness techniques.  They are simple techniques to remove as many toxins from our environment as possible and nurture the human body and brain.  You've probably read about  few of these items, but just like the rest of us, you are not sure what is important, or where to start, or what to recommend to your own parents.  You might also worry about “what you missed.”  Our goal is to help folks not miss anything!

As a contributor, you would be helping to set up a grass-roots facility and services that will not only help several hundred people, but you will also be helping to link  the data in a published way to medicine and research, so that wellness living facilities, services, and information will spring up in our own communities and backyards!  In the end,  we would like these  "boosting brain health" ideas to be common knowledge, based on verifiable data.  We should have good data within 5 years, and substantial data at 10 to 15 years. In the meantime, we help a lot of folks.

If we don't reach our goal, we will use initial funds to start the home-services program, and expand from there to a very small residential care facility (perhaps 11 to 20 people) where we can quantify and qualify our findings with a small control group. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We have built a professional quality business plan, before coming to crowdfunding, which details the residential care community.  It is replete with a 5-workbook Excel which tracks the entire business, depending on the numbers of residents or guests.  For this project, $700,000 is needed for downpayment to purchase a site and put up a building.  We plan to use conventional financing, and $700,000 covers the downpayment and operating cash needed the first year.
  • We are asking for $200,000 to begin the “in your home” program.  This will pay for two vans, marketing, and initial setups with vendors. 
  • Residents joining our project can do one of the two programs, whether they relocate to us, or we come to their home.  They will pay the “normal” costs associated with each, so they will be self-sustaining after initial roll-out and the first year.
  • We would like to offer the beautiful (exclusive) residential care facility – out in the country – with gardens, organic foods, organic wine, fresh air, and lots of activities – first to contributors and/or family members or friends whom you would like to submit. 
  • We will apply for grant funds as they become available.
  • We will also mention contributors in our marketing, and our published data, with our many thanks.
  • As above, if we don’t reach goal of $900,000, we will start with the “in your home” services and set up a facility as large as the funds will allow.  Our 5-workbook excel, attorney, and business plan will go to work for us, to tell us how much we can have. 

Risks & Challenges

All of the numbers on baby boomers and the need for more rooms and facilities is well published.  However, there are always risks.  These are outlined in our business plan.

  • The risks – as outlined in the business plan – involve unforeseen economic crisis that would prevent folks from moving to our “pilot” continuing care retirement community, or any facility. Not all folks can afford to move to a community, especially if there is national financial crisis. They must be cared for at home, or by family members.
  • Funding – if we are not funded, there is no chance we can move forward.
  • We are not dependent on Medicare or Obama’s Affordable Healthcare Act, because Medicare does not pay for custodial care or CCRC’s. 
  • If our marketing fails, baby boomers won't see the need for Wellness Living.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t financially contribute, could you help us by:

  • Getting the word out, and make a fuss about the ideas we are talking about.
  • Pick up the phone and reach out to anyone you know might be interested in our ideas.  We will can certainly use volunteer work, like medical oversight, grant writers, and folks to provide physical help in the programs in order to help ensure success.
  • Refer an investor to call us – someone interested in the baby boomer care market, but also in wellness living.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Short Summary 

See the video!  Our team consists of myself, Kathy
McCay, a medical knowledgebase writer with a degree in social work/psychology,
two physicians, an environmental biologist, and an attorney. 
We care profoundly about preventing or reducing the onset of diseases that have
typically been called "age-related"  -- diseases which can often
be prevented.  In fact, diseases like Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, dementia,
and many types of cancer have been shown to be directly related (either in
onset or progression) to toxins in our food and environment, as well as
stress. It appears that the word is not out! 
In case you haven't heard the argument of “wellness” vs “maintenance”
– some physicians dispense medications to treat symptoms and others are
into PREVENTION of disease; we fall into the latter camp.
We also know that the "baby boomer" market for affordable Continuing Care Retirement Communities (CCRCs) is huge.  Our idea was born out philanthropy, but will also cater to the financial sense of the investor who understands how unprepared the United States is for baby boomer care.  In Houston, Texas, for example, there is a 39% increase predicted in folks over 65 by the year 2030.  It's huge.
We would like to set up two programs
in Houston, Texas, to boost awareness, provide services, and actually
provide verifiable data to the national medical community. Both programs
will become self-sustaining. One would be a  "field project" -
which would be a small "country setting" continuing care retirement
community of under 75 lucky folks.  These
will be mostly independent living folks (before onset of disease). The second

story:
Short Summary

My husband, Ricky Adams, has been training in Martial Arts for over 40 years, teaching for more than 37. He is a kind hearted person who has taught 100's for free who needed MA training but could not afford it. Now he needs your help. He recently had a massive heart attack, but survived. However, he simply cannot pay his medical bills. Please give him your support!

What We Need & What You Get

He needs $50,000 to pay the hospital and doctors who saved his life. He is offering his instructional DVD's of his world famous karate and iaido (japanese samurai sword).  ALL funds raised will pay his medical bills. Any funds raised over our goal will pay for  children who need self defense instruction but cannot afford it.

The Impact

Your support will help the youth of central florida by enabling Ricky Adams to continue to teach children who cannot afford lessons. Ricky has always given more than he has received and wants to continue helping those children who need his help.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give, please spread the word to all your friends. He really needs your help. Please, send our link to all your online friends. He will appreciate your help forever. Thank you

story:
Whiteknights Muggle Quidditch Tournament


Our Goal

We are the Reading Rocs Quidditch team. All of our team members are students at the University of Reading. We have started this project as we intend to host England's first ever Quidditch Tournament, Whiteknights Tournament, held in Reading on the 22nd and 23rd of June. As Quidditch is a relatively new sport to the United Kingdom, we receive no funding from the Students' Union or other official bodies. As a result, we rely entirely upon donations and fund-raising to fund all of our activities.

Whiteknights Tournament will bring Quidditch teams from all over the UK together to compete over two days to be named the UK's best. Of the 20 UK teams in existence, 6 are currently signed up to attend our tournament, making Whiteknights the biggest ever held in the UK to date. For many it will be the chance to prove themselves to the country, or to settle rivalries from previous matches.

This project is particularly important to Reading Rocs as a team because this is our first opportunity to take on the best teams in the UK all together, and it gives us the chance to have Quidditch officially recognised by our Students' Union. By hosting this tournament we will gain more local recognition and experience as a team and have our chance to show that we can be one of the best teams in the UK.

What exactly is Quidditch?

Quidditch originated in the Harry Potter Books written by J.K. Rowling. The sport, as we play it, was created in 2005 at Middlebury College in Vermont. Each team is made up of 7 players on broomsticks: 3 chasers, 2 beaters, 1 keeper and 1 seeker. The chasers work together to get the Quaffle through one of three hoops at the opposite end of the pitch. The beaters throw the Bludgers at the opposing team to make them lose possession and results in the opponent having to run back to their own set of hoops. The keeper defends the hoops. The seeker is responsible for pursuing the Snitch, wherever it may go.

Quidditch is a full contact sport played with mixed teams on broomsticks. 1 Quaffle, 3 Bludgers and 1 Snitch are used during the game. The Snitch is carried by the Snitch Runner, who can run off the pitch, play tricks on the players and generally cause mayhem.

There are over 300 teams in the USA and already 20 in the UK. Quidditch is flourishing as a sport with many, both young and old, jumping at the chance to pick up a broom and play. 

The Funds Breakdown

We require funding because we receive no funds from the Students' Union. We have been fund-raising ourselves but it would be impossible for us to raise the funds needed without outside help.

We will be spending the funds on:

  • First Aid cover for the event

  • Pitch Hire

  • New equipment

  • Awards for the winners of the Tournament

 Our target is to raise a minimum of £300 but ideally we need at least £600 to have all the basics covered. Any money raised over our target will be spent on ensuring the Teams have a safe and fun time. We have already prepared the majority of the Tournament, we just need the funds to finalise everything.

Quidditch is only small at present but we hope that one day it will grow to be a recognised sport. We want to play our part to make this happen, but we need your help to get us there. Please sponsor us today!

We're really grateful for your donations and support. We'd really appreciate it if you could share our page to anyone who might be interested in helping our team.

Thank you very much,

The Reading Rocs

story:
Our Story

This website was created for my dear Friend Katie Rutko-Hunsdorf.  She is a young mom of 3 children ages, 1,3,5 and also a wife.  She has underwent 3 surgeries so far. We are hoping to earn money for her medical expenses and care not covered by insurance.  We have earned $4,000 already in just 10 days...so I know we can earn $4,000 more. within 60 days..$5 is enough if that is all you can give, $10 is enough if that is all you can give, $1 is enough..adding it up makes it work! 


The first $4,000 we earned goes for Katies radical radiaton treatments that will keep her from being sick as long as traditional radiation treatments do.  She will have more time at home with her family because of the money we earned for her.  Her sickness and downtime will be shortened! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please make sure you share this site with anybody and everybody you know.  $1 times 1,000 ppl is $1000...Post on facebook status, email the link, use the share tools provided by the website
