story:
(Desplácese hacia abajo para vea la versión en español)

The Problem

Not all doctors in Mexico undergo medical residency programs after completing medical school. As a result, in many rural areas, doctors are not always trained to properly handle some situations. Patients in need are sometimes very far from a doctor with proper training and do not have the time nor money to reach these doctors. Closing these gaps in medical education would help save more lives, especially in emergencies and during childbirth.

In the US and Canada, shifting demographics reveal that communicating in Spanish has become a necessity in many professional spheres. Nowhere is this more important than in the healthcare industry. Communicating effectively when discussing issues of health is a skill that is not just recommended, it must be emphasized continuously so that Spanish-speaking patients are not marginalized.

PACE MD

PACE MD was the first social impact organization in Mexico to address particular gaps in Mexican health care skills and services. It is staffed 100% by Mexican citizens, and has a network of hundreds of certified medical instructors. In Mexico, the PACEMD program seeks to improve medical care in areas where mortality rates are high.

PACE MD has pioneered different courses in Latin America to provide doctors improved knowledge, skills, and abilities. These include:

-  Basic and Advanced Life Support for Obstetrics courses- decreasing the maternal mortality rate in southern Mexico. 

-  Basic and Advanced Cardiovascular and Pediatric Life Support courses

-  National Association of EMT courses

-  PACE SONO Emergency Ultrasound Courses

-  Technical Conference on  Sexual Assault Nurse Examiner programs

-  International Federation of Emergency Medicine Conferences in Latin America

Building from the success of these programs, PACE MD is also developing a training academy and fostering partnerships that will give this post-doctorate model of education a greater reach throughout Mexico and Latin America. These programs seek to include, rather than exclude, as many interested parties as possible in the context of improved education for health professionals. Other programs being developed by PACE MD include Spanish language access to the MedChallenger online database, and the University of New Mexico ECHO Program.

PACE MedSpanish Program

The PACE MedSpanish Program is a language and cultural immersion program specifically designed for pre-med and medical students, nurses, paramedics, residents, physicians, emergency and general medical personnel, and any other medical professionals interacting with Spanish speaking patients.  Over the course of 1-4 weeks, students obtain cultural knowledge and skills which refine their abilities when communicating with Spanish speaking patients at home. It was founded in the state of Guanajuato (GTO), Mexico and operates in Guanajuato City (GTO), San Miguel de Allende (GTO), Oaxaca City, Oaxaca (OX), and San Cristobal de Las Casas, Chiapas (CH).

The exposure PACE MedSpanish provides students to clinics, hospitals, rural brigades, and ambulatory services almost universally sparks a greater interest in global health. The potential that these networks reach with increased exposure and commitment to impact-driven initiatives is very powerful. These Global health providers often help PACE develop new training models to apply in developing conditions.

PACE MedSpanish is unique because no other Medical Spanish program in America or Latin America offers multi-week immersion rotations in medical settings. By granting access to hospitals, clinics, and the Red Cross, this service speeds up and enhances the practitioner’s learning experience. This learning model is scalable and currently available at the four different destination points mentioned above, each with their own vibrant indigenous populations.

Impact

PACEMD

·  PACEMD was the first social impact organization in Latin America to address “chain of survival” gaps in the Mexican health care system with competency based training for providers and systems

·  By January 2014 PACE MD will have trained 15,000+ health care providers through its certification courses

·  The ALSO course alone has trained 8,000 doctors

·  Overall enrollment in ALSO has increased by 66% from 2011-13

·  We are initiating an “Obstetrical First Responder “ course for traditional midwives in Chiapas in 2014

PACE MedSpanish

·  Impacted 400+ visiting students in the states of Guanajuato, Oaxaca, and Chiapas

·  This model of immersion, gained by nurturing a bilateral training relationship with the Mexican Ministry of Health, is not offered anywhere else in the Americas

·  The MedSpanish program has been an “innovation engine” for the community based-training programs improving care to the “last kilometer of village life” in Mexico and Latin America, the first line of defense in every potential emergency.

·  Training village inhabitants of this first line of defense empowers communities to work collectively to address common health issues

We Need Your Help!

We are raising money to participate in the Agora Partnerships Accelerator Program so that our social impact business, PACE MD and its subsidiary, PACE MedSpanish can increase their impact in global health areas, especially rural areas of Mexico’s health system, and to expand the model throughout Latin America.  Agora’s mission is to accelerate the success of early-stage entrepreneurs committed to building businesses that create shared value and address critical social and environmental challenges. The Agora Accelerator is an intensive program designed to give Social Entrepreneurs like us, access to the knowledge, networks, and capital we need to succeed.  We have partnered with Agora in the hopes of imparting more knowledge, skills, abilities, and community onto health practitioners who work with Latin American patients.

Watch the Agora short video to learn more about the Accelerator Program.

Growth

We are confident that participating the Agora Accelerator will allow us to grow our business and our impact. Below is the growth we aim to achieve:

PACE MD

·  From 2011-13, revenues and enrollment for our Mexico-based certification courses increased 66%, with the sharpest increase coming between 2011-12.

·  In 2014, enrollment is expected to increase an additional 14%.

Pace MedSpanish

·  Between 2010-13, travel warnings, perceptions of pervasive crime, and swine flu concerns kept students away from the program.

·  However, the combination of an improved economy, positive perceptions towards travel within Mexico, and a retooled marketing strategy has helped us retool our program as one that will impact a greater number of students in the following year(s).

Dr. Haywood Hall

Dr. Hall and his team want to solve the problems encountered above, to provide greater medical education for health professionals in rural areas, and especially improve solutions for the health of people with Latino heritage across the Americas. The passionate deployment of these initiatives is evident in the inspired partnerships between communities and increased opportunities throughout the Americas. 

Thank You!

Thank you for your support! If you have any questions feel free to contact us at +52 415 152 7532 or send an email to info@centro-pace.org

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

El Problema

No todos los doctores en México pasan por programas de residencia médica después de que terminan la escuela de medicina. Como resultado, en muchas áreas rurales, los doctores se encuentran con escenarios para los que nunca fueron capacitados  para dar soluciones de manera efectiva. Muchas veces los pacientes se encuentran muy lejos de un doctor capacitado y no tienen ni el tiempo ni el dinero para acceder  a ellos.  Cerrar estos huecos en la educación médica ayudará a salvar más vidas, especialmente en emergencias y durante los partos.

Estadísticas  inconsistentes de los Estados Unidos y Canadá, revelan que comunicarse en español ha venido a ser una necesidad en muchas esferas profesionales. Más  en ningún lado es más importante que en la industria de la salud. Comunicarse efectivamente cuando se tratan problemas de salud es una habilidad que no es sólo recomendable sino primordial para que los pacientes de habla hispana no sean marginados.

PACE MD

PACE MD fue la primera organización de impacto social en México que se dirigió a cubrir ciertos huecos en las habilidades y servicios de la salud mexicana. Esta supervisado 100% por ciudadanos mexicanos, y tiene una red de trabajo de cientos de instructores médicos certificados. En México el programa PACE MD busca mejorar el cuidado médico en áreas donde la tasa de mortalidad es elevada.

PACE MD ha introducido cuatro cursos en América Latina para proporcionar a los doctores conocimientos, destrezas y habilidades, como:

·  ALSO Soporte vital avanzado en obstetricia

·  PALS Soporto vital pediátrico avanzado

·  BLS Soporte vital básico

·  ACLS Soporte cardiovascular avanzado

Basados en el éxito de estos programas, PACEMD también está desarrollando una academia de capacitación, reforzando a corporaciones que darán  este modelo de educación de post doctorado, un mayor alcance dentro de México y América Latina. Otros programas  buscan incluir, más que excluir, tantos participantes  como sea posible en el contexto de la mejora de  la educación para los profesionales de la salud. Otro programa  desarrollado por PACE MD incluyen acceso en español a la base de datos en línea MedChallenger, y al programa ECHO de la universidad de Nuevo México.

PACE MedSpanish Program

PACE MedSpanish es un programa de inmersión a la lengua y la cultura diseñado específicamente para pre y estudiantes de medicina, enfermeras, paramédicos, residentes, doctores, personal médico general y de emergencia, y cualquier otro profesional médico que interactúe con pacientes de habla hispana. A través los  cursos de 1 a 4 semanas, los estudiantes adquieren conocimientos y habilidades culturales que refinan sus destrezas para cuando tienen que volver a comunicarse con pacientes hispanos en su lugar de residencia. Fue fundado en el estado de Guanajuato (GTO.), México y opera en la ciudad de Guanajuato (GTO.) San Miguel de Allende, (GTO.), la ciudad de Oaxaca, (OX) y San Cristóbal de las Casas, Chiapas (CH).

Al estar en PACEMedSpanish permite  a los estudiantes acceso a clínicas, hospitales, brigadas rurales, y servicios ambulatorios interesados en la salud global. El potencial que estas redes pueden alcanzar con el compromiso de impactar iniciativas es muy poderoso.  Estos proveedores de salud pueden ayudar a PACE  a desarrollar nuevos modelos de capacitación para ser aplicados en condiciones de desarrollo.

PACEMedSpanish es único porque no hay otro programa de español médico en América y en América Latina que ofrezca una inmersión en ambientes médicos, al garantizar acceso a hospitales, clínicas y la cruz roja, este servicio acelera y mejora la experiencia de aprendizaje de los practicantes. Este modelo de aprendizaje es escalable y disponible en nuestros cuatro destinos mencionados anteriormente, cada uno con su propio carácter derivado de su población indígena.

Impacto

PACEMD

·  PACEMD fue la primera organización de impacto social en América Latina dirigida con “cadenas de supervivencia”  a cubrir espacios en el sistema de salud mexicano, con capacitación basada en competencias tanto para proveedores como sistemas.

·  Cadena de supervivencia puede ser definida como la vinculación entre cualquier comunidad y el mejor centro de salud disponible.

·  Para enero de 2014 PACEMD habrá capacitado más de 15 mil proveedores de salud a través de sus cursos de certificación.

·  El programa ALSO por sí sólo ha capacitado a 8 mil doctores.

·  La matrícula general de ALSO ha incrementado en un 66% de 2011 al 2013.

·  Hemos iniciado un curso de “primera respuesta obstetra” para parteras tradicionales en Chiapas para el 2014.

PACE MedSpanish

·  Ha impactado a más de 400 estudiantes en los estados de Guanajuato, Oaxaca y Chiapas.

·  Este modelo de inmersión, extendido al cultivar una capacitación bilateral con el ministerio mexicano de salud, es un curso que no se ofrece en ningún otro lado de América.

·  El programa de MedSpanish ha sido una “máquina innovadora” para los programas de capacitación a la comunidad, mejorando que  el cuidado llegue hasta “el último kilómetro de las villas” en México y América Latina

·  Capacitar a los habitantes de “el último kilómetro de las Villas” empodera a las comunidades a trabajar colectivamente en problemas de salud comunes.

¡Necesitamos su Ayuda!

Estamos reuniendo dinero para participar en Agora Partnerships Accelerator Program para que nuestro negocio de impacto social, PACEMD y su subsidiaria, PACEMedSpanish puedan incrementar su impacto en áreas de salud, especialmente en el sistema de salud de las  áreas rurales de México, y para expandir el modelo a través de América Latina. La misión de Agora es el de acelerar el éxito de los emprendedores, en  estadio tempranos, comprometidos  en construir negocios que creen valores compartidos y se dirijan a retos críticos sociales y ambientales. Agora Acecelerator es un programa intensivo diseñado para darle a los emprendedores sociales como nosotros acceso al conocimiento, redes de trabajo y el capital necesario para triunfar.  Nos hemos unidos a Agora con la esperanza de impartir más conocimiento, destrezas, habilidades y  comunidad a los médicos practicantes que trabajan con pacientes Latinoamericanos.

 Para aprender mas acerca de los proyectos apoyados por Agora, vea este video.

Crecimiento

Estamos convencidos que el participar en el Agora Accelerator nos permitirá hacer crecer tanto a nuestro negocio como nuestro impacto. A continuación se describe el crecimiento que buscamos alcanzar:

PACEMD

·  Del 2011 al 13 ganancias y matrícula para nuestros cursos de certificación en México aumentaron 66%, donde el mayor crecimiento se da entre el 2011 y 12.

·  En 2014 se espera que la matricula aumente un 14%

Pace MedSpanish

·  Entre el 2010 y 13, las advertencias sobre destinos, percepciones del crimen persistente, y la influenza porcina, mantuvieron a los estudiantes fuera del programa.

·  La combinación de una economía mejorada, y por ende una percepción más positiva acerca de viajar a México, nos ha ayudado a reorganizar nuestro programa de manera que sea un programa que impacte a un mayor número de estudiantes.

Dr. Haywood Hall

El Dr. Hall y su equipo quieren solucionar los problemas antes mencionados,  proveer mayor educación médica a los profesionales de la salud en áreas rurales, y especialmente mejorar las soluciones de salud de la gente con herencias Latina alrededor de América.  La correcta  organización de estas iniciativas evidentemente está inspirada en el compañerismo entre comunidades, y el incremento de oportunidades en toda la América.

¡Gracias!

Gracias por su apoyo. Si tiene más preguntas no dude en contactarnos al +52 415 152 7532 o enviar un correo electrónico a: 

info@centro-pace.org
story_txt:
(Desplácese hacia abajo para vea la versión en español)The Problem
Not all doctors in Mexico undergo
medical residency programs after completing medical school. As a result, in
many rural areas, doctors are not always trained to properly handle some
situations. Patients in need are sometimes very far from a doctor with proper
training and do not have the time nor money to reach these doctors. Closing
these gaps in medical education would help save more lives, especially in
emergencies and during childbirth.
In the US and Canada, shifting
demographics reveal that communicating in Spanish has become a necessity in
many professional spheres. Nowhere is this more important than in the
healthcare industry. Communicating effectively when discussing issues of health
is a skill that is not just recommended, it must be emphasized continuously so
that Spanish-speaking patients are not marginalized.
PACE MD

PACE MD was the first social impact
organization in Mexico to address particular gaps in Mexican health care skills
and services. It is staffed 100% by Mexican citizens, and has a network of
hundreds of certified medical instructors. In Mexico, the PACEMD program
seeks to improve medical care in areas where mortality rates are high.
PACE MD has pioneered different courses in
Latin America to provide doctors improved knowledge, skills, and abilities.
These include:
-  Basic and Advanced Life Support for Obstetrics courses- decreasing the maternal mortality rate in southern Mexico. -  Basic and Advanced Cardiovascular and Pediatric Life Support courses-  National Association of EMT courses-  PACE SONO Emergency Ultrasound Courses-  Technical Conference on  Sexual Assault Nurse Examiner programs-  International Federation of Emergency Medicine Conferences in Latin AmericaBuilding from the success of these
programs, PACE MD is also developing a training academy and fostering
partnerships that will give this post-doctorate model of education a greater
reach throughout Mexico and Latin America. These programs seek to include,
rather than exclude, as many interested parties as possible in the context of
improved education for health professionals. Other programs being developed by
PACE MD include Spanish language access to the MedChallenger online database,
and the University of New Mexico ECHO Program.
PACE MedSpanish Program
The PACE MedSpanish Program is a
language and cultural immersion program specifically designed for pre-med and
medical students, nurses, paramedics, residents, physicians, emergency and
general medical personnel, and any other medical professionals interacting with
Spanish speaking patients.  Over
the course of 1-4 weeks, students obtain cultural knowledge and skills which
refine their abilities when communicating with Spanish speaking patients at
home. It was founded in the state of Guanajuato (GTO), Mexico and operates in
Guanajuato City (GTO), San Miguel de Allende (GTO), Oaxaca City, Oaxaca (OX),
and San Cristobal de Las Casas, Chiapas (CH). 
The exposure PACE MedSpanish provides
students to clinics, hospitals, rural brigades, and ambulatory services almost
universally sparks a greater interest in global health. The potential that
these networks reach with increased exposure and commitment to impact-driven initiatives
is very powerful. These Global health providers often help PACE develop new
training models to apply in developing conditions. 
PACE MedSpanish is unique because no
other Medical Spanish program in America or Latin America offers multi-week immersion
rotations in medical settings. By granting access to hospitals,
clinics, and the Red Cross, this service speeds up and enhances the
practitioner’s learning experience. This learning model is scalable and
currently available at the four different destination points mentioned above,
each with their own vibrant indigenous populations. 





Impact
PACEMD
· 
PACEMD was the
first social impact organization in Latin America to address “chain of survival” gaps in the Mexican health care system with competency based
training for providers and systems
· 
By January 2014
PACE MD will have trained 15,000+ health care providers through its certification courses
· 
The ALSO course
alone has trained 8,000 doctors 
· 
Overall
enrollment in ALSO has increased by 66% from 2011-13
· 
We are
initiating an “Obstetrical First Responder “ course for traditional midwives in
Chiapas in 2014
PACE MedSpanish
· 
Impacted 400+
visiting students in the states of Guanajuato, Oaxaca, and Chiapas 
· 
This model of
immersion, gained by nurturing a bilateral training relationship with the
Mexican Ministry of Health, is not offered anywhere else in the Americas
· 
The MedSpanish
program has been an “innovation engine” for the community based-training
programs improving care to the “last kilometer of village life” in Mexico and
Latin America, the first line of defense in every potential emergency. 
· 
Training
village inhabitants of this first line of defense empowers communities to work
collectively to address common health issues
We Need Your Help!
We are raising money to participate
in the Agora Partnerships
Accelerator Program so that our
social impact business, PACE MD and its subsidiary, PACE MedSpanish can
increase their impact in global health areas, especially rural areas of Mexico’s
health system, and to expand the model throughout Latin America.  Agora’s mission is to accelerate the
success of early-stage entrepreneurs committed to building businesses that
create shared value and address critical social and environmental challenges.
The Agora Accelerator is an intensive program designed to give Social Entrepreneurs
like us, access to the knowledge, networks, and capital we need to succeed.  We have partnered with Agora in the
hopes of imparting more knowledge, skills, abilities, and community onto health
practitioners who work with Latin American patients. 
Watch the Agora short video to learn more about the Accelerator Program.
Growth
We are confident that participating
the Agora Accelerator will allow us to grow our business and our impact. Below
is the growth we aim to achieve:

PACE MD
· 
From 2011-13,
revenues and enrollment for our Mexico-based certification courses increased
66%, with the sharpest increase coming between 2011-12.
· 
In 2014, enrollment
is expected to increase an additional 14%. 
Pace MedSpanish
· 
Between
2010-13, travel warnings, perceptions of pervasive crime, and swine flu
concerns kept students away from the program. 
· 
However, the
combination of an improved economy, positive perceptions towards travel within
Mexico, and a retooled marketing strategy has helped us retool our program as
one that will impact a greater number of students in the following year(s). 


Dr. Haywood Hall
Dr. Hall and his team want to solve
the problems encountered above, to provide greater medical education for health
professionals in rural areas, and especially improve solutions for the health
of people with Latino heritage across the Americas. The passionate deployment
of these initiatives is evident in the inspired partnerships between
communities and increased opportunities throughout the Americas. 
Thank You!
Thank you for your support! If you
have any questions feel free to contact us at +52 415 152 7532 or send an email to info@centro-pace.org 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------El Problema
No todos los doctores en México pasan
por programas de residencia médica después de que terminan la escuela de
medicina. Como resultado, en muchas áreas rurales, los doctores se encuentran
con escenarios para los que nunca fueron capacitados  para dar soluciones de manera efectiva. Muchas veces los
pacientes se encuentran muy lejos de un doctor capacitado y no tienen ni el
tiempo ni el dinero para acceder  a
ellos.  Cerrar estos huecos en la
educación médica ayudará a salvar más vidas, especialmente en emergencias y durante
los partos.
Estadísticas  inconsistentes de los Estados Unidos y
Canadá, revelan que comunicarse en español ha venido a ser una necesidad en
muchas esferas profesionales. Más 
en ningún lado es más importante que en la industria de la salud.
Comunicarse efectivamente cuando se tratan problemas de salud es una habilidad
que no es sólo recomendable sino primordial para que los pacientes de habla
hispana no sean marginados.
PACE MD

PACE MD fue la primera organización
de impacto social en México que se dirigió a cubrir ciertos huecos en las
habilidades y servicios de la salud mexicana. Esta supervisado 100% por
ciudadanos mexicanos, y tiene una red de trabajo de cientos de instructores
médicos certificados. En México el programa PACE MD busca mejorar el cuidado
médico en áreas donde la tasa de mortalidad es elevada.
PACE MD ha introducido cuatro cursos
en América Latina para proporcionar a los doctores conocimientos, destrezas y
habilidades, como:
·  ALSO Soporte vital avanzado en obstetricia
·  PALS Soporto vital pediátrico avanzado
·  BLS Soporte vital básico
·  ACLS Soporte cardiovascular avanzado
Basados en el éxito de estos programas,
PACEMD también está desarrollando una academia de capacitación, reforzando a
corporaciones que darán  este
modelo de educación de post doctorado, un mayor alcance dentro de México y
América Latina. Otros programas  buscan
incluir, más que excluir, tantos participantes  como sea posible en el contexto de la mejora de  la educación para los profesionales de
la salud. Otro programa 
desarrollado por PACE MD incluyen acceso en español a la base de datos
en línea MedChallenger, y al programa ECHO de la universidad de Nuevo México.
PACE MedSpanish Program

PACE MedSpanish es un programa de
inmersión a la lengua y la cultura diseñado específicamente para pre y
estudiantes de medicina, enfermeras, paramédicos, residentes, doctores,
personal médico general y de emergencia, y cualquier otro profesional médico
que interactúe con pacientes de habla hispana. A través los  cursos de 1 a 4 semanas, los
estudiantes adquieren conocimientos y habilidades culturales que refinan sus
destrezas para cuando tienen que volver a comunicarse con pacientes hispanos en
su lugar de residencia. Fue fundado en el estado de Guanajuato (GTO.), México y
opera en la ciudad de Guanajuato (GTO.) San Miguel de Allende, (GTO.), la
ciudad de Oaxaca, (OX) y San Cristóbal de las Casas, Chiapas (CH).
Al estar en PACEMedSpanish
permite  a los estudiantes
acceso a clínicas, hospitales, brigadas rurales, y servicios ambulatorios
interesados en la salud global. El potencial que estas redes pueden alcanzar
con el compromiso de impactar iniciativas es muy poderoso.  Estos proveedores de salud pueden ayudar
a PACE  a desarrollar nuevos
modelos de capacitación para ser aplicados en condiciones de desarrollo.
PACEMedSpanish es único porque no hay
otro programa de español médico en América y en América Latina que ofrezca una
inmersión en ambientes médicos, al garantizar acceso a hospitales, clínicas y
la cruz roja, este servicio acelera y mejora la experiencia de aprendizaje de
los practicantes. Este modelo de aprendizaje es escalable y disponible en
nuestros cuatro destinos mencionados anteriormente, cada uno con su propio
carácter derivado de su población indígena.
Impacto
PACEMD

·  PACEMD fue la primera organización de impacto social en América
Latina dirigida con “cadenas de supervivencia”  a cubrir espacios

para proveedores como sistemas.

·  El programa ALSO por sí sólo ha capacitado a 8 mil doctores.
·  La matrícula general de ALSO ha incrementado en un 66% de 2011 al
2013.
·  Hemos iniciado un curso de “primera respuesta obstetra” para
parteras tradicionales en Chiapas para el 2014.
PACE MedSpanish

·  Ha impactado a más de 400 estudiantes en los estados de
Guanajuato, Oaxaca y Chiapas.
·  Este modelo de inmersión, extendido al cultivar una capacitación
bilateral con el ministerio mexicano de salud, es un curso que no se ofrece en
ningún otro lado de América. 
·  El programa de MedSpanish ha sido una “máquina innovadora” para
los programas de capacitación a la comunidad, mejorando que  el cuidado llegue hasta “el último
kilómetro de las villas” en México y América Latina
·  Capacitar a los habitantes de “el último kilómetro de las Villas”
empodera a las comunidades a trabajar colectivamente en problemas de salud
comunes.
¡Necesitamos su Ayuda!
Estamos reuniendo dinero para
participar en Agora Partnerships Accelerator Program
para que nuestro negocio de impacto social, PACEMD y su subsidiaria, PACEMedSpanish
puedan incrementar su impacto en áreas de salud, especialmente en el sistema de
salud de las  áreas rurales de
México, y para expandir el modelo a través de América Latina. La misión de
Agora es el de acelerar el éxito de los emprendedores, en  estadio tempranos, comprometidos  en construir negocios que creen valores
compartidos y se dirijan a retos críticos sociales y ambientales. Agora Acecelerator
es un programa intensivo diseñado para darle a los emprendedores sociales como
nosotros acceso al conocimiento, redes de trabajo y el capital necesario para
triunfar.  Nos hemos unidos a Agora
con la esperanza de impartir más conocimiento, destrezas, habilidades y  comunidad a los médicos practicantes
que trabajan con pacientes Latinoamericanos.
 Para aprender mas acerca de los proyectos apoyados por Agora,
vea este video.
Crecimiento

Estamos convencidos que el participar
en el Agora Accelerator nos permitirá hacer crecer tanto a nuestro negocio como
nuestro impacto. A continuación se describe el crecimiento que buscamos
alcanzar: 
PACEMD

·  Del 2011 al 13 ganancias y matrícula para nuestros cursos de
certificación en México aumentaron 66%, donde el mayor crecimiento se da entre
el 2011 y 12.
·  En 2014 se espera que la matricula aumente un 14%
Pace MedSpanish

·  Entre el 2010 y 13, las advertencias sobre destinos, percepciones
del crimen persistente, y la influenza porcina, mantuvieron a los estudiantes
fuera del programa.
·  La combinación de una economía mejorada, y por ende una percepción
más positiva acerca de viajar a México, nos ha ayudado a reorganizar nuestro
programa de manera que sea un programa que impacte a un mayor número de
estudiantes. 
Dr. Haywood Hall

El Dr. Hall y su equipo quieren
solucionar los problemas antes mencionados,  proveer mayor educación médica a los profesionales de la
salud en áreas rurales, y especialmente mejorar las soluciones de salud de la
gente con herencias Latina alrededor de América.  La correcta 
organización de estas iniciativas evidentemente está inspirada en el
compañerismo entre comunidades, y el incremento de oportunidades en toda la
América.

story:
Gravlet incorporates the efforts of a team of physicists and engineers who execute theoretical and experimental research in the sphere of gravitation. Our basic idea is to come closer to the nature of gravity, as well as to develop experimental methods which are simulating gravitational effects, thus providing us the ability to construct a gravitational engine.

The engine is based on the idea that gravitation and electricity are closely related which gives us the ability to generate gravitational-waves by using properly constructed electrical devices.

Gravitational engine by Gravlet, white model.

“An enterprising band of physicists and designers is about to launch an IndieGoGo campaign for research and experimentation to develop a product sci-fi fans and futurists have been eagerly awaiting for decades: an antigravity engine.”

– CNN iReporter

“The next big thing in engines might be on its way. If all goes well, it’ll be clean, cheap, efficient, and have the coolest, most futuristic name of any engine yet. It’s called Gravlet, and it’s an anti-gravity propulsion engine.”

– ChipChick

      


Research in the sphere of gravitation will provide a clear idea on what the nature of gravitation is, and how we can control and use it. A similar type of a technology can give us the opportunity to construct devices and vehicles which work with electricity, and do not use liquid fuels. This technology will not emit harmful gases into the atmosphere and will, as a result, be ecological.

The focus of the research program is:

  • to do experimental research;
  • to construct a gravitational engine.

The scope of this research program is named Gravlet, and because it represents the starting stage we just call it Gravlet Beta.

The Gravlet project aims to spread more light onto this type of research, and to make it well known. Crowdfunded by enthusiasts and people all around the world will aid in getting this project off the ground. This is a pioneering project that will accelerate the adoption of new technologies and drive them into the mainstream market.

Engine models by Gravlet.


 Gravitational waves
An engine based on antigravity technology will use electrical energy in order to polarize the vacuum which surrounds it, and it will generate gravitational waves to be used as a driving force.

It consumes electrical energy
For the generation of the driving force the antigravity engine will use electrical energy.

Ecological
The antigravity engine will not emit harmful gases into the atmosphere.

Applicable
The antigravity technology can have a wide application for the construction of new machines and vehicles.

This is a summary comparison between Gravlet’s engine and other kinds of current technologies.

  Gravlet Gasoline vehicles Electric vehicles Flying machines
Environmentally friendly YES NO YES NO
Emissions NO YES NO YES
Consumes liquid fuel NO YES NO YES
Powered with electricity YES NO YES NO
Aircraft YES NO NO YES
The engine requires a special shield YES NO YES YES

A short comparison of antigravity technology with other types of technologies.


The basic idea behind the technology is that the gravitational interaction originates from the Maxwell's equations which, on the other side, describe the electro-magnetic interaction as well as a huge number of physical effects.

"The Generalization of Classical Electrodynamics" (in english, size: 114 KB) written by Koen van J. Vlaenderen, and "The Generalization of Classical Electrodynamics" by Alexander Tomilin offer a new model according to which the classical electrodynamics (this section of physics based on the Maxwell's equations) is incomplete and it needs re-examination.

They show that apart from the electric and the magnetic field in the Maxwell's equations there is also a third one termed by Koen as the Scalar field.

Scalar field definition

Our supposition is that every atom is a source of this scalar field, the magnitude of which decreases according to the inverse-square law. In other words, the more we are drifting away from the atom the weaker the scalar field becomes. This effect is very weak for the scales of a single atom, and hardly detectable, but if we have several million of them, or a big enough quantity, this effect will become stronger, and will be correspondingly noticeable and easier to measure. Ask yourself the question: how many atoms does the Earth consist of? The answer is: About 1.33 multiplied by 10 with 50 zeros behind it. And this is how this number looks:

133,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000

Also, according to the force law describing how the scalar field interacts with the "surrounding world", the behaviour of this interaction is similar to the behaviour of gravity.

According to the equation expressing the Scalar field, the generation of such a kind of field is possible under certain conditions, and one of them is to generate high voltages with high frequencies. Imagine 1 million volts (1,000,000 volts) vibrating with the frequency of 1 gigahertz (1,000,000 Hz)...which is a lot!

And to express how difficult it is to generate and work with 1 million volts, we have to note that the standard Mains electricity powering our homes varies from 110 to 240 volts (depending on the country), which is approximately 4000 times less compared to 1 million volts. Also, the frequency of the Mains electricity system is about 50 - 60 Hz, which is 20,000 times less compared to 1 gigahertz.

Here we have displayed a short comparison between the different systems using electricity with a system which satisfies the conditions to generate observable gravitational effects.

From this basic comparison it's obvious that there are not so many electrical systems around the world (if there are any at all) which are able to produce observable gravitational field, and also that the construction of such a type of system requires special research and experimental work.

Cycle of Gravlet engine operation.

We've been through a long creative process, from the theoretical research, writing the theoretical model, to sketching and engineering of the setups required for our experimental work.

All we need now is you!

Mind map which is describing the plan of Gravlet in the future

Sketches

You can check our perks on the top of this page. Here are some of them:

Bumper stickers

Gravlet's Hat

Coffee Mug

T-shirt / White model

T-shirt / Black model

iPhone 4/4S/5/5S Case

You can be of great help if you become part of our community and share your ideas related to our gravity research. Visit Gravlet's room for ideas.

Contest

There is a contest which gives a prize to any fan that refers the most amount of funders to the campaign, or that helps to raise the most amount of contributions.

How to do that?

If you have IndieGoGo account and you're logged in:

  • Use the social buttons on the top of the page to share the campaign through your social media networks.
  • Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
  • Send a direct email from Indiegogo.

If you don't have IndieGoGo account:

  • After your contribution you will be presented with a special URL (on the completed contribution landing page, under "Spread the word!") that you can copy and share with your network.


Don't forget to like and follow us for the latest information on Gravlet!

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/gravlet
Send us a tweet: @gravlet
Like us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/groups/Gravlet-6530252
Email Gravlet at: info@gravlet.com

We’ve a detailed financing plan for all expenses in the project. For better understanding we've visualized this in a graphic.

The graphic also contains a schedule which displays the processes distributed in chronological order in time.

Quite a reasonable question is why the campaign uses Flexible Funding. The reason is that even if we don't reach the crowdfunding target, in that case we will use the raised money to fund the theoretical work of the project.

We are prepared with a tight budget plan (see above). Take into account that there are no percentages and schedule because they depend on the raised money.

Pavel Tashev, Founder / Engineer physicist
Manager of Gravlet and an engineer physicist in the team.
pavel.tashev@gravlet.com

Bozhil Zhelev, Technical drawer
Bozhil Zhelev is an electrical engineer and technical drawer. He has excellent knowledge with the following instruments - AutoCAD, SolidWorks and others.
bozhil.zhelev@gravlet.com

Konstantin Nikolov, Product designer
Product designer at Gravlet.
bg.linkedin.com

The team of Gravlet is a group of engineers and physicians who have been united around the idea to implement theoretical and experimental activities in the field of gravity.

Gravlet was born at the end of 2013 with a theoretical concept about gravitation as a physical phenomenon. Today we’re working on the theory and the future experiments which are behind the scene. We need your support to bring this idea to life. Here is what we have planed to do in the upcoming months:

We are undertaking something that requires special research and experimental work, especially if we consider that high voltages and high frequencies are required. This is a quite big challenge and we’re dedicated to bringing it a step closer to reality.

It is going to be a journey. We’ve set such a high crowdfunding target for a good reason. From the computer simulations, the real physical tests, to the construction of a stable prototype, the costs are huge.

If you’ve backed us, you’ll be kept right up to date.

  1. General questions
  2. Technical questions
  3. Other questions

General questions

What is the present mission of the Team?

Currently our team is focused on the implementation of experimental activity in the field of gravity, as well as the development of an anti-gravitational device. 

The experimental work requires huge efforts which mean that our focus and actions will be totally focused in this direction.

The inspiration of the team?

The knowledge for the gravitational and anti-gravitational technology will open a new chapter in the way in which society advances. Human-kind can invent new types of communication systems based on gravity. We can live in a more ecological way without polluting the environment. Imagine how deep into space we could go with such a type of anti-gravitation technology. We will face a new world. The inspiration is obvious; we will study and discover the universe with one more step!

And of course this is not something which will happen tomorrow (let us be realists), but imagine how one day this will be reality.

What are the challenges?

Hard work.

I'd like to be informed about the development process of Gravlet?

Information about the progress of the project will be published on the web site (www.gravlet.com), but much more detailed information will be presented only to the supporters of Gravlet. For more information look at our perks.

Stay tuned through the social networks listed below.

If I have further questions where can I contact Gravlet?

You can reach us at info@gravlet.com.

Technical questions

What is the anti-gravity technology about?

In order to be able to read more about the idea behind the Gravlet work you should go to the following page: Technology.

More details are to be published later.

There are many pictures on the website depicting a certain device. What is this?

The device which is shown on most of the pictures is a model of an antigravity engine. The energy source is not represented on them.

What are the advantages of the antigravity technology?

The advantages of the antigravity technology are:

  • ecological, because it will not emit harmful gases in the atmosphere
  • requires electrical energy
  • applicable for different devices and vehicles
What are the disadvantages of this technology? Are they easy to overcome?

A disadvantage of the antigravity technology is that a device based on it would emit electromagnetic radiation around itself. This can be overcome through the usage of protection around the engine which has been constructed especially for this goal.

This is not a real problem. You would not place a metal spoon in a microwave oven or your own hand in an electrical oven, neither should you violate the protection of a similar engine. This is all about technical safety.

Other questions

What if my question isn’t answered here?

We’re happy to respond to any other queries you might have about the Gravlet, the Indiegogo campaign, and our company as a whole. Email us at info@gravlet.com

Go to the Top
story_txt:
Gravlet incorporates the efforts of a team of physicists and engineers who execute theoretical and experimental research in the sphere of gravitation. Our basic idea is to come closer to the nature of gravity, as well as to develop experimental methods which are simulating gravitational effects, thus providing us the ability to construct a gravitational engine.
The engine is based on the idea that gravitation and electricity are closely related which gives us the ability to generate gravitational-waves by using properly constructed electrical devices.

Gravitational engine by Gravlet, white model.


“An enterprising band of physicists and designers is about to launch an IndieGoGo campaign for research and experimentation to develop a product sci-fi fans and futurists have been eagerly awaiting for decades: an antigravity engine.”
– CNN iReporter


“The next big thing in engines might be on its way. If all goes well, it’ll be clean, cheap, efficient, and have the coolest, most futuristic name of any engine yet. It’s called Gravlet, and it’s an anti-gravity propulsion engine.”
– ChipChick


       


Research in the sphere of gravitation will provide a clear idea on what the nature of gravitation is, and how we can control and use it. A similar type of a technology can give us the opportunity to construct devices and vehicles which work with electricity, and do not use liquid fuels. This technology will not emit harmful gases into the atmosphere and will, as a result, be ecological.
The focus of the research program is:

to do experimental research;
to construct a gravitational engine.

The scope of this research program is named Gravlet, and because it represents the starting stage we just call it Gravlet Beta.
The Gravlet project aims to spread more light onto this type of research, and to make it well known. Crowdfunded by enthusiasts and people all around the world will aid in getting this project off the ground. This is a pioneering project that will accelerate the adoption of new technologies and drive them into the mainstream market.





Engine models by Gravlet.







Gravitational wavesAn engine based on antigravity technology will use electrical energy in order to polarize the vacuum which surrounds it, and it will generate gravitational waves to be used as a driving force.




It consumes electrical energyFor the generation of the driving force the antigravity engine will use electrical energy.




EcologicalThe antigravity engine will not emit harmful gases into the atmosphere.




ApplicableThe antigravity technology can have a wide application for the construction of new machines and vehicles.

This is a summary comparison between Gravlet’s engine and other kinds of current technologies.


 
Gravlet
Gasoline vehicles
Electric vehicles
Flying machines



Environmentally friendly
YES
NO

NO

The engine requires a special shield
YES

YES


A short comparison of antigravity technology with other types of technologies.

The basic idea behind the technology is that the gravitational interaction originates from the Maxwell's equations which, on the other side, describe the electro-magnetic interaction as well as a huge number of physical effects.
"The Generalization of Classical Electrodynamics" (in english, size: 114 KB) written by Koen van J. Vlaenderen, and "The Generalization of Classical Electrodynamics" by Alexander Tomilin offer a new model according to which the classical electrodynamics (this section of physics based on the Maxwell's equations) is incomplete and it needs re-examination.
They show that apart from the electric and the magnetic field in the Maxwell's equations there is also a third one termed by Koen as the Scalar field.

Scalar field definition
Our supposition is that every atom is a source of this scalar field, the magnitude of which decreases according to the inverse-square law. In other words, the more we are drifting away from the atom the weaker the scalar field becomes. This effect is very weak for the scales of a single atom, and hardly detectable, but if we have several million of them, or a big enough quantity, this effect will become stronger, and will be correspondingly noticeable and easier to measure. Ask yourself the question: how many atoms does the Earth consist of? The answer is: About 1.33 multiplied by 10 with 50 zeros behind it. And this is how this number looks:
133,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000
Also, according to the force law describing how the scalar field interacts with the "surrounding world", the behaviour of this interaction is similar to the behaviour of gravity.
According to the equation expressing the Scalar field, the generation of such a kind of field is possible under certain conditions, and one of them is to generate high voltages with high frequencies. Imagine 1 million volts (1,000,000 volts) vibrating with the frequency of 1 gigahertz (1,000,000 Hz)...which is a lot!And to express how difficult it is to generate and work with 1 million volts, we have to note that the standard Mains electricity powering our homes varies from 110 to 240 volts (depending on the country), which is approximately 4000 times less compared to 1 million volts. Also, the frequency of the Mains electricity system is about 50 - 60 Hz, which is 20,000 times less compared to 1 gigahertz.
Here we have displayed a short comparison between the different systems using electricity with a system which satisfies the conditions to generate observable gravitational effects.
From this basic comparison it's obvious that there are not so many electrical systems around the world (if there are any at all) which are able to produce observable gravitational field, and also that the construction of such a type of system requires special research and experimental work.

Cycle of Gravlet engine operation.

We've been through a long creative process, from the theoretical research, writing the theoretical model, to sketching and engineering of the setups required for our experimental work.
All we need now is you!


Mind map which is describing the plan of Gravlet in the future





Sketches

You can check our perks on the top of this page. Here are some of them:Bumper stickersGravlet's HatCoffee MugT-shirt / White modelT-shirt / Black modeliPhone 4/4S/5/5S CaseYou can be of great help if you become part of our community and share your ideas related to our gravity research. Visit Gravlet's room for ideas.Contest There is a contest which gives a prize to any fan that refers the most amount of funders to the campaign, or that helps to raise the most amount of contributions.
How to do that?

If you have IndieGoGo account and you're logged in:

Use the social buttons on the top of the page to share the campaign through your social media networks.
Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
Send a direct email from Indiegogo.


If you don't have IndieGoGo account:

After your contribution you will be presented with a special URL (on the completed contribution landing page, under "Spread the word!") that you can copy and share with your network.
Don't forget to like and follow us for the latest information on Gravlet!

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/gravlet

Send us a tweet: @gravlet

Like us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/groups/Gravlet-6530252

Email Gravlet at: info@gravlet.com


We’ve a detailed financing plan for all expenses in the project. For better understanding we've visualized this in a graphic.

The graphic also contains a schedule which displays the processes distributed in chronological order in time.
Quite a reasonable question is why the campaign uses Flexible Funding. The reason is that even if we don't reach the crowdfunding target, in that case we will use the raised money to fund the theoretical work of the project.

We are prepared with a tight budget plan (see above). Take into account that there are no percentages and schedule because they depend on the raised money.


Pavel Tashev, Founder / Engineer physicistManager of Gravlet and an engineer physicist in the team.pavel.tashev@gravlet.com


Bozhil Zhelev, Technical drawerBozhil Zhelev is an electrical engineer and technical drawer. He has excellent knowledge with the following instruments - AutoCAD, SolidWorks and others.bozhil.zhelev@gravlet.com



Konstantin Nikolov, Product designerProduct designer at Gravlet.bg.linkedin.com

Gravlet was born at the end of 2013 with a theoretical concept about gravitation as a physical phenomenon. Today we’re working on the theory and the future experiments which are behind the scene. We need your support to bring this idea to life. Here is what we have planed to do in the upcoming months:


We are undertaking something that requires special research and experimental work, especially if we consider that high voltages and high frequencies are required. This is a quite big challenge and we’re dedicated to bringing it a step closer to reality.
It is going to be a journey. We’ve set such a high crowdfunding target for a good reason. From the computer simulations, the real physical tests, to the construction of a stable prototype, the costs are huge.

story:
Our Story & The Impact

My name is Angel.  My mom is a hard working bartending at a bar in my town and the economy hasn’t been good to us. We have been living without water for several months due to leaking pipes that the rental people refuse to fix. It has caused a lot of strain in our everyday life. My mom has been contemplating suicide due to this because nobody can help. My grandmother, bless her heart, gives us jugs of water to help us do daily activities. She also lets us shower at her house.  We don’t want to keep burdening her with our problems as she is in her 70’s.


What We Need and What You Get

We are a low-income family and I have been seeing the campaigns at IndieGoGo and I seriously think this is a last resort to avoid eviction. I have a mental illness and having no water is seriously affecting my mental health. On behalf of my family, I ask for $2,000. This is to cover the water bill that caused the water to get turned off and to help pay to get the pipes fixed. I don’t want to ask for more. We are looking out to the community of the Internet to donate a much as they can.

 

I don’t have a lot but each donator will get a hand written or typed thank you letter from myself. It’s not much but it would come from my heart. You can donate as little as a dollar. Every bit counts.

 

Thank you and God Bless.

 

-Angel

story:
Our names are Alicia and Breanne. Rita is our mom and we would like to share her story with you. 

Anybody who knows her would describe her as one of the most generous, nurturing and loving people they know.  With a smile on her face and a positive outlook on any position, she is always the first person to accept any responsibility and finds great joy in taking care of others. 

The story that follows, is how the table turns and now she needs us to take care of her. 

On Nov.2, 2012, our mom at the young and active age of 58, was getting ready to take her dog, Nelly, for a quick walk in the cool air of Vista, CA. The next moment would change her life forever. She fell from the top of her staircase inside her home down to the first floor.

She was rushed to the Trauma unit in the ER.  After hours of x-rays, CAT scans and MRI's we got the news that she had broken her neck and severed part of her spinal cord. The doctor's prognosis was she will have little to no feeling or movement from the neck down and she may never walk again.

Once enough swelling went down, she had her c1,c2,c3 vertebrae fused and bone from her hip used to help support parts of her spine that were very fragile. She is now stable enough to have Physical Therapy 5 days per week and is living in an acute physical therapy center that specializes in traumatic brain and spinal cord injuries. She has around the clock care from nurses and doctors that shower her, feed her and do all the little things we all take for granted. It is very important that she gets the best therapy and care right now to make sure the living cells don't die.

She has been making progress that the doctors told her she would never have, and we are believing for a full recovery.   We are very excited to report that today she is able to move her arms and hands, and even wiggle her feet! She has gotten a little feeling back in her feet and parts of her hands and fingers. We know its a long road ahead, but she will be better than she was. She has said that she knows whatever comes of this, she knows she was put here for a reason and maybe its to help others who aren't handling it so well. Rita's personal goal is to be at Isabelle's (her granddaughter) first birthday in Arizona and to hold her two granddaughters again.

Her best friend and soul mate, Tommy, has been by her side every moment since her accident. He continues her physical therapy when the therapists are done for the day. 

Since she is unable to hold a pen, Tommy has been taking care of all the many insurance documents and various forms that are needed to continue this long process. His love for her is transparent and we are so blessed and thankful he is a part of her and our lives to be there when we cannot.

On Dec. 31, 2012 Rita was let go from her position at work and her insurance was cut off from that point.  Tommy is having to move and sell off all their personal belongings since they are in a live/work property to be closer to her. He is trying to get a job driving a cab, as well as pick up side jobs to pay for a place to live close to our mom and help pay expenses.

We have tried to transfer her to Arizona, where we are, so Tommy would stay with us while caring for her during the days, but she is not stable enough for the trip. When the time comes,  for her to be in Arizona, insurance will not pay for her transportation or to convert their van into a wheelchair accessible vehicle. 

There are a few pieces of medical equipment she needs to get around and be somewhat independent that insurance will not pay for so we are hoping with everyones help and small or large donations we can help our mom get the equipment she needs. 

PLEASE help us make sure she continues to get the best treatment and that an insurance bill is the last of her worries! We know not everyone can contribute with monetary donations, but you can repost and share this with your friends, family and co-workers. Facebook and Twitter are both great ways you can help Rita.

 

We love all of you for listening and may God bless you always!

story:
Although our friend John beat hepatitis C by getting a liver transplant, he still faces a common and grave hepatitis C side effect -- periodontal disease.

Periodontal disease is an illness of the gums that produces inflammatory bacteria that can make its way into the bloodstream. Typical results include heart attack, stroke and respiratory disease.

John needs quick medical attention; he has no health insurance.

John is also a survivor of Hodgkin's lymphoma. The expenses of treatment of hepatitis C and Hodgkin's have drained his finances, and he is getting by on Social Security.

As a group of friends who want to spare John any more major medical problems, we are trying to raise $5,500 to pay for his treatment.
story_txt:

Periodontal disease is an illness of the gums that produces inflammatory bacteria that can make its way into the bloodstream. Typical results include heart attack, stroke and respiratory disease.
John needs quick medical attention; he has no health insurance.
John is also a survivor of Hodgkin's lymphoma. The expenses of treatment of hepatitis C and Hodgkin's have drained his finances, and he is getting by on Social Security.

story:
Brooke has Chronic Lyme Disease.

For 5 years Brooke has been suffering different illnesses and issues that were not being diagnosed properly, which is common for people who suffer from Chronic Lyme.

Last year Brooke received a diagnosis of Lyme disease after she asked to have the test for Lyme ran on her.  The disease continues to progress due to lack of treatment at this current time, basically the whole 5 years.

Insurance does not cover most of the cost of the proper tests and treatments that have proven to be helpful for Lyme patients. These tests and treatments are very expensive.

There are only a handful of doctors in the State of California that are Lyme literate

This disease has affected every area of her life.  It is multi systemic especially the central nervous system.

The disease is in the chronic stage and needs to have aggressive treatment right away.

Your donation will help Brooke to work with a Lyme Literate doctor to start a course of treatment that will not be covered by insurance. 

The treatment is an ongoing process.  The treatment is a combination of homeopathic and antibiotics as well as numerous visits to the doctor prescribing the treatments.

Your generous donation will help get Brooke this much needed treatment and give us our Brookey back!

 

Here are some links for you to click on for more information regarding Lyme Disease:

Movie: Under our Skin 

California Lyme Disease website

 Youtube video of Dr. Phil show from April 13, 2012 - Deadly Consequences

(paypal account will come up under the name Theresa Martin, which is also Terri Notz-Martin)  Funds will be distributed to Brooke's doctor, pharmacist, and other care providers as needed.  Thank you for your contribution.

story:
Short Summary

  • QuikTherm: QuikTherm is a wearable, reliable, hassle free temperature measurement and monitoring. Its a non contact thermometer which can be used for both kids and adults. Wearable headband makes it comfortable for continuous monitoring.

Key Features

  • Fast, just takes 4 seconds to read out temperature
  • Audio Visual indicators for change in fever condition
  • Pediatric and adult use
  • Adjustable headband for comfort fit [One size doesn't fit all ;)]
  • Battery operated (Upto 500 measurements can be taken)
  • USB rechargeable
  • Low Battery Indication
  • Single or continuous use modes
  • Historical data with trend plots
  • Robust construction to withstand shocks and knocks

Progress So Far

  • Custom Hardware - Complete
  • Firmware - Complete
  • Prototype - Complete
  • Industrial Design - ongoing
  • System Validation - ongoing

Funding Required

  • We have got so far on grit, spit and duct tape :)).
  • We need your help to raise 20,000 USD to complete industrial design and system validation
  • QuikTherm will revolutionize the way fever is managed
  • With QuikTherm around you no longer lose sleep over your child's fever
  • QuikTherm will monitor while you sleep!!!
  • We hope to raise the requisite funds to enable us to go to market quicker. If we don't achieve our funding target we will be delayed but not out!!!

Impact

  • Hassle free temperature monitoring of kids and adults alike
  • No more sleepless nights worrying about near and dear ones
  • Fit and forget fever management
  • Yethi Medical Systems first product,"Multi-parameter Patient Monitor" is already successfully launched in the market.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=htMXsj9A6L8

FAQ

1. Is it safe for Kids?
A. Absolutely safe for kids. It is non contact based and does not have
mercury based measurement. There are no moving parts or sharp edges
that can hurt the person.

2. Will the thermometer generate heat when used continuously?
A. No, the entire product is a low power design and does not
emit any RF or heat energy.

3. Will it be uncomfortable to wear for longer duration?
A. Not really. The thermometer comes with a comfortable headband with
adjustable straps for securing the device on the forehead. The headband
also has moisture wicking capability to absorb the sweat to some extent.

4. Can it be worn while sleeping?
A. Yes, the thermometer is designed to be worn while sleeping or during
normal day-to-day activities. The headband with adjustable straps allows
the wearer to change the size of the band to suit his comfort.

5. Will wearing the headband thermometer obstruct the view of the wearer?
A. No, the thermometer is placed on the forehead of the wearer and secured
with adjustable straps of the headband. This ensures comfortable fit and
prevents the thermometer from moving around and possibly obstructing the
wearer's vision.

6. How long can the thermometer monitor the temperature continuously?
A. On a full charge of the built-in battery, the thermometer can
monitor temperature continuously for 12 hours.
The thermometer also generates ALERTs whenever there is a change in
the fever characteristics (high, under control, normal temperature).

7. How accurate is the temperature reading?
A. The temperature reading is accurate to +/ 0.2 Fahrenheit.

8. How fast is the thermometer in taking readings?
A. It takes about 5 seconds to get a temperature reading.

9. Should the thermometer be always used with a headband?
A. Not really. The thermometer can be used just like any other
regular thermometer by holding it on the forehead for few seconds
until a readout occurs. Please make sure the device is placed above
the right eyebrow or left eyebrow for accurate readings.

10. Where should the thermometer be positioned on the forehead?
A. The thermometer should be placed above the right eyebrow or
the left eyebrow.

11. How can i charge the built-in battery of the thermometer?
A. The thermometer can be charged via the USB port provided
on the device using the supplied USB charging cable. Plug the
cable into a standard USB port of a PC/laptop for charging the device.
On full charge it gives continuous monitoring of about 12 hours.

12. Can it be used for adults?
A. Absolutely. This can be used for people of all ages.

13. Can I alternate between degree Celcius and Farhenheit?
A. Yes. The mode button on the front panel, allows the user to switch between displaying temperature in C/F. In addition there is a special mode to display “Fever Trend” of the past few 8 hours as a simple line graph.

About Us

  • Yethi Medical Systems Pvt Ltd (Yethimed) was started in 2010 to build affordable medical products, systems and services as an engineering innovation.
  •  We firmly believe that investor interests and mass social benefits can go hand in hand by using technology as an enabler of convergence
  •  Over the last 3 years we have put together a in-house talent team in the areas of embedded system development (hardware & firmware),  C#, Java based end user application design and development,  Android Application design and development,  Product Industrial Design
  •  Overall the team has 75+ years of combined product engineering experience
     Yethimed also has an excellent vendor eco-system for augmenting core strengths and complementing non-core areas
  •  To know more visit www.yethimed.com

Products Developed So Far

  • Multi-parameter Patient Monitor: The device can measure NIBP, SPO2, ECG, Temperature and Weight. All the measurement data is uploaded to a server and managed remotely. Yethimed designed and developed custom hardware, firmware, Android application, PC Application and Web Application. Casing industrial design was also done by Yethimed. Clinical trials are completed and we are currently we are in pilot production. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=htMXsj9A6L8

Projects Executed So Far

  • eBill  : Yethimed designed and developed custom hardware, firmware, custom jpos printer, Android application and PHP based server software
  • LASIK Surgery Device: Yethimed was involved in design and development of custom hardware, firmware and Qt application (on uBuntu platform)

Key Features


Fast,
just takes 4 seconds to read out temperature

Audio
Visual indicators for change in fever condition

Pediatric and
adult use
Adjustable headband for comfort fit [One size doesn't fit all ;)]

Battery operated (Upto 500 measurements can be taken)

USB rechargeable

Low Battery Indication
Single or continuous use modes
Historical data with trend plots
Robust construction to withstand shocks and knocks


Progress So Far
Custom Hardware - Complete
Firmware - Complete
Prototype - Complete
Industrial Design - ongoing
System Validation - ongoing
Funding Required

We have got so far on grit, spit and duct tape :)). 
We need your help to raise 20,000 USD to complete industrial design and system validation 
QuikTherm will revolutionize the way fever is managed 
With QuikTherm around you no longer lose sleep over your child's fever
QuikTherm will monitor while you sleep!!! 
We hope to raise the requisite funds to enable us to go to market quicker. If we don't achieve our funding target we will be delayed but not out!!!

Hassle free temperature monitoring of kids and adults alike
No more sleepless nights worrying about near and dear ones
Fit and forget fever management

story:
Short Summary

Preemies * Anastasia’s Gift is a 40-page inspirational and informative guide for parents of preemie babies, accompanied by music that can be played for the baby. It began as one mother’s gift to parents of premature infants, and as a tribute to her daughter, Anastasia. Patti Bose’s dream was to introduce parents to this new, unfamiliar world through her own personal experience, soothing words, music, and soft photographs. It is what she wished she had had when she was going through the experience. Endorsed by some of the most respected individuals in the field, this book is a comforting resource for anyone going through this challenging time as a parent.

Current and Future Formats

Preemies * Anastasia's Gift is currently available as an e-book in both Apple iBooks and Amazon Kindle formats.  Patti is seeking additional funding to produce two additional versions:

  • A commemorative hardcover book featuring photo holders, journaling pages, and milestone records.
  • An interactive iPad app that will enable parents to document and share their baby's progress through photos, videos, journaling, e-newsletters, chat boards, and more.

The Impact

"Preemies * Anastasia’s Gift offers a different perspective of life for a preemie and his/her family in the NICU. It addresses the emotional aspect of a very difficult time in any parent’s life like no other book in this field has before. It is as heart-warming as it is informative."

Eduardo J. Lugo, M.D.
Medical Director, Newborn Intensive Care Unit
Florida Children’s Hospital, Orlando, Fl.


"My dream was to introduce this new, unfamiliar world with soothing words and soft photographs. Through my personal experience, I hope to touch people with wisdom and support. Preemies was written with love and founded in this simple truth: 'The world asks of us only the strength we have. And we give it.'"

Patricia K. Bose
Author and photographer, Santa Fe, NM

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Like us on Facebook
  • Join our mailing list

story:
**Are the features still coming?**

YES! THEY WERE DELIVERED!   Please continue to donate and share the word about Timeriffic. We appreciate your support.

 

**Can I still contribute?**

YES! Send your donations via PayPal to rdrr.labs [at] gmail [dot] com. Or click the button. We have a few extra Limited Collector's Edition postcards and Cute Android Robots or Create Your Own Theme. See more at http://rdrrlabs.com/donate

 

What is Timeriffic?

You ❤ Android. We do too. But there are times such as school and work and when you are asleep Android doesn’t need to make noise or deplete your battery. That’s why there’s Timeriffic.

 

Timeriffic is a free and ad-free app that has been installed nearly half a million times by users all over the world. We invite you to try it today. Click to download. Android users ❤ Timeriffic. 


Click to download.

 

 

Why this campaign? 

The most requested features for Timeriffic are: 

  • Back-up/Restore - Save time and make switching to a new device easy. 
  • Data Sync Toggle - Save money and battery by controlling when accounts sync (Google Accounts, Facebook, Etc)

We need your support to develop them. At this point you are saying to yourself either. 

 “I use Timeriffic everyday. It’s one of the best apps I own, how can I help?”

or 

“I am an Android user who likes Indiegogo, show me the rewards.”

Before we get to the rewards...How is it going? 

We already have the lab rolling with not one but two pots of coffee. We are reviewing early builds and things look great! (Interested in helping do a little quality testing? Join our Lab Assistant program.) 

We have our safety glasses on and the code is cooking away. This is a short way of saying these features are important to us and we can’t wait to make them for everyone. 

The lab’s whiteboard is full of inspiration from our user’s who tweet and facebook and google+ us reguarly. 

What are the rewards? 

Indiegogo makes it super easy to help the lab. RDRR.Labs is making it a fun time to be a part of the Timeriffic community. Choose a level and click on it to become a backer. 

From Einstein to Themes to a cool Android Robot and even a chance to have a private Google Video Chat there are some great options for our global users and fans. Every reward tier builds on the tier before. - This means you get everything in your tier and the previous tiers. 

Tier Descriptions 

$1 - Thanks for the support - web, tweet and of course the two new features.

$5 - Limited Collector's Edition Einstein Postcard (worldwide shipping included) 

$15 - Indiegogo Exclusive - All 5 Donation Themes unlocked allows users to skin Timeriffic with any of the fun science lab themes. (a $25 value)

 $25 - Back-up is important in technology, and to support our new back-up feature backers will get a cool Android robot micro sd card reader. A great back-up tool. 

$35 - Limited Collector's Edition Einstein T-Shirt - American Apparel Shirt

$85 - Your name will be in the app for the world to see. 

$250 - Your name will be on Timeriffic’s listing in the Google Play store. 

 

$600 - A 60 min Google Video Chat with both the Timeriffic lead developer and lead designer. Talk about Android, mobile, Timeriffic. It’s your time.

 $1300 - Each of the five donation themes could use a name and we’ll use yours! What an exciting way to be a part of Timeriffic.

 

$5000 - Create your own theme for the world to see. We’ll work with you to design a custom theme for Timeriffic. This new theme will be available to every user of Timeriffic and part of the donation themes. This will be a back and forth effort and you will be fully credited and share your creation with the world. No art skills required. Get a peek behind the curtain. 

Every reward tier builds on the tier before. - This means you get everything in your tier and the previous tiers.

 

Timeriffic Backstory 

A mobile developer excited for the new Android platform, decided to program a “no interface” app just for himself. He put the free app on the then called Google Market where there weren’t many apps at launch. Thousands of miles away a mobile designer who at the time was able to watch each app released in real time because there weren’t that many, found this little app. It was a device timer. It could control the device in a few different ways. The mobile designer emailed the mobile developer with some enthusiastic feedback that could make the app better. The developer thought, “Sure it could, but how?” So he challenged the designer. 

What he got back was the outline for Timeriffic an app that was a mobile timer to save battery life and mute the phone when needed and the developer was inspired. Starting casually the two worked together improving the interface and features along with improving stability. It started to pay off, the star rating began to rise along with the usage. 

In 2010 Google named rdrr.labs a Top Android Developer based on download numbers and a 4+ star rating. It was about this time Timeriffic began to get help from around the world translating the app which is available in English, French, Spanish, Chinese, Czech, Danish, German, Hungarian, Italian, Hebrew, Korean and Norwegian with more to come. 

In 2011 we were asked if our app could be used at Google’s Developer Conference known as Google I/O. It was flattering and certainly a highlight of the year. We also launched rdrrlabs.com, began our Lab Assistants program, twitter account @rdrrlabs and Google+ . 

In 2012 we continued our international appeal with a review by two of the mobile heavyweights in LG Mobile Chile and Samsung Italia along with reviews from around the world both video and on the web. We also joined Facebook. 

Since our lab opened we have maintained a policy to answer EVERY single email, helpdesk, feature request, compliment and donation with a personal reply. It is the core of who we are and users love it. 

We have some great quotes about how users love Timeriffic, in many languages. Timeriffic was even suggested to the pilot of the Mars Rover Curiosity. It has helped many couples get sleep filled nights, saved from beeps and chirps of email and texts. People in general love the set it and forget it nature, because it just works. But the best story of all time is still from a mom who bought an Android phone for her daughter just for our app.

 

We are using Teelaunch to fulfill and print, so things will happen fast and professional for all our supporters.

story:
Mar 2, 2015 LAUNCH 2015: One Drop Wins “Best Design” Award

Apr 21, 2015 TechCrunch: Razorfish’s Jeff Dachis Launches One Drop, An App For Diabetics To Log And Share Info With Each Other

Apr 22, 2015 Washington Post: How the data revolution could transform the way people live with diabetes

Jun 4, 2015 TechCrunch: Diabetes Management App One Drop Gets $8 Million In Series A Funding To Build Out The Platform

Dec 15, 2015 Yahoo! Finance: Internet pioneer now taking on diabetes

Mar 1, 2016 Inc: A Digital Shot in the Arm for Disease Management

Mar 8, 2016 One Drop Featured in “Best New apps” on iTunes App Store

Mar 6, 2016 LAUNCH 2016: One Drop Wins "Best Alumni Update” Award

Mar 21, 2016 Fast Company: Apple CareKit Lets Patients And Researchers Team Up To Help Each Other

Apr 28, 2016 Time: Apple’s Plan To Turn the iPhone Into a Medical Wonder Starts Now

May 12, 2016 Motley Fool: Apple Moves a Step Closer to Revolutionizing Healthcare


FAQ


How long will these Early Access opportunities be available?

This Indiegogo Campaign provides exclusive early access opportunities to subscribe to One Drop Premium. These opportunities will be available for only 30 days from the date this campaign launched (July 25, 2016).

What is One Drop Premium?

One Drop Premium is a monthly subscription service that includes the following:

  • One Drop Premium Meter, Lancing Device, Test Strips, and Black Vegan-Leather Carrying Case
  • Unlimited Test Strips: based on your usage, we will provide you all the blood glucose test strips you need, delivered monthly to your door
  • One Drop Experts: 24/7 in-app diabetes coaching support from a Certified Diabetes Educator (CDE)

How accurate is the One Drop Premium Meter?

The One Drop Meter and One Drop Test Strips have been designed to meet or exceed all FDA and CE requirements. 

Has the One Drop Meter been submitted to the FDA yet?

Yes. The One Drop Meter and testing supplies were submitted to the FDA in July 2016. We cannot be sure if/when we will receive FDA approval, but given our understanding of the process, we anticipate a timely review and will address any concerns as they arise.

How many test strips come with the One Drop Chrome?

Every One Drop Chrome comes with 100 One Drop Test Strips.

How does "Unlimited Test Strips" work?

With One Drop Premium, you'll get unlimited blood glucose test strips delivered to your door based on your usage and how often you are logging in the One Drop app.  Need more? Just let us know and we'll ship direct to your door.

What is One Drop Experts?

One Drop Experts an in-app diabetes support, education, and digital therapeutics program. Certified Diabetes Educators (CDEs) are available 24/7 to offer real-time support, advice, and answers to all of your questions. 

When will I receive One Drop Premium?

We plan to begin shipping throughout the US in November 2016 and internationally in March 2017, pending FDA and country-specific approvals.

When will One Drop for Android be available?

We plan to release One Drop for Android in September 2016.

Will the basic One Drop app that I currently use and love continue to be free?

Of course. The basic One Drop app will always be free. If One Drop Premium isn’t for you, we want you to keep using One Drop to manage your diabetes, just like you always have. Upgrade to premium when you think it's right for you.

How do I reach the One Drop team? 

Just email us at support@onedrop.today

I'm having trouble contributing on Indiegogo. Who do I contact?

Just email support@indiegogo.com
