story:
Short Summary

This is a family effort to help David, a 46 year old father, son, brother, uncle & friend, purchase an accessible van so that he can enjoy his life, despite MS, to the fullest. 

David was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis at the very young age of 25 and swiftly went from healthy young man and father of two little boys, to disabled and in a wheelchair.  Before his now 22 year old son was 3 feet tall, he had learned to transfer dad from bed to chair and back again… and today David spends all of his waking hours in a heavy 500 lb motorized wheelchair so that he can be comfortable and mobile for his caregivers.  He cannot operate the chair, but it’s his way around the world these days.  David needs assistance to do everything except smile that big kind smile he shares with everyone.   

Our family has rallied throughout the years to help Dave live a better life, including raising money for a stem cell transplant when it was still an experimental option for MS.  We’ve pulled together to turn a small unaccommodating house into a place he could live with family and be independent of the facility he’d been living in, and most times when David has a need, we find a way to accommodate him.  This time we need help from you….  

Currently David gets around town riding in the back of a big oversized cargo type van, with his chair strapped to the floor.  Going over a small bump in the road about gives him a whiplash!  The van is no longer reliable transportation so Dave can’t travel far from home, and we live in a beautiful place in Southern Oregon, so there’s lots he would like to see.  It has an old style type lift that wasn’t designed for his heavy wheelchair, and the mechanics of it are no longer supported by the local hydraulic specialist, not to mention that it’s frightening to get him in and out of the van…. There is only one person in Dave’s life (a loyal caregiver) who is able to make this mode of transportation work for him.  It’s time to move into this century and help Dave get a different van.

The vans we are looking at aren’t new, but are a huge improvement over his current transportation.  Importantly, it will allow David to sit up front in the passenger space in his own chair.  He hasn’t seen the world from the front seat of a car for years! 

We need cash contributions to make this dream a reality, but we understand that not everyone can help in that way.  Other ways you can help are….

  • Link this campaign to your facebook
  • Send Davey’s campaign to your email friends

If you make a contribution to Davey’s campaign, we’ll send you a picture of that big Davey smile;  you’ll feel the appreciation when you see his face.

Thank you so much for reading this story…..  Dave’s family & friends.
story_txt:
Short Summary
This is a family effort to help David, a 46 year old father, son, brother, uncle & friend, purchase an accessible van so that he can enjoy his life, despite MS, to the fullest. 
David was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis at the very young age of 25 and swiftly went from healthy young man and father of two little boys, to disabled and in a wheelchair.  Before his now 22 year old son was 3 feet tall, he had learned to transfer dad from bed to chair and back again… and today David spends all of his waking hours in a heavy 500 lb motorized wheelchair so that he can be comfortable and mobile for his caregivers.  He cannot operate the chair, but it’s his way around the world these days.  David needs assistance to do everything except smile that big kind smile he shares with everyone.   
Our family has rallied throughout the years to help Dave live a better life, including raising money for a stem cell transplant when it was still an experimental option for MS.  We’ve pulled together to turn a small unaccommodating house into a place he could live with family and be independent of the facility he’d been living in, and most times when David has a need, we find a way to accommodate him.  This time we need help from you….  
Currently David gets around town riding in the back of a big oversized cargo type van, with his chair strapped to the floor.  Going over a small bump in the road about gives him a whiplash!  The van is no longer reliable transportation so Dave can’t travel far from home, and we live in a beautiful place in Southern Oregon, so there’s lots he would like to see.  It has an old style type lift that wasn’t designed for his heavy wheelchair, and the mechanics of it are no longer supported by the local hydraulic specialist, not to mention that it’s frightening to get him in and out of the van…. There is only one person in Dave’s life (a loyal caregiver) who is able to make this mode of transportation work for him.  It’s time to move into this century and help Dave get a different van.
The vans we are looking at aren’t new, but are a huge improvement over his current transportation.  Importantly, it will allow David to sit up front in the passenger space in his own chair.  He hasn’t seen the world from the front seat of a car for years! 
We need cash contributions to make this dream a reality, but we understand that not everyone can help in that way.  Other ways you can help are….

Link this campaign to your facebook
Send Davey’s campaign to your email friends

If you make a contribution to Davey’s campaign, we’ll send you a picture of that big Davey smile;  you’ll feel the appreciation when you see his face.
Thank you so much for reading this story…..  Dave’s family & friends.

story:
Let's Help Bekr

My name is George. My wife and I have been together for 7 years. We were childhood friends. She went her way, I went mine... only to meet up again 20 years later. We were meant to be.
 
About Bekr
 
She is very open about mental health/illness and wishes to help others. She runs a blog about mental health/bipolar disorder and helps so many people on a daily basis and asks for nothing in return. She has always been a kind giving soul, and would do anything for anyone. She is always smiling no matter how terrible she feels. Ready and willing to help others, while she is having a difficult time herself. She is unable to work because of her condition.
 
This campaign is for my wife, Bekr. She has been hospilalized against her will many times due to suicide attempts and other hospilizations due to her mental health. Her well-being is extremely important to me and our family. The medical expenses have added up and we have tried to get them covered by insurance, but they have been rejected. She has tried countless times to get funds and this "situation" under control, only to be turned away time and time again, causing more undue stress on her already fragile state of mind.
 
Every little donation can add up to help at least put a dent in these medical bills. Which would help my wife very much with her stress and her daily life. Decreasing these bills or completely paying them off would be such a grand gesture for my wife. It would lift a heavy burden that has befallen upon her. Helping her overall wellness and sense of being.
 
Where will my money go?
 
These medical expenses have added up to over $30,000. Anything we get from here will go toward those bills. While, yes, it would be nice to get that amount, we realize that is unrealistic. So we are setting the goal of $5000, which is plenty. Anything we make over that (if we do) then that would be fantastic. Again, any and all of the funds would be put toward these medical bills.
 
Perks
 
My wife loves taking photos and creates little cards with sayings on them. So with donations we will be able offer some tokens of gratitude.

The Impact

My wife is hoping to start a Non-Profit Foundation helping those with mental disorders. To help pay for medical expenses already accrued and to help others that need care. A place to turn to when people need it the most. To be the voice for those that can't open or speak up. With this stress out of the way, she will be ready to get this started and hopefully make a real difference in others lives. She has a big heart and wishes to put it to good use.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, we understand, but please share this link with your friends, be it by e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit, etc.

story:
Arkadiusz Pisarkiewicz, the Polish champion of traditional karate needs help.He has been suffering from M.S (Multiple Sclerosis) for the past 12 years.

When he was young,Arek dreamt of being like his idol,Bruce Lee.In 1993,he obtained gold in Karate Shotokan .Two years later he went on the first United Nations mission to Yugoslavia.He wrote on his website:"There I saw the harm people did to each other".

A few months later ,he was diagnosed with this terrible disease.His distraught parents tried to get drugs and treatment.The drugs were bought from their own savings for the first 6 months.The monthly cost was 8000 zloty.This was an incredible amount for someone who was receiving 700 zlotych invalidity benefit.

Finally,he was lucky enough to get onto a treatment program,which only lasted 2 years.This period was funded by the polish health system.

As soon as the treatment was stopped ,the disease got worse.Arek wanted to fight the M.S but the polish health system took away not only the drugs, but hope too.

"I will do everything I can to live" is written on his website:www.arkadiuszpisarkiewicz.za.pl

I am begging you for mercy, but it hurts me to do so"

Today he has been left without any treatment and drugs,only the rehabilitation has continued.

At the moment ,Arek isn't able to sit or speak.He suffers from terrible stiffness of the whole body and constant tiredness.During feeding ,he chokes and suffocates.

The only way of saving his life at this stage is a stem cell transplant.

He has to raise 37,000 U.S. dollars.

We are begging people for help.

story:
It has a variety of convenient functions. The most important function out of these is the one that notifies the guardian if the medicine has not been taken. I made it to aid my wife whom becomes critically endangered if she does not take her medicine every day.

Experience the various functions of MediAlarm such as medicine alarm, guardian alarm, medicine consumption report and amazing portability. Choose the smart medicine container MediAlarm for the health of yourself or a person you wish to take care of.

 

 

Notify your guardian when you have missed your alarm by the smart medicine container or become a guardian to check on your loved ones. There are no limits to the number of registrable guardians or devices.

Set the time you wish to take your medicine. The alarm rings from your mobile phone and medicine container every time and can be delayed by 30 minutes when difficult to consume immediately.

Do you know your own consumption pattern, whether you take your medicine on time, slightly late or often not at all? MediAlarm provides a consumption report. Now manage and check your consumption in one go.

MediAlarmS is only 84g. The size is also compatible for pockets and thus very easy to carry around. It is easy to hang on a bag with the ring on the case.

The medicine compartments in MediAlarmS is replaceable. Fill the excess medicine compartments with medicine and conveniently replace them every day.

 

  1.  Purchase your own smart medicine container MediAlarm
  2.  Connect the MediAlarm to the battery
  3.  Search MediAlarm Global at the App store
  4.  Connect to Bluetooth
  5.  Fill out medicine information and consumption time in the application
  6.  When it becomes time, the phone and medicine container will ring
  7.  Consumption can be checked on the medicine container or using the mobile phone
  8.  If the medicine is not consumed after the second alarm 30 minutes later, an alarm is sent to the registered guardian

* The overseas users have to use 'MediAlarm S Global', not 'MediAlarm S'

This is the normal medicine container…

▶ Clear medicine compartment : Easy to become discolored in the sunlight

▶ Not smart : Does not notify the user when it becomes time to take medicine

▶ Easy to forget : Does not notify the guardian

▶ Easy broken medicine compartment : The medicine container is not sturdy

▶ Impact : It is easy for the medicine to shake and crack.

 

  • MediAlarm comes in a total of 4 colors pink, purple, blue and green.
  • We will shipping items in April.

 

Support … 5$

  • Please support us!
  • With your support, we can build a PSS that is a personalized platform.

  MediAlarmS 1ea … 35$ (28% off)

+ International Shipping $10

  • It is composed of one MediAlarmS.
  • A $10 international shipping fee is required by all regions except South Korea.

MediAlarmS + MediAlarmLite … $45(33% off)

+ International Shipping $10

  • It is composed of a MediAlarmS and a MediAlarmLite.
  • A $10 international shipping fee is required by all regions except South Korea.

MediAlarmS 2ea … 60$ (38% off)

+ International Shipping $10

  • It is composed of two MediAlarmS.
  • A $10 international shipping fee is required by all regions except South Korea.

MediAlarm 4ea … $120 (38% 0ff)

+ Free Shipping

  • It is composed of all 4 colors available by MediAlarmS.
  • Free International Shipping!

 

If you are wonder as to what product the MediAlarm Lite is?

▶Click this link to know

 

 

Shipping

 MediAlarm S demo video
MediAlarm S is complete product, we will go on Mass production in March to start shippng!
 

2018.02

Launch the campaign

2018.03

Mass production

2018.04

Shipping

 

Contact US

▶ioteencs@ioteen.com

▶Official Page

▶+82-32-225-1156

story:
For over a decade, HoopsStrength Personal Training has used basketball skills and performance training to help hundreds of young men and women gain physical strength and mental confidence. 

During this time, we have been fortunate to have had temporary locations at a local high school, as well as two local colleges.  As we have grown, the idea of having our own physical location has been the ultimate dream.  

We have already secured a new 16,000 square foot facility, which will be opening its doors in Spring of 2020.  While we are financing most of this en devour through our own funds, we are looking to raise some capital to be sure that when we launch, it is truly a one of a kind basketball training experience.  This will include our strength and performance workouts, basketball skill work and the incorporation of cutting edge technology never before seen in Western NY.       

Although HoopsStrength has a proven success model, we are looking at HoopsStrength 2020 as a total reboot.  We not only want to have a great physical location loaded with cutting edge tech, but we also wish to revamp our systems to be clean and streamlined.  This is going to take a lot of time, some extended education and extra money.

If you are unable to help financially at the moment, please keep in mind that HoopsStrength is looking to increase our involvement in the Rochester region.  Please follow us on Facebook and/or Instagram for updates on our future plans!

The support and buzz around town since our announcement has been extremely humbling.  In short, we are extremely excited that our community is extremely excited!  The new HoopsStrength facility will no doubt service hundreds of players for years to come.  The bottom line is that we have, do and will,  have an impact on our youth.  We truly appreciate the support of our friends, family and the believers of HoopsStrength!

story:
Overview

√ Great for Coffee, Tea, Juice, Smoothies, Protein Shakes & More
√ Maintains Freshness & Prevents Oxidation 
√ Keep Temperatures For 24 Hours
√ Fully-Automatic Vacuum Sealing
√ Digital Temperature & Pressure Monitor
√ Dishwasher-Safe

 

Production Started

After finishing the trail-production and testing, we are now moving to the next stage - MASS PRODUCTION. Can't wait to share this exciting news with you all. By starting it now, we are able to START THE SHIPMENT FROM THE SECOND WEEK OF NOV!

 


MEET YICOLY

 

YICOLY is the world's first auto vacuum sealed bottle that keeps your drinks fresher, longer. Its patented one-touch vacuum technology combined with the thermal insulation design ensures your smoothies and juices last all day and tastes just as fresh as the first sip. It's perfect for your daily routine no matter where need to be.

A Review From Netherlands Health Coach

 

 

 

Freshly Made Drinks
Tend to GO BAD Quickly


Homemade juice is a more convenient, affordable and delicious way to boost your fruit and vegetable intake. But keeping homemade juice and smoothie fresh while on-the-go is still a common challenge. When fruits and vegetables are exposed to air, they start to oxidize, turning them brown and depleting them of their nutrients.

 

 

 

YICOLY

Seals in Freshness


YICOLY slows down the oxidation process by removing air/oxygen from the bottle. The lid of the bottle is integrated with an electronic vacuum pump that acts as a preserver by removing the air from the bottle and maintaining a tight seal.

Vacuum-sealed juice tastes so much better. It holds its moisture and flavor, whether you are making your juice, smoothie or any other drink with you, you will get an all-day freshness.

 

We filmed a timelapse over the course of 3 days. The results speak for themselves.

 

 

Effective Decompression


YICOLY's patented deep vacuum removes all of the air and creates a tight seal that is only broken with you open the valve - ensuring your food stays fresher - longer.

YICOLY will remove all the air from the body. Unlike the marshmallows, your fruits will not get any bigger – but its preservation period will extend 5x longer.


 

 

Keep Your Drink

The Temperature You Want


Hate when you make your coffee and its cold by the time you get to work? Lukewarm coffee? Never again! 

Featuring double-walled (stainless steel/glass) construction and vacuum insulation technology, YICOLY will keep your drink cold for up to 24 hours and hot for up to 12 hours.

 

 

 

PERFECT
For All Drinks

 

Thanks to the vacuum sealing tech and the thermal insulated design, YICOLY is perfect for any kind of drink. It holds its moisture and flavor while keeping your drink the temperature you want, and it tastes just as fresh as the first sip. It's perfect for juice, smoothie, coffee, milkshake, protein shake, tea, and etc.

 


 

 

Intelligent Readings
At a Glance


The water bottle features an integrated OLED display. On this miniature screen, you'll always be able to see whether if the content of your bottle is hot, warm, or cold. The next time you bring along a hot drink to your office or on a hike, you can confidently take a sip. 

 

 

 

 

 

Easy to Open

 

The water bottle top stops sucking the air out while you are ready to drink. This makes the cap easier to be taken off. No worry that air pressure will push the lid and won’t let you open. 

 

 

 

No Handwashing Necessary

 

The detachable rubber strap allows for easy removal and easy cleaning. The body is composed of 316 stainless steel & 100% BPA-Free materials that do not retain odors.

And we get it. Once you have used your great bottle, you want to clean it. You can do so by hand, or just pop it in the dishwasher! YICOLY allows you to put it in the dishwasher, the lid can be easily washed by hand.

 

 

It's Very Easy to Use

 

YICOLY comes with a very easy-to-use design. The single button on the lid triggers all the functions you need. A single press will switch between display screens (pressure/temperature/battery), and a double press will start or stop the vacuum pump. 

 

 

 

Take it Wherever You Go


Want to take cold water with you on a hike? Want to keep your juice fresh at the gym? Want to bring your friend some piping hot soup? YICOLY makes it possible.

 

 

 

Reduces Wastes & Pollutions

We believe that healthier living starts with vacuum-sealing our freshly made juice — and creating a better way to manage your daily fruit and vegetable intake. Also, it reduces your spends on bottle-drinks and reduces wastes on food. In other words, it saves time, money and helps maintain the nutrients in your freshly made foods.

 

The use of plastic has become integral to our lives. In the juice world, it has become a quick and easy way to store juice and keep it edible for longer. Although it is convenient and comfortable, it is incredibly harmful to the environment.

 

The perfect height, the perfect capacity. And there are two capacity - 450ml (stainless steel) and 500ml (glass) and three colors (black/white/lucid) for choice. Meet your daily drinking needs, drink as healthy as you can!

 

 

 

 

Here are our main staffs

We are YICOLY team, who are passionate about juicing, health, fitness, and design. YICOLY was started with a simple vision where innovative technology can be combined with inspirational design to help people access healthy drinking easily and sustainably. We are trying our best to redefines the juice drinking field with our humble forces. We have been working on this project for over a year to design, create and test to ensure this product is perfect to preserve juice and smoothies. Now, we are finally ready to share our product to the world. Please kindly support our product, we will be handing your YICOLY Fresh-Drinking Bottle to you without any delay (mass production ongoing).

Never again! Featuring double-walled (stainless steel/glass) construction and vacuum insulation technology, YICOLY will keep your drink cold for up to 24 hours and hot for up to 12 hours.   PERFECTFor All Drinks Thanks to the vacuum sealing tech and the thermal insulated design, YICOLY is perfect for any kind of drink. It holds its moisture and flavor while keeping your drink the temperature you want, and it tastes just as fresh as the first sip. It's perfect for juice, smoothie, coffee, milkshake, protein shake, tea, and etc.   Intelligent ReadingsAt a GlanceThe water bottle features an integrated OLED display. On this miniature screen, you'll always be able to see whether if the content of your bottle is hot, warm, or cold. The next time you bring along a hot drink to your office or on a hike, you can confidently take a sip.      Easy to Open The water bottle top stops sucking the air out while you are ready to drink. This makes the cap easier to be taken off. No worry that air pressure will push the lid and won’t let you open.    No Handwashing Necessary The detachable rubber strap allows for easy removal and easy cleaning. The body is composed of 316 stainless steel & 100% BPA-Free materials that do not retain odors.And we get it. Once you have used your great bottle, you want to clean it. You can do so by hand, or just pop it in the dishwasher! YICOLY allows you to put it in the dishwasher, the lid can be easily washed by hand.  It's Very Easy to Use YICOLY comes with a very easy-to-use design. The single button on the lid triggers all the functions you need. A single press will switch between display screens (pressure/temperature/battery), and a double press will start or stop the vacuum pump.    Take it Wherever You GoWant to take cold water with you on a hike? Want to keep your juice fresh at the gym? Want to bring your friend some piping hot soup? YICOLY makes it possible.   Reduces Wastes & PollutionsWe believe that healthier living starts with vacuum-sealing our freshly made juice — and creating a better way to manage your daily fruit and vegetable intake. Also, it reduces your spends on bottle-drinks and reduces wastes on food. In other words, it saves time, money and helps maintain the nutrients in your freshly made foods. The use of plastic has become integral to our lives. In the juice world, it has become a quick and easy way to store juice and keep it edible for longer. Although it is convenient and comfortable, it is incredibly harmful to the environment. The perfect height, the perfect capacity. And there are two capacity - 450ml (stainless steel) and 500ml (glass) and three colors (black/white/lucid) for choice. Meet your daily drinking needs, drink as healthy as you can!    Here are our main staffsWe are YICOLY team, who are passionate about juicing, health, fitness, and design. YICOLY was started with a simple vision where innovative technology can be combined with inspirational design to help people access healthy drinking easily and sustainably. We are trying our best to redefines the juice drinking field with our humble forces. We have been working on this project for over a year to design, create and test to ensure this product is perfect to preserve juice and smoothies. Now, we are finally ready to share our product to the world. Please kindly support our product, we will be handing your YICOLY Fresh-Drinking Bottle to you without any delay (mass production ongoing).

story:
Background

What happened to my feet?  I was born with a congenital birth defect, called bilateral syndactyly.  You can see a picture at the very top of this page.

I had corrective surgery when I was 4-5 years old to narrow my feet enough to wear shoes.  I was in bed for several weeks, as my feet had to be elevated the entire time to assist in keeping the swelling down from all the bones they broke/cut/gnawed on.  I can distinctly remember the struggle experienced learning to walk a second time, and my mom cutting the toe portion off a pair of my dads socks to slide the "tube" over my knees to pad them so I could crawl around when I was regaining mobility. I was young and had been pinned down for too long, with a ton of pent up kid energy.  When I started crawling, I would do so until my knees were bleeding, thus the sock invention.  I remember my dad coming home from work, and looking down at me crawling -- just giving a warm smile, glad to have me home.  But it could have been that I looked just a little odd, as well.  I remember a trip to Disneyland after that surgery, where my father and older brother took turns putting me on their shoulders because I still couldn't walk well enough.

I used to have a good paying job at Microsoft, but had to consider alternate employment as my job function wasn't one that can be readily "accommodated" and the torque on my feet was just too much after several years.  So I dumped my savings into books and tuition to go back to school.

My school is pressuring me to go on disability to help offset some recent and planned medical costs, but I simply refuse.  It's part of who I am as an individual not to throw in the towel.  Instead, I chose to take out student loans and continue my independence.  Take that! Administration office.  But a big thank you to Behin in the Financial Aid office for helping to push my loans through the system.

Living with a Disability

I am thankful that I can walk, but most activities, like running or other sports are out of the question because they create great torque on my feet that is quite painful which crawls up my legs to about my knees, and lasts for a few days.

Shopping for shoes is a challenge, because my feet are two different sizes and require finding a size 4.5-5 for my right foot and a 5.5-6 for the left.  Since the stores don't allow a mix and match in sizes, I have to buy two pairs each time.  Because my feet are so small, I often end up buying shoes from the kids section.  Finding two sets of shoes that match is often difficult.  Last year, I ended up with shoes that had lights in the heel, what a conversation piece those were.  But strangely enough, with my personality, I can pull off wearing something that bizarre.  I still have the shoes.  The big drawback here though, is cost.  Shoes x2 plus an orthotic insert in each.

I was teased in school (as were a lot of kids), and was often told I had "Ton Ton" feet (think Star Wars movies).  They had two toes and so do I.

And as can be expected, I pay more than the average Joe in medical bills.

Avoiding Trouble

I learned early on that I needed to keep active.  Keeping muscle tone in my legs and ankles allows me to retain a lot of mobility and reduces episodes of pain.  As a result, I try to walk around the campus where I go to college rather than take the Disability Support Program's offer of shuttle rides from class to class.  I rode the tram once, but I felt awkward -- almost like I should give the guy a gratuity when he dropped me off.

Besides walking, I also see benefit in cycling with equal results in terms of my mobility, there are health benefits to biking, like cardio vascular conditioning.  I've heard many people tell me they can't ride for this reason or that...  all I can say to them -- If I can do it, you can too.

Making Progress

I used to ride a 2-wheeled bike.  But as the years progress, it has become difficult to go even 5 miles without being sore for several days.  In order to keep excess pressure off my feet, I would hold a lot of my weight on my hands & arms.  That is, until they couldn't sustain, then my feet take the brunt of the weight plus pressure pedaling.  The usual result is that I'm hurting for 3-4 days.  So I decided to locate a recumbent trike.   Yep, I'm not too proud to tool around on a tricycle.

The seating position puts all my weight on my back and rear, where it should be -- and if my feet start to get sore, I can just stop and rest.  No need to stand around or find a place to sit.  I contacted a local bike shop that had a used recumbent with cambered rear wheels (so I'm less apt to tip over and get hurt), and explained my situation.  Upon visiting the shop, the salesman made some adjustments to the bike and off I went.  I was fortunate that he sold me the bike for roughly half of the cost of a new one.  But it was still a whopping $1000.

But there is one problem.  Recumbent bikes weigh a lot more than a regular bike, and when I first tried it, I had a lot of difficulty riding over a pedestrian overpass.  I had to stop a few times going over, and was rather humiliated when I was passed by joggers.

I called the bike shop back, and he put me in contact with a specialty shop about twenty minutes away.  The plan is to put a motorized hub on the bike, and a lithium-polymer battery.  This will allow me to use motor assist to get up over the pedestrian walkways, and yet allow me to work my leg muscles too.

Electrification is the Solution

But one thing I have learned, getting a setup that will allow me to ride the bike in the manner I desire, is very expensive – simply more than I can afford while I'm going to school.  I'm getting some assistance from the provider of the electric setup, but overall I'm going to be set back about $3000.  This will get closer to $4000 if I get a hitch & rack for the recumbent to put on my car and be able to take it to other bike trails.  It's near 84" long, so putting it in my car won't work.

I can try to make the conversion a little more affordable by using SLA (sealed lead acid) batteries, but they are heavy -- a whopping 36lbs each! So it seems a bit counter to my goal to make the bike even heavier, ultimately reducing the amount of exercise I get on my lower extremities, because I'll need to use the motor assist more to offset the added weight.  The entire lithium-polymer battery pack is a mere 8lbs.  But the cost of this battery is $600-1000 depending on the mileage capacity.  With the added costs of a controller, motor, throttle, wiring and the work involved, it's going to go way beyond making my credit card scream for mercy.

Community

So I'm asking for my fellow online community members for some generosity to help get me back outside this summer.  Everyone's life is a story, and my bike will have a story of its own thanks to you.

My request includes (since I already bought the bike for $1000):

Motor
50 Mile Battery
Controller
Thumb Throttle
Wiring
Labor
Hitch & rack

Ideally, I'd like to be able to put the long range battery on the bike, simply because the cost of the 19 mile battery is $600+ and will likely be deprecated and unused (wasted) once I put the long term pack on the bike.  It's $400 more for the long range.  How the bike is configured will ultimately depend on the success of my campaign.  I've also included the hitch and rack so that I can take the bike to other trails that are only reachable by car. 

My old bike is being donated.  I have located a student on campus that is lacking a car, and has to ride the bus for 3 hours a day.  His funds are as tight as mine, and he's essentially stuck within a 1-2 mile radius of his flat, so in consideration of people helping me out here, I'm already planning on helping someone else.  He has offered me $300 for my old bike -- on payments  -- but what he doesn't know yet, is that I'm going to take the bike and just give it to him this weekend.  But I will ask him to do something nice for someone else in return.

As the campaign proceeds, I'll provide updates, pictures and maybe even a video of a test drive while I work with the dealer getting my bike set up.

If you are unable to provide a monetary contribution, would you be so kind as to cross post this to your social media pages?

Updates

6/23/2012:  I visited the specialist today.  My bike has been equipped with a trial setup -- that happens to be $1000 cheaper.  This means we're more than 10% to my goal as of this writing if this setup works.  I rode the bike with no pedaling for 5 miles to facilitate battery break-in.  There's something different about lithium-polymer batteries from what he said.  They are treated with a chemical that makes them "sleep" while they are being stored.  This increases shelf life, and part of the break-in process is to increasingly discharge the batteries over a few charge cycles.  This process rids the batteries of the chemical so they can function at normal efficiency.  The ride was fantastic, although I didn't meet up with my nemesis (pedestrian bridge) because the sprinklers were on in the park that has access to the Stevens Creek Trail where this bridge resides.  I'll visit the bridge tomorrow.  I'll keep this setup on the bike for 1-2 weeks, then he'll be switching some components out for another configuration for testing.  I'm partial to this one already, merely because it's so much cheaper.  The range on this setup is 19 miles unassisted.  My exact range has yet to be determined.  I won't know the range until after the batteries are fully broken-in and I can ride the bike in the intended manner of pedaling with the motor as an assist.

6/24/2012:  I went to the imfamous pedestrian bridge to try it out.  Went about 8.5 miles this time. Still being very easy on the batteries during break-in.  The bridge was not an issue.  In fact, the motor didn't work any harder than it does on the flats.  I went over the bridge twice, and a couple more bridges along the trail.  I was stopped by one of the trail maintenance officers, and he commented on my bike.  It's the second time I've been approached by someone with questions, I'm sure there will be a lot more.  My friend Liz is coming over in an hour (hopefully the batteries are recharged by then), we are going on a 12-15 mile ride.  I'm keeping a spreadsheet with the battery and distance information.  So far, it looks like this configuration is going to exceed my expectations in terms of distance capability.  It started with ~25 a mile range, and on the 2nd charge cycle, it's up to 28.  Despite it being fairly windy today (12 MPH), its evident that the break-in process is very real.  I woke up to find that a couple friends gave me quite a suprise during the nightime hours, a whopping $500 was added to my campaign.  Thank you dearly.  I don't think you will ever know the impact you've had on my day. 

Notable Mentions

Thank you to Liz & Christine for proof-reading this page.  Thank you Jess for your outstanding teaching and drilling "focus" into my head and for helping me be able to "just write".  Yes sir, I know you hate your name, but I didn't want to use last names here without permission.  It's been three semesters, I can get away with it once.  Thank you Jill for helping me gain confidence to speak publicly about a private matter, albeit in written form.  Thank you "Wine Gal", "Truck", and "Nyx" for your support and friendship.

story:
You may know my friend Kendra, but only some of you know her desperate situation. Many of you know her as the woman who is always kind and always willing to help others & most importantly supportive to the Lyme & Mold community! Now is our chance to finally give back to her...

Kendra & her 2 cats have been virtually homeless for over 6 months. She is very humble and didn't want others to know how difficult her situation has been!

My family and I had given her a place to stay and a warm bed for a few weeks, but unfortunately due to our own struggling situation we are unable to help her on a permanent basis to live here. BUT our willingness to help Kendra and her cats Jessica & Bailey haven't stopped since she left. I'm doing this campaign and pleading for help because she finally has a chance to move into an affordable apartment... But she needs all of our help ASAP

Just a little backround:
Kendra is sick and struggling to win her battle to beat Lyme Disease & Mold Toxicity and many other auto-immune infections. The last home she lived in made her more sick as there was mold in the house. She had to quickly move out and without any other place to go, she ended up in her car and then temporarily at a motel. Unfortunately things got worse for her as she stayed at a new motel because the room had mold which set off her illness where she was in the hospital for a month, then out and back in again weeks at a time. Each time she had a more and more difficult time recovering for the exposure and quickly ran out of funds.

Kendra finally found two doctors in Illinois that are helping her and take her insurance, however, finding a chemical & mold free place to move into has been extremely difficult.

Well, the GREAT news is that she has found a place to move, but desperately need the help for the deposit, first months rent, and to set up the basic utilities, & to rent a trailer to move the remainder of her things out of storage.

Unfortunately Kendra has NO support from family, not even an offer for a place for her to stay. They've told her to go live in a homeless shelter and that IS NOT acceptable! Kendra is too sick, exhausted, and unable to stay at a shelter. We have looked into them and they are packed and you must wait in lines to even see if you could get a cot to sleep on. You cannot stay there more than a day. This isn't feasible for many reasons - most importantly her immunity. Section 8 waiting list is 3-4 years long and Kendra needs a home now, so she can start to recover and build up some of her strength back.

She has stayed with us a few times and she is like family, and I believe family should always be there, to help, be a shoulder to support on, and love. We love Kendra as do many of you. Even you don't know her, I am begging for a simple donation to help her more than I can myself.

Please consider donating even a $1 I know would make her smile. Also I am asking if you could share this with some friends as well. Every little bit counts!!! It does matter and so does Kendra!

Thank you from the bottom of my heart,

Tiffany

story:
Emily and Kat want to be roommates

Emily moved away from Portland, but she misses all of her friends and family.  That's right, she misses you!!  Kat misses Emily too, and her roommate, Daniel, is moving to New York to follow his heart.  Kat is sad, but excited because maybe Emily could be her new roommate.  Kat has a room for rent beginning March 1st, and she wants Emily to live there.  It is perfect for Emily because there is even a space for her massage therapy practice. Emily is commuting from Eugene to attend school at PSU, is looking for work in Portland, and just can't afford the moving costs on her own.  She really really wants to return home. 

You can get some wonderful bodywork to ease stress, relieve pain, relax! AND help your friend Emily return to our vibrant Portland community, help her have work and help her afford to move, all at the same time!      

What We Need & What You Get

  • Emily needs $2000 to afford first, last and deposit at Kat's house, and cover moving expenses.
  • To make this possible, Emily will gift you professional massage therapy services for any donation you make.  
  • Donations will go directly to fund Emily's move to Portland.  
  • You will personally be able to confirm that donations are used for their stated purpose because you will see Emily for massage at her new massage studio in Kat's house.
  • To celebrate our community acheivement, Kat will throw a Welcome Back to Portland Potluck for Emily that you all are invited to, in March.  Kat promises to make delicious cupcakes to share!!

We are positive you will help us reach our goal, but just in case we aren't able to reach our goal, and we aren't able to stretch the amount raised to meet the need, then 100% of your donation will be returned to you.  

 

The Impact

Imagine a world where you, Kat and Emily can SEE each other, in person!! This will be reality by March 1st, with your help.  Here is what we will do:

  • Emily will come to your birthday parties, dinner parties, summer parties, winter parties and slumber parties.
  • Emily will cook dinner for you, massage you, laugh at your jokes, tell you when your jokes aren't funny, tell you if you have toilet paper stuck to your shoe and give you a hug if you need one.  All things that require her to be in Portland, in person.
  • Emily will drink wine with you, eat cookies with you, go with you to the zoo, babysit your children, pet sit for you, and most importantly, be so, so, so happy to see you!!!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out by liking the "HelpMoveEmilyBackToPortland" Facebook page.
  • Do you have a friend or family member who needs a massage?  Send them a link to this page.  Get the word out!
  • Talk about how much you like massage at work or school.  When someone says they really want a massage, tell them you know the perfect place, and show them this website right away!

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools on this site to like on Facebook, Tweet, etc.
story_txt:
Emily and Kat want to be roommates
Emily moved away from Portland, but she misses all of her friends and family.  That's right, she misses you!!  Kat misses Emily too, and her roommate, Daniel, is moving to New York to follow his heart.  Kat is sad, but excited because maybe Emily could be her new roommate.  Kat has a room for rent beginning March 1st, and she wants Emily to live there.  It is perfect for Emily because there is even a space for her massage therapy practice. Emily is commuting from Eugene to attend school at PSU, is looking for work in Portland, and just can't afford the moving costs on her own.  She really really wants to return home. 
You can get some wonderful bodywork to ease stress, relieve pain, relax! AND help your friend Emily return to our vibrant Portland community, help her have work and help her afford to move, all at the same time!      

What We Need & What You Get

Emily needs $2000 to afford first, last and deposit at Kat's house, and cover moving expenses.

To make this possible, Emily will gift you professional massage therapy services for any donation you make.  

Donations will go directly to fund Emily's move to Portland.  

You will personally be able to confirm that donations are used for their stated purpose because you will see Emily for massage at her new massage studio in Kat's house.

To celebrate our community acheivement, Kat will throw a Welcome Back to Portland Potluck for Emily that you all are invited to, in March.  Kat promises to make delicious cupcakes to share!!
We are positive you will help us reach our goal, but just in case we aren't able to reach our goal, and we aren't able to stretch the amount raised to meet the need, then 100% of your donation will be returned to you.  
 

The Impact
Imagine a world where you, Kat and Emily can SEE each other, in person!! This will be reality by March 1st, with your help.  Here is what we will do:

Emily will come to your birthday parties, dinner parties, summer parties, winter parties and slumber parties.
Emily will cook dinner for you, massage you, laugh at your jokes, tell you when your jokes aren't funny, tell you if you have toilet paper stuck to your shoe and give you a hug if you need one.  All things that require her to be in Portland, in person.
Emily will drink wine with you, eat cookies with you, go with you to the zoo, babysit your children, pet sit for you, and most importantly, be so, so, so happy to see you!!!!

 


Other Ways You Can Help
Some of you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Get the word out by liking the "HelpMoveEmilyBackToPortland" Facebook page.
Do you have a friend or family member who needs a massage?  Send them a link to this page.  Get the word out!
Talk about how much you like massage at work or school.  When someone says they really want a massage, tell them you know the perfect place, and show them this website right away!

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools on this site to like on Facebook, Tweet, etc.

story:
pricingHealthcare.com is now live
come see what we're up to!

 

Help us build a solution to lower your healthcare costs.
Even small contributions help!

Adding your comments (see above) makes us more visible.

PricingHealthcare.com

Pricing Healthcare is busting the healthcare pricing market wide open, exposing the closely guarded pricing secrets of insurers and healthcare providers. We let consumers go to a single, easy-to-use website where they can compare procedure-level prices across all the healthcare facilities in their area.

If you’ve ever experienced the shock of an expensive medical bill, or known someone who has, then you understand the problem we’re trying to solve. Consumers have no recourse for outrageously high prices.  They want to know what they’re being billed for, what all of those procedure codes mean, if their bill is correct, and most importantly, if there's a place nearby that charges less.

There are lots of prices out there – list prices, insured rates, cash discounts.  We let people see all of it.  Nothing like this exists today.

 

 

The Solution (patent pending)

A number of companies have tried for years to convince hospitals and insurers to publish pricing data, but it's in the best interest of hospitals and insurers to keep this information secret.  Without this data, our competitors have been left to provide overly generalized estimates and very small fragments of the pricing picture, and have been unable to expose protected pricing data.

The data that could transform the healthcare industry is out there.  It’s sitting in our file cabinets and in the pile of bills on our kitchen counter. Our model is to help patients come together at the grass roots level, and anonymously share the pricing data from their healthcare bills.  That data is then combined and shown for your specific community, anywhere in the country.

Using our site is easy.  A user simply selects the facility listed on their bill, enters their primary insurance, then enters the service date, procedure code, and price charged from the bill details.  The site then displays descriptive information on the code, the lowest price for all payment types (including the average insured rate, the providers's retail and cash discount prices, and the medicare rate for the region), and names of the lowest-priced facilities in the area, with their prices.

Pricing Healthcare is pulling back the curtain on healthcare pricing by letting consumers anonymously share information from their bills online.  It's as simple as it is revolutionary.

Benefits

Consumers can save hundreds and thousands of dollars, comparing prices and finding the best healthcare at the lowest price.  Not only can patients choose to go to a lower-priced provider for big savings, but our information can also be used in trying to get a provider to lower the amount on your bill after the fact.  Pricing Healthcare also helps consumers find abnormalities and errors in their bills, such as double billing.  We save all the data you submit and provide you with a dashboard that allows you to see and manage your healthcare history.

Imagine what we could all do, collectively, with all the data from our healthcare bills anonymously online and freely available to other consumers.  Healthcare providers, like all American businesses, will have to compete on quality and price.

The rise in healthcare prices is one of America's biggest crises.  Nothing is more effective at lowering prices than good old-fashioned competition.  We can work together and make a huge difference, by exposing healthcare prices on a single site that is open to everyone.


 

Who We Are

We have a small, talented team of senior developers and a handful of top marketing and legal resources.  Most of us have had leadership roles on very large, enterprise-level projects at some of the biggest companies in America, and the founding members have worked together for years.

Randy, the founder and CEO, is also our chief architect and senior developer.  In addition to working for Intel, Microsoft, and HP, he has spent years building scalable web healthcare systems, and is passionate about making healthcare more affordable.

What We Need

We are just a couple months away from launching our public Beta (planned for June 2013).  Over the last year the Pricing Healthcare team has poured a lot of our savings and free time into this product.  In order to have a successful launch and reach a critical mass of people, we need additional funding for the following things.

  • A robust hosting environment: There are tens of thousands of codes with prices at hundreds of thousands of facilities in this country.  Our data set at launch time will be very large, and we need servers that can handle it.  Because our environment also has more complex security needs for things like HIPAA compliance, we can't get by with the cheap, smaller-scale hosting plans.
  • Supplemental data: We have opportunities to supplement portions of the pricing data, but that data has a price.
  • Outreach campaigns: The speed at which this site transforms the pricing landscape depends on getting information from a lot of people in a relatively short timeframe.  Additional funding will be carefully used to accelerate our outreach campaigns in targeted locations.

Your donations at any level will go toward these things.  We're asking for your help.

If you feel like you just can't contribute funds, we would love help getting the word out by mentioning our campaign in email and social media (see links to our pages below).  We also encourage you to use IndieGoGo share tools.

Donate Today

On behalf of our small team at Pricing Healthcare we thank you for your generous support as we bust healthcare pricing wide open.  We’ve tried to provide enticing rewards for your donations, but we know that the real reward comes in June 2013 when we launch our Beta and Americans can start comparing prices for the healthcare services that matter to them, at PricingHealthcare.com.

 

Randy Cox - founder and CEO

 

Listen to Bill Clinton talk at HIMSS 2013 on March 9th about the need for transparency in healthcare pricing

"Another thing, I think, needs to be done everywhere that isn't ..., is we need much more transparency in pricing" (interrupted by applause)

 

  More about the team
Randy Cox   Founder, CEO, CTO - Randy is a software architect, experienced analyst, and senior developer.  He has worked for Intel, Microsoft, HP, Allscripts, building scalable web healthcare systems over the last 3 year.  Randy is an expert in highly reliable, scalable systems, is rigorous in approaching enterprise-level solutions, and has a strong artistic / creative side.

Randy has a soft spot for families who struggle financially but want to be able to stand on their own two feet.  In a previous life Randy was a film composer and real estate investor.
 
Don Bennion   Chief Marketing Advisor, Board of Directors - Don is the chief marketing advisor for Pricing Healthcare.  He is currently Director of Business Strategy & Development at Adobe (Digital Marketing Business Unit), and has consulted large companies on their digital marketing strategy for 7 years - companies like Ford, Ikea, American Express.  Don also has experience in online sales, social media strategy and execution, and search engine marketing (SEM).
 
Bonnie Schreck   Advisor, Medical Coding Expert - Bonnie was a director and product manager at Ingenix and Contexo, with emphasis in coding and billing.  She consults on medical coding for various organizations and has an entrepreneurial spirit.
 
  Orrick, Herrington & Sutcliffe - Orrick is Pricing Healthcare's legal counsel.  Orrick is a global law firm that represents many of the largest public firms as well as over 1200 startups. They took us on as a client in September, 2012, and our primary liaison is San Francisco-based attorney Joseph Perkins, who was involved in advising Instagram in their buyout by Facebook.

 

  Frequently asked questions
Can I use the site without submitting data from my bills?
 
Our success depends on individual contributions from within each community. All users are required to enter at least one line item (a medical code and a price) from one of their recent medical bills.
Why do you require medical codes?
 
Medical billing is done at the code level.  Comparing line items with the same text description from two different bills may not be an apples-to-apples comparison.  For example, there is a different code (at a higher price) used for seeing a physician at their office if you are a new patient vs. an established patient.  There are also different codes used depending on how long you talk to your physician.  You should be skeptical of anyone offering to give you a quote on medical services that doesn't mention these codes.
Do you get data from other sources?
 
Yes. We are regularly importing data from public and proprietary sources and expect that flow to increase over time. Medical offices and hospitals may submit their chargemasters directly to us to publish, and we expect more and more will want to do so, especially those at the lower end of the price spectrum.
Can my doctor's office use your site when recommending treatments?
 
Yes, and please ask the facilities you visit to use Pricing Healthcare. We are also creating products specifically for medical organizations with the intent of providing better care for consumers at a lower cost.
Won't lower-priced care generally result in lower-quality care?
 
There have been studies year after year attempting to find a correlation between price and quality of care, but there has never been any evidence found that paying more will result in higher quality care.
How does the Affordable Care Act (Obamacare) affect this space?
 
The ACA focuses primarily on providing insurance to Americans who did not have it, and does not slow the rise in healthcare costs.  Prices are increasing for many under this plan.  Government subsidies will be used to control rising costs for the rest, which masks what the real prices are, burdens taxpayers, and becomes a huge incentive for fraud.
Don't most people have good health plans through their employer?
 
The number of Americans with employer-based health insurance has been declining for years, and is now well below 50% of the country.  In addition, employers are rapidly moving to plans that minimize future costs for the employer and place much of the burden on employees, either through high-deductible plans or by businesses getting out of employer health benefits altogether.
Once everyone's insured, don't we all just care about our in-network rates?
 
The CBO estimates after the ACA is fully in place, there will still be some 30 million Americans uninsured.  And as insurance-negotiated rates increase, there are actually a growing number of people finding that going outside the insurance system and paying cash rates saves them a lot of money.
I'm on Medicare - is this site for me?
 
Medical practices lose a lot of money on Medicare and Medicaid patients. Large numbers of providers are getting out of this business. If trends continue, it will become increasingly difficult, even in the next 5 years, to find practices that will take on new Medicare or Medicaid patients, leaving those consumers, many with lower-than-average incomes, to pay high list prices directly (or find very expensive insurance). Pricing Healthcare will help these consumers find quality care they can afford.
  Additional FAQs
How does this site help me save money?
 
Many patients are becoming aware of the huge price differences there can be between facilities in the same area for the same service.  The media is also beginning to cover the fact that paying the cash price can sometimes be a lot less than going through your insurance.  Getting this information over the phone is almost impossible, and there are no other web sites you can visit to get this information.  We show you apples-to-apples comparisons of all the prices at facilities that are close to you.  With that data at your fingertips you can find care at a lower cost.  And even for services you have already received, we give you information on codes and descriptions and competitive pricing to make you a more formidable negotiator if you wish to call and get your payments reduced.
Is your first loyalty to consumers? What are your revenue sources?
 

Our site is open to everyone, and independent of any provider, insurance carrier, or government entity.  At this time we are not planning to collect ad revenue.  Our revenue model includes a small annual subscription fee after Beta (currently targeting about $15 per year for consumers) to cover license fees and other costs so we don't have to have ads on our site.  This keeps our loyalties focused on patients.  Later revenue streams may include hospitals, insurance brokers, and government agencies seeking to buy the data from the collective efforts of the American people (hospitals and insurers paying patients - that would certainly be a welcome change).

Some might be concerned about Pricing Healthcare positioning itself to rely on data streams from third parties.  We are of course always looking for data sources to complement our user submissions, but our goal will always be to serve consumers.  We have no interest in taking money or data from third parties that seek to move us in any way from that primary focus.

Finally, unlike insurance carrier price estimate tools, PricingHealthcare.com doesn't need to keep a group of hospitals or providers happy by hiding what they charge or hiding what competitors charge.  Nor are we under contract to keep some prices secret, as large medical institutions often are.

Do I need an account for each member of my family?
 
A family or household paying medical bills under one name will typically need only one subscription account.  We let you specify the patient for each medical bill item, so you can still track bills for specific family members.  Pricing Healthcare also lets you track payments for an aging parent that you are paying the bills for.  Our goal is to help your family simplify and lower their medical costs, not add to them.
Is my subscription tied to my employer or my insurance?
 
No, and you won't have to learn a new pricing tool if you go to another state, or if you change jobs or insurance carrier.
Can your team make this happen with just $70,000?
 
The $70k is to get us through a successful Beta launch and maybe 2-3 months (very lean months) of runway after that - not much more.  Our campaign’s stretch goal is $500,000, but if we only reach the $70k level, we will be seeking a larger raise from traditional investors after our June release.
Will I be able to give someone access to my account with restricted privileges?
 
An early user has requested a feature, termed "personal assistant access", where others can access your account and do certain things, without them having full access.  This would be useful in letting another person or organization submit large numbers of medical bills and EOBs on your behalf. The team is taking this feature request under consideration.
  Media links about the healthcare pricing environment

High Disparity in Healthcare Prices

2013, Mar – N.Y. Times (Economix) – U.S. Health Care Prices Are the Elephant in the Room - http://economix.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/03/29/u-s-health-care-prices-are-the-elephant-in-the-room/?smid=tw-share

2013, Feb – N.Y. Times (Healthy Consumer) – Quotes on a hip replacement in St. Louis might surprise even hardened health care economists - http://well.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/02/11/price-for-a-new-hip-many-hospitals-are-stumped/

2012, Jul – Consumer Reports – Health-care prices are all over the map, even within your plan’s network - http://www.consumerreports.org/cro/magazine/2012/07/that-ct-scan-costs-how-much/index.htm

 

Consumers Struggle to Pay

2012, Jun – NY Times – Many Americans Struggle to Pay for Health Care, Survey Finds - http://bucks.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/06/18/many-americans-struggle-to-pay-for-health-care-survey-finds/

 

Big Changes in Employer and Other Insurance Plans

2013, Mar – BenefitsPro – 60% of employers moving away from traditional “managed trend” approach to healthcare benefits - http://www.benefitspro.com/2013/03/04/employers-taking-bold-steps-with-health-benefits#.UTZ0y5vXmnk.twitter

2013, Mar – NY Daily News – Small business owners have no strategy for coping with rising healthcare costs - http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/small-business-owners-strategy-coping-rising-healthcare-costs-report-article-1.1257787

 

Lack of Transparency, Competition

2013, Mar – Pittsburgh Post Gazette – Keeping us clueless on cost of health care - http://www.post-gazette.com/stories/business/opinion/regional-insights-keeping-us-clueless-on-cost-of-health-care-677693/

2012, Jun – The Heartland Institute – Sometimes the cash price is lower than the insurance negotiated discount.  Private-pay eliminates the third party and the insurance companies, and is truly a free-market device for patients as consumers of health care.  The trend of patients paying cash for health care services is a win-win situation for both the patient and the provider. - http://news.heartland.org/newspaper-article/2012/06/19/california-health-care-providers-offer-discounts-cash-payment#.USmr3CMQYTc.twitter

2011, Dec – National Review – Why Not Medical Pricing Transparency? - http://www.nationalreview.com/agenda/285019/why-not-medical-pricing-transparency-josh-barro

2011, Jul – Kellogg Insight – An Unhealthy Market for Competition: Health insurance companies in the U.S., not consumers, control the market - http://insight.kellogg.northwestern.edu/article/an_unhealthy_market_for_competition

 

Consumer Awareness, Advocacy

2013, Feb – HealthDay News – Patients who take an active role in their health care have substantially lower healthcare costs, even among patients with the same type of chronic illness - http://www.wate.com/story/20966821/patient-involvement-lowers-health-costs-study-says

2012, Aug – U.S. News (My Money) – 10 Ways to Deal with an Expensive Emergency Room Bill: request an itemized statement, check your statement - http://money.usnews.com/money/blogs/my-money/2012/08/16/10-ways-to-deal-with-an-expensive-emergency-room-bill

2012, Jun – About.com Patient Empowerment – What Is Healthcare Billing Fraud and How Can It Be Stopped? - http://patients.about.com/od/costsconsumerism/f/healthcarefraud.htm

  Additional FAQs
How does this site help me save money?
 
Many patients are becoming aware of the huge price differences there can be between facilities in the same area for the same service.  The media is also beginning to cover the fact that paying the cash price can sometimes be a lot less than going through your insurance.  Getting this information over the phone is almost impossible, and there are no other web sites you can visit to get this information.  We show you apples-to-apples comparisons of all the prices at facilities that are close to you.  With that data at your fingertips you can find care at a lower cost.  And even for services you have already received, we give you information on codes and descriptions and competitive pricing to make you a more formidable negotiator if you wish to call and get your payments reduced.
Is your first loyalty to consumers? What are your revenue sources?
 

Our site is open to everyone, and independent of any provider, insurance carrier, or government entity.  At this time we are not planning to collect ad revenue.  Our revenue model includes a small annual subscription fee after Beta (currently targeting about $15 per year for consumers) to cover license fees and other costs so we don't have to have ads on our site.  This keeps our loyalties focused on patients.  Later revenue streams may include hospitals, insurance brokers, and government agencies seeking to buy the data from the collective efforts of the American people (hospitals and insurers paying patients - that would certainly be a welcome change).
Some might be concerned about Pricing Healthcare positioning itself to rely on data streams from third parties.  We are of course always looking for data sources to complement our user submissions, but our goal will always be to serve consumers.  We have no interest in taking money or data from third parties that seek to move us in any way from that primary focus.
Finally, unlike insurance carrier price estimate tools, PricingHealthcare.com doesn't need to keep a group of hospitals or providers happy by hiding what they charge or hiding what competitors charge.  Nor are we under contract to keep some prices secret, as large medical institutions often are.

Do I need an account for each member of my family?
 
A family or household paying medical bills under one name will typically need only one subscription account.  We let you specify the patient for each medical bill item, so you can still track bills for specific family members.  Pricing Healthcare also lets you track payments for an aging parent that you are paying the bills for.  Our goal is to help your family simplify and lower their medical costs, not add to them.
Is my subscription tied to my employer or my insurance?
 
No, and you won't have to learn a new pricing tool if you go to another state, or if you change jobs or insurance carrier.
Can your team make this happen with just $70,000?
 
The $70k is to get us through a successful Beta launch and maybe 2-3 months (very lean months) of runway after that - not much more.  Our campaign’s stretch goal is $500,000, but if we only reach the $70k level, we will be seeking a larger raise from traditional investors after our June release.
Will I be able to give someone access to my account with restricted privileges?
 
An early user has requested a feature, termed "personal assistant access", where others can access your account and do certain things, without them having full access.  This would be useful in letting another person or organization submit large numbers of medical bills and EOBs on your behalf. The team is taking this feature request under consideration.
  Media links about the healthcare pricing environment

High Disparity in Healthcare Prices
2013, Mar – N.Y. Times (Economix) – U.S. Health Care Prices Are the Elephant in the Room - http://economix.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/03/29/u-s-health-care-prices-are-the-elephant-in-the-room/?smid=tw-share
2013, Feb – N.Y. Times (Healthy Consumer) – Quotes on a hip replacement in St. Louis might surprise even hardened health care economists - http://well.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/02/11/price-for-a-new-hip-many-hospitals-are-stumped/
2012, Jul – Consumer Reports – Health-care prices are all over the map, even within your plan’s network - http://www.consumerreports.org/cro/magazine/2012/07/that-ct-scan-costs-how-much/index.htm
 
Consumers Struggle to Pay
2012, Jun – NY Times – Many Americans Struggle to Pay for Health Care, Survey Finds - http://bucks.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/06/18/many-americans-struggle-to-pay-for-health-care-survey-finds/
 
Big Changes in Employer and Other Insurance Plans
2013, Mar – BenefitsPro – 60% of employers moving away from traditional “managed trend” approach to healthcare benefits - http://www.benefitspro.com/2013/03/04/employers-taking-bold-steps-with-health-benefits#.UTZ0y5vXmnk.twitter
2013, Mar – NY Daily News – Small business owners have no strategy for coping with rising healthcare costs - http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/small-business-owners-strategy-coping-rising-healthcare-costs-report-article-1.1257787
 
Lack of Transparency, Competition
2013, Mar – Pittsburgh Post Gazette – Keeping us clueless on cost of health care - http://www.post-gazette.com/stories/business/opinion/regional-insights-keeping-us-clueless-on-cost-of-health-care-677693/
2012, Jun – The Heartland Institute – Sometimes the cash price is lower than the insurance negotiated discount.  Private-pay eliminates the third party and the insurance companies, and is truly a free-market device for patients as consumers of health care.  The trend of patients paying cash for health care services is a win-win situation for both the patient and the provider. - http://news.heartland.org/newspaper-article/2012/06/19/california-health-care-providers-offer-discounts-cash-payment#.USmr3CMQYTc.twitter
2011, Dec – National Review – Why Not Medical Pricing Transparency? - http://www.nationalreview.com/agenda/285019/why-not-medical-pricing-transparency-josh-barro
2011, Jul – Kellogg Insight – An Unhealthy Market for Competition: Health insurance companies in the U.S., not consumers, control the market - http://insight.kellogg.northwestern.edu/article/an_unhealthy_market_for_competition
 
Consumer Awareness, Advocacy
2013, Feb – HealthDay News – Patients who take an active role in their health care have substantially lower healthcare costs, even among patients with the same type of chronic illness - http://www.wate.com/story/20966821/patient-involvement-lowers-health-costs-study-says
2012, Aug – U.S. News (My Money) – 10 Ways to Deal with an Expensive Emergency Room Bill: request an itemized statement, check your statement - http://money.usnews.com/money/blogs/my-money/2012/08/16/10-ways-to-deal-with-an-expensive-emergency-room-bill
2012, Jun – About.com Patient Empowerment – What Is Healthcare Billing Fraud and How Can It Be Stopped? - http://patients.about.com/od/costsconsumerism/f/healthcarefraud.htm

story:
"If you were told you might only have a few months to live, what would you do? For Jenn and Brian, they are planning the wedding of a lifetime."
 
The wedding on 4/21 was AMAZING!  And we made headlines! Thank you so much to the list of vendors below and for everyone who contributed and shared.  We are so grateful fo your support.  Here is the link to see the story on Yahoo! Shine! 
 
Jenn and Brian have been engaged since Valentines Day and were planning a big beautiful wedding for late summer 2013.  In late March, Jenn was diagnosed with an aggressive cancer (angiosarcoma of the breast) and we fear she will not be around long enough for a late summer wedding. Her doctors have told her that the survival rate to beating this is very low.  Even though we are planning on beating the odds,  the new date was set for April 21st (hoping her chemo treatments would not trigger her hair loss that soon). 
 
Before this campiagn began, we were seeking 100% of wedding costs to be covered in addition to Jenn's out of pocket medical treatments. It's also been hard for them becuase Brian currently lives out of state and is doing everything to secure work in LA to support his amazing bride-to-be (he truely is Prince Charming!).
 
We want Jenn to be a miracle story of triumph over tragedy! The Elysia Skye Breast Cancer Organziation, Rebel Belle Weddings and LA Wedding Woman have teamed up to make their dreams come true!  And with your help, we can make this happen for them and give Jenn a much better chance at NOT becoming a statistic.  Plus, your donation is 100% tax deductible. Woohoo!

What We Need for her Cancer Treatments

  • $$$$ medical costs not covered by insurance (mastectomy and reconstructive surgery co-pays, prescriptions, etc.)
  • $2,500 eastern medicine costs not covered by insurance (intravenious vitamin c therapy, immune system boosters, accupuncture, holistic nutritionist, etc.)
  • $500 for 2 human hair lace front wigs
  • $1000 to move Brian to LA to care for her
  • $250 in comedic entertainment (movies, live shows, concerts etc. - LAUGHTER IS THE BEST MEDICINCE AFTER ALL!).
  • $$$$ in unforseen costs and care

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Indiegogo has very simple share tools!

And stop by Jenn's blog to learn more about this incredible woman and send her your love! She would appreciate that very much :-) https://www.mylifeline.org/JenniferGailGargano/?page=welcome.cfm

On behalf of Jenn, Brian, Laura (Rebel Belle) and LA Wedding Woman,  we would like to express our heartfelt gratitude to everyone who has donated their money, time, goods and services. Below you will find a list of ROCK STAR vendors who came together without hesitation to make what was just an idea last Wednesday a reality this coming weekend. We cannot thank them enough!

Wedding Coordination - Rebel Belle Weddings

Ceremony Venue - Yamashiro

Reception Venue, Food & Drink - M Bar

Photography - The CoCo Gallery

Videography - NST Pictures

Wedding Cake – The Butter End Cakery

Makeup – Alli B Make-up

Wig – Nigel's Beauty Emporium

 Transportation – Classy Chasis Rentals

Wedding Gown Alterations – In Stitches

Accessories – Petal Blush Love

Wedding Officiant - LA Wedding Woman

Additionally, we extend our very deepest appreciation to the following friends and family members who so generously contributed their time, energy and special talents as well: Christine & Marsha (for the lovely flowers), Yasmin (for the gorgeous hairstyling), Jovina (for the stunning wedding gown), Branden (for the fabulous music), Jeremy (for the super-cool guest book), Dorian & Lynn (for the plentiful wine and funky photo booth props), Hayley (for the magnificent giant flowers), “Make it Pretty” Megan (for just that talent), Heather & Gavin (for the helping hands), and last but very much not least – Lorraine, Madelyn, Blanca, Marlan, Jenny, Emilyn, Jennifer and Meilanie (for all the decor, wedding goodies, support and love).

(So many people have come forward to help, and we have been working so quickly, that it is entirely possible we have missed someone on this list. If so, please accept our apology in advance and email us right away!)

story:
Hell. I'm creeping up on 40. I see the fork in the road ahead. One direction leads to one of those "too fat to walk" carts, velcro shoes, and lots of TV. The other direction represents a complete change in my life. Workout. Get healthy. Lose weight. Why not be extreme - become a triathlete. Why? As someone who believes that everything happens for a reason, I was given a message when I had the opportunity to watch an Ironman event recently. Immediately, I became obsessed. I needed to do this. The more I've explored, the more I am certain of this direction.

Making the transition from fat guy to triathlete will require significant commitment - both physically and emotionally on my part. I'm a month away from being physically cabable of even beginning a training program. I understand there will be pain, and I am ready for it.The other commitment involved in making this transition is financial. Sponsors aren't exactly lining up behind someone who has never competed before - and someone in their mind who probably won't be able to. So, that's where Team Pat comes in... Each discipline requires gear, little of which I already have. To swim, I need a wetsuit, goggles, and a pool membership so I can train in the cold months. To bike, well... I need a bike, helmet, shoes, a bike rack, and probably other things I haven't thought of. To run, I need some compression socks. To compete in sanctioned events, I need to join USATriathlon.org. Believe me, I need every penny I can get. 

I am creating some SWEET Team Pat swag as a way to thank those who are willing to help me along this road:

1. For a $10 donation, you will receive a custom designed Team Pat wristband, so you can proudly show your suport.

2. A $25 donation gets you a Team Pat beer koozie plus the wristband.

3. For $100, you get the above items, plus a Team Pat t-shirt in a size of your choosing.

4. For a $250 donation, you can choose either a 16X9 Photo on Canvas print of an elephant (a picture I took in Tanzania) which I will number and sign.  OR  You can be a guest blogger on my blog, gmanofleisure.com, for a day. Just don't blog any hate...

5. I'm gonna throw this out there too... for a $20,000 donation, I will tattoo your company's logo (3X3) on my right shoulder. Really. 

If we exceed our goal of $1,500 I will make a donation to the Animal Care Center of St. John, an INCREDIBLE animal clinic and adoption center that is completely supported through donations. Check out their site http://stjohnanimalcarecenter.com/home. 

I sincerely hope this journey becomes even bigger than one guy competing in triathlons. I am going to succeed. And I will have a story to tell. As a vegan and animal rights advocate, I will have the opportunity to spread information, share experiences, and make a difference. Also, I will be able to help so many people who are struggling with health issues, depression...people who can't figure out their own road. I am documenting my journey on my blog, and fully intend to write a book after I compete in my first Ironman event. My story will inspire others. Your help, at whatever level, will be a HUGE part of my success. I cannot thank you enough. 

Believe me, I get that money is tight. If it wasn't, I wouldn't be on Indiegogo.com looking for help. If you can't donate, please spread the word... share of Facebook or Twitter, talk to your friends. And again, thanks! 

 

Pat
