story:
Due to ignorance of the government and civil society, most of such survivors find no hope and stay quite inside the four walls. We work to make the Survivor’s life better , as most of the victims of this brutal crime, which is much more grave in its impact than a rape, have isolated themselves after losing their face.

What we do- We strongly believe that mere charity and money giving is only the first step towards a solution for this issue, as the acid attack crime leads to extreme social alienation of the victim. Most of these victimized women are deemed unfit for marriage or employment due to the permanent disfigurement of their faces. We allow such victims the opportunity to not only earn their own livelihoods, but also to find and embrace their own sense of dignity and self-worth. 

·  Helpline – We have a dedicated Helpline available, which will respond to any distress or First aid call from victims or their families. We will alert the local authorities, hospitals etc. for faster and timely response and you can email us – atijeevanfoundation@gmail.com

·  Rehabilitation of Victims: Victims of acid attacks need assistance in dealing with the trauma. We work towards the comprehensive rehabilitation of such victims. We analyze their social background, education and circumstances and recommend and bring about positive changes that can ensure rehabilitation of victims.

·  Psychological Counselling: Our team of psychological counselors and acid survivors who helps and guides the Survivor during the treatment  and reduce the trauma of whatever they have gone through. Our aim is to help build the Survivors self-confidence again .

·  Legal Counselling & Support:We have a group of Legal experts and renowned Lawyers of Supreme court  to help the Survivors fight the legal battle.

·  Employment Opportunity Creation: We  generate employment opportunities for Survivors  either in our own office or create  work for them to do at convenience of their Home as well.The Survivors face health issues and cannot go out to work. We  ensure that the psychological stress and stigma attached to being a victim of such crimes doesn't necessarily result in a financial crisis for the victim or their families.

·  Education & Sensitization: We aim at conducting Seminars and Workshops to spread awareness about the acid violence and First aid/ treatment for the same and ways for women to remain safe. Our aim is to sensitize the general public to stand up against this growing menace and turn our society into one where there is no Acid violence.

Our vision is to free India from this crime, which reflects the flaws of our male-dominated culture and abusive attitudes. We want survivors to have access to fast justice and fight back the irreparable impact of this crime with ample support and find a regular source of Income for themselves with us.


How you will help..

We are a group of Acid attack Survivors and some friends as volunteers who are trying very hard to create a social enterprise plan to support our fellow Survivors in terms of employment.

The amount collected from the Campaign will help us Establish a stitching workstation  for the survivors. Where in they will produce the Home Furnishing products. We will organize exhibitions of those products to raise money for supporting their livelihoods.

story:
My friends need help!

Bev and Dave are two wonderful friends of mine who are both struggling with terminal illness.  Dave has an inoperable brain tumor, and Bev has Parkinson's disease, Fibromyalgia and COPD.  Bev was expected to die, and put on hospice, but recently recovered enough to be taken off--for now.  She has been in the hospital twice in the last two months.

They both live on Social Security ($1100 a month for each) and their rent is $875 dollars a month.  Both are worried that when the other one passes away, they will be unable to pay for their medications and other bills.  The best thing to do would be to move out into a cheaper apartment, but they are trapped by a $6,000 overdue electric bill.  They reached this point due to overwhelming medical bills and assisting their daughter, who has schizoaffective disorder.  Their daughter, Chrissy, now is on disability and does not need as much help.

Currently, the electric company allows them to pay $150 dollars a month towards the current bill (writing off $100 on the past due amount), but if they were to move out to a cheaper area, they would have to pay $500 dollars a month towards the bill.  The overdue electric bill currently makes moving nearly impossible, and adds even more stress to their lives.

They have applied for assistance and have been denied, gone to charities and churches, and currently owe relatives an additional $1000 dollars (the electricity was going to be shut off) that they are unable to pay back.

Bev has told me that she feels like she is "drowning" under all the financial stress.  She told me: "I've been through the whole process of dying thing," but "I'd like to feel like I'm not drowning.  I'd like to feel happy when I die."

What they need

The current overdue electric bill with PP&L is $6000 dollars, which is what I have listed as the needed funds for the campaign.  If any money is donated in addition, which they would be endlessly grateful for, it would be used for medical and moving expenses.  Bev needs $400 dollars for a copay on a test she needs.  She has Barrett's esophagus, and needs to be retested for cancer.  However, she currently cannot afford the test.  Dave has a referral to The New York Brain Tumor Center, and the VA will pay 100% of his costs--but none of hers if they have to stay over.  They need $800 for a moving van if they are able to move, which their nephew will drive for them.

An Overview of Expenses

Here is a partial list of bills that Bev and Dave pay:

+$2200 a month

-$875 rent
-$150 electric current bill, plus any past due
-$83 water
-$100 propane for the stove
-$72 trash
-$145 other bills, including cable
-$145 medicare and part D (taken out of both checks automatically (total: $290)
-$50 phone and fax (which are needed for medical reasons)
-$95 cost of seven prescriptions
-$400 mail-order prescriptions not covered by medicare
-around $100 over the counter medications not covered by medicare

That leaves hardly anything for gas to get to the doctors, other necessities, and food not available at the food bank. Dave doesn't have money to get dentures, and Bev's need to be repaired. It is an impossible situation!  It will become even more impossible when one of them passes, and the survivor receives $1100 a month.

The Impact

Bev and Dave are caring, lovely people who are always thinking of other people.  Ever since I've known them, they have been loyal friends to me and helped me through immense difficulty.  If they could raise the $6000 dollars needed to pay off their electric bill, they could move into an apartment that costs half their current rent--with cheaper propane, water, etc. as well!  That would put them in a better financial situation and ease their stress.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to help financially (I can't either, very much) it would be amazingly helpful to share this campaign with your friends, family, and around the internet.  I know that Bev and Dave would both appreciate it deeply.  Your prayers or thoughts are welcome.  Thank you for reading!
story_txt:
My friends need help!
Bev and Dave are two wonderful friends of mine who are both struggling with terminal illness.  Dave has an inoperable brain tumor, and Bev has Parkinson's disease, Fibromyalgia and COPD.  Bev was expected to die, and put on hospice, but recently recovered enough to be taken off--for now.  She has been in the hospital twice in the last two months.
They both live on Social Security ($1100 a month for each) and their rent is $875 dollars a month.  Both are worried that when the other one passes away, they will be unable to pay for their medications and other bills.  The best thing to do would be to move out into a cheaper apartment, but they are trapped by a $6,000 overdue electric bill.  They reached this point due to overwhelming medical bills and assisting their daughter, who has schizoaffective disorder.  Their daughter, Chrissy, now is on disability and does not need as much help.
Currently, the electric company allows them to pay $150 dollars a month towards the current bill (writing off $100 on the past due amount), but if they were to move out to a cheaper area, they would have to pay $500 dollars a month towards the bill.  The overdue electric bill currently makes moving nearly impossible, and adds even more stress to their lives.
They have applied for assistance and have been denied, gone to charities and churches, and currently owe relatives an additional $1000 dollars (the electricity was going to be shut off) that they are unable to pay back.
Bev has told me that she feels like she is "drowning" under all the financial stress.  She told me: "I've been through the whole process of dying thing," but "I'd like to feel like I'm not drowning.  I'd like to feel happy when I die."


What they need
The current overdue electric bill with PP&L is $6000 dollars, which is what I have listed as the needed funds for the campaign.  If any money is donated in addition, which they would be endlessly grateful for, it would be used for medical and moving expenses.  Bev needs $400 dollars for a copay on a test she needs.  She has Barrett's esophagus, and needs to be retested for cancer.  However, she currently cannot afford the test.  Dave has a referral to The New York Brain Tumor Center, and the VA will pay 100% of his costs--but none of hers if they have to stay over.  They need $800 for a moving van if they are able to move, which their nephew will drive for them.
An Overview of Expenses
Here is a partial list of bills that Bev and Dave pay:
+$2200 a month
-$875 rent-$150 electric current bill, plus any past due-$83 water-$100 propane for the stove-$72 trash-$145 other bills, including cable-$145 medicare and part D (taken out of both checks automatically (total: $290)-$50 phone and fax (which are needed for medical reasons)-$95 cost of seven prescriptions-$400 mail-order prescriptions not covered by medicare-around $100 over the counter medications not covered by medicare
That leaves hardly anything for gas to get to the doctors, other necessities, and food not available at the food bank. Dave doesn't have money to get dentures, and Bev's need to be repaired. It is an impossible situation!  It will become even more impossible when one of them passes, and the survivor receives $1100 a month.


The Impact
Bev and Dave are caring, lovely people who are always thinking of other people.  Ever since I've known them, they have been loyal friends to me and helped me through immense difficulty.  If they could raise the $6000 dollars needed to pay off their electric bill, they could move into an apartment that costs half their current rent--with cheaper propane, water, etc. as well!  That would put them in a better financial situation and ease their stress.


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you aren't able to help financially (I can't either, very much) it would be amazingly helpful to share this campaign with your friends, family, and around the internet.  I know that Bev and Dave would both appreciate it deeply.  Your prayers or thoughts are welcome.  Thank you for reading!

story:
Brian's Fight

After a series of health problems, five months ago, Brian Chambers was diagnosed with esophageal cancer (cancer in the esophagus). This is very rare for a person only 35 years old, especially considering Brian has never smoked or drank in his life, which is usually the cause of this disease. Brian had a large tumor on his esophagus and under went weeks of chemo and radiation treatment to reduce the size of the tumor before having it removed. Last month, he was scheduled to have surgery to remove the tumor. Not long after the surgery began, doctors came out to tell the family the heartbreaking news, that although the tumor had shrunk, the cancer had unfortunately spread throughout his lymph nodes, so surgery was declined to keep his best quality of life.

Brian is still fighting the cancer, now at stage IV. The past five years have been hard on Brian and his family. Things have been extremely difficult especially after the heartbreak of losing his three month-old baby girl, Jewels, to SIDS in 2008, and the disappointment of a divorce a few years later.

Because of his sickness, on July 1st, Brian was terminated from his job at Cardinal IG where he had worked for 15 years, which also means he loses his health insurance...


Brian's Heart

Brian has lived in or around the town of Greenfield, IA his entire life. Everyone in the area knows Brian. He has never been mean or unkind to anyone in his entire life. He loves his family and his little boy D'Vid and would do anything for them. He also loves Nodaway Valley athletics and has attended the events and always supported the teams and athletes. He was the one in the crowd always going wild with cheers of support.

Brian has never once hesitated to give when asked. He would give the shirt off his back if someone were in need of it.

It seems unfair that someone so kind-hearted would have to endure such struggle and heartbreak.


Brian's Dream

Anyone who knows Brian, knows that he's a huge NASCAR fan. He loves watching the races and watching Dale Jr. But Brian has never had the chance to go to an actual race.

This fundraising campaign is to help Brian's dream come true. Let's send him and his family to see a race and give him a chance to maybe even meet Dale Jr. himself. Brian has never once hesitated to show support to the community so lets return the favor and show Brian how much we care and appreciate him.

In his struggle and fight, let's give Brian something great to look forward to, and raise enough money so that Brian and his family can have the chance of a lifetime to go to a race together!

The funds will pay for: tickets for a two-day race, travel, lodging, and food for him and his family. Any additional or leftover money will go towards Brian's medical expenses.

Brian and his family are some of the most kind-hearted people to ever grace this earth! In this difficult time, let's show them the love and support they have always shown others!

story:
Short Summary

Can water cure disease? Throughout history and across all cultures, there are stories of water that can heal. We have identified a possible basis. Through a decade of research at the University of Washington, we have uncovered evidence for a fourth phase of water, beyond the commonly known solid, liquid, and vapor. This fourth phase could be the root of water’s purported healing properties.

To test the health benefits of fourth-phase water, we need to produce that water in some quantity. We have built a microscale device (below) that concentrates fourth-phase of water, while filtering out contaminants. We want to scale up this patented device to produce larger quantities of this water.

Imagine attaching one of those scaled-up devices to your kitchen sink!

This is a "filterless filter” that separates contaminants and produces fourth-phase water. The device has been granted a US Patent 7,819,259. It needs scale-up to produce meaningful quantities of potentially health-giving water.

Many drinking waters contain some fourth-phase water. Those with the most may produce the most health benefits. Testing this hypothesis constitutes a major thrust of this scientific effort. We will evaluate the benefits of pure fourth-phase water (produced by the filterless filter), as well as various other waters deemed likely to have health benefits.

We expect to provide objective scientific data that will let you make an informed choice for optimizing your health.

To learn more about our scientific work on water and health implications, check out the following presentations and interviews:

A TEDx talk describing water’s fourth phase.

Dr. Mercola interviews Professor Pollack on the role of water in health.

A recent talk on fourth phase water, electricity, and health.


What We Need & What You Get

With $100,000 we can build a new prototype filter-less filter device for creating meaningful quantities of fourth-phase water. With $500,000 we can test the health benefits of that water; and with $2 M we can thoroughly evaluate the potential curative benefits of various waters that you might consider drinking.

As a reward for your generosity we offer several tangible perks. However, the main reward is objective and reliable information that can help you make an informed choice about your health.


The Impact

Many claims exist for the health benefits of certain waters. Such claims often engender skepticism because they are made by people with financial interests in those waters.

We have no commercial interest in any of those waters. Our interest is purely science. We will objectively test whether any of these waters can promote health and possibly reverse pathologies. You have the right to know what kind of water is best for your health. We will provide that information.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you resonate with our vision for developing effective, scientifically based, drug-free approaches to health, please share this campaign link with your visionary friends, who might be moved to help.

story:
A little about Tristin and his dream.

Hi my name is Tristin MacLeod I am 9 years old and I race go-karts.  This is only my third year and I am kicking butt.  I have won a lot of races over these three years. I was offered a spot on a national team (CRG-USA) this year.  I have several wins and podiums since the year began.  I am currently third in the points standing for the SKUSA Rocky Mountain Region Series.  In this series I race kids that are older and more experienced than me, but I have been able to beat them.

I am trying to get to Indiana for a huge race the ROTAX Grand Nationals.  We had somewhat of a budget for this event, but with my dad’s job changing and us having to move it will be impossible without help. So my dad and I have put this together to see if I can still go. It is rushed we know and sorry for that.

This event host people from all over the world.  I may never get to do this again unless we get sponsors in the future.  Doing well at this race may really help with that.  The experience I would gain at this event would be invaluable for my racing future. I will learn so much. I want to go fast I just want to race. I put a little video up and will try to post a few of me driving I will also send some link of interviews and aticals I have been part of. Here is on of the lates. Copy and paste it in your browser if it doesn't open.

http://www.krextv.com/news/around-the-region/Fa...

 

Where the money goes

Tire sets run $248 per set and we will go through 3-4. Total $750 to $1000 roughly.

Air Fare we expect to be about $800 since we will have to book last minute.

Race entry fees are about $800.

Lodging for the week $400.

Kart transport to and from the event $500.

Tent fees $300

Parts for when things go wrong $700 (with luck this will be lower).

 

What you get

Well we would love to give the world to any one for their help, but we are limited on our options.  So here are a few things we came up with.

$5        I will send you a thank you email.

$10      I will mail you a personal thank you note.

$25      I will mail you the thank you along with a racing photo

$100+  I will send the above along with your name and thanks on my Facebook page (this end up racing) and mention at a podium speech.

This all being said if you have a company and can afford to sponsor me please email me and we can discuss other option like name on driver suit, placement on kart, and even on our car.

 

 

If we don’t reach our goal

Well here’s hoping we do. If not we will see if we can make it on what we do raise, and what dad has.  If we can’t then we may extend the time frame and raise money for another huge event this November in Vegas with the SKUSA series. This is a cool event because it attracts people from around the world, including pro drivers from F1, NASCAR, and IRL. This event too would be huge for me.  So one way or another I will have a time to remember for life and learn ever so much.

 

The Impact you will have

Without your help I won’t be able to go.  I have learned and done so much in such a short time, this will just help increase my abilities.  I will work so hard.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute you can still help just by spreading the word about what I am doing. If you know someone who may sponsor me, let them know.

If you have a restaurant in town a meal would save us some money.

If you know a way we can get a hotel stay for free that helps us save too.

Any other ideas will be greatly appreciated.

 

Thanks for any help and thanks to my dad for his help with this. (Yes he knows his pucuation, and things are not perfectJ).

http://youtu.be/uovvel7DWQ0

story:
Our Story

Like many people in America I am a single woman with inadequate medical coverage. The doctor says I need to have a hysterectomy, but I only have 1/2 the $4000 co-pay. It is sad that in "the land of plenty" the difference between life and death is $2000. 


The Impact

If I don't have the surgery I will just get sicker and sicker and the pathology that can be solved right now with a simple surgery will progress to needing chemo and other interventions that are even more expensive and put more of a burden on the health care system. In addition, I lose my quality of life, and my vitality and the world loses the impact that my joy and self expression has on them.


What We Need & What You Get

The total cost of the surgery to me is $8000. They will not perform the surgery without the $4000. I have $2000 of that so far. If I raise additional funds it will go to the remaining $4000 and after that I will use the money to pay for the expenses during the 2 weeks of unpaid leave I have to take for recovery.


Other Ways You Can Help

I have done a good job of caring for other people and will continue to do so as I heal. Please pass my cause on to other people. Every little bit helps.

story:
Our Story

Hello - we are the Meeks and Days - Bobby, Larisa, Annie and Trey Meeks and Louis, Madeline and Max Day.  We are a blended family in Memphis, TN.  We found out about the scripture memorization camp at a homeschool convention last year and thought that it would be a fantastic way for our family to grow as Christians this summer.  It takes place in Conway, AR from June 27 - July 1st.


The children are each learning 50 -100 verses (based on age/grade).


We have decided to use this website as a tool to raise the funds to go to the camp and thank you for your consideration...


The Impact

We have seen our children grow spiritually over the past few months as they have dug into the scripture books.  All five children (as well as we parents) have been working to get the verses memorized and still have a ways to go.  This opportunity will forever etch God's word on the children's hearts.  Our prayer is that this will positively guide the children in their lives as they are presented with chances and choices to make God honoring decisions.


This camp is great - it offers learning series for preschoolers - adults (including a Collegiate Series).  The camp rules stress modest dress codes, NO ELECTRONIC DEVICES to distract kids and divide families, and it allows families to go to camp together!


What We Need

We are trying to cover the cost of the trip to camp through this web site.  

The base cost: 

$800 = $650 for the family registration and $150 for gas

$300 = new tires for the van so we don't have to drive 400 miles on faith

Above and beyond:

$???? - reward (all money over the goal will be divided amongst the children for completing the course)


NOTE: There is a small fee taken out by this site for processing the credit card payments - and PayPal charges a fee on top of that if you choose to pay via PayPal.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to pledge to the children that you will reward them directly for their success at camp when they return, please do so.  We should have some sort of "score sheet" that will tell how many verses they have memorized.  So it may motivate them well to be offered 25 cents a verse for example. 


Also, please feel free to pass this site address along to anyone who may want to help us make this trip.  


Thank you so much for your support...  

Bobby Meeks

story:
Please Help Enedina:

My Mother-in-Law, Enedina Barajas, is 67 years old and lives in Guadalajara, Mexico where she has lived for her entire life. She has recently been diagnosed with stage 4 Gastro-Intestinal cancer and now has a large, baseball-sized, tumor that needs to be removed. She also needs blood transfusions and Chemotherapy. Enedina has been admitted into a public, state funded medical center instead of a private hospital. The service and treatment in this facility is slow due to the physicians being overwhelmed with the sheer numbers of people crowded into the small rooms. The room Enedina is in has 8 other patients and the cleanliness of it is far below what most would call acceptable. Enedina's bed is small and she has said it's uncomfortable. Dried blood was seen on the floor of the room during the last visit and looked as though it had been there for some time. As of now, the process is very slow and frustrating because Enedina is continually losing weight and needs surgery and Chemotherapy as soon as possible.

Enedina is wonderful, charismatic woman who has raised four beautiful daughters and as a mother and friend has always been willing to help when she can and go without so others wouldn't have to. Things have never been easy financially for the family, but she has always  kept her head up and a smile on her face during difficult times. She has always thought keeping her family healthy and happy has been more important than how much money is made.  Enedina's husband, Candelario, and she have been together for over 45 years. He is a quiet man who, as an electrician, is frequently looking for work to help pay the bills and put food on the table.

 Enedina's daughter, Brenda, and I live in Fort Collins, Colorado. Brenda has left her job and has gone to Guadalajara with our 11 month old daughter, Maya, to do anything she can to help her sick mother. This is the first time Enedina has seen her newest grandchild. I have stayed behind with our 3 year old boy so I can try to make a little extra money to help out as well. Brenda has two other sisters who are also doing everything possible to contribute to their mother's medical care. 

The medical costs, even in the state run medical center, are far above what any of us can afford. Chemotherapy, for example, runs approximately $1500 per treatment and she needs a minimum of six treatments. Brenda is beside herself every time she calls to give me updates on her mother's progress. She knows she has to return to the United States soon and only wants to see that her mother is recieving the proper care for her illness before she has to leave.

We would be more than grateful for any donations received which would be directly forwarded to Enedina to help with the medical costs incurred. Thank you in advance for your kindness and generosity in helping us during this extremely difficult time.

                                                                                             John
story_txt:
Please Help Enedina:
My Mother-in-Law, Enedina Barajas, is 67 years old and lives in Guadalajara, Mexico where she has lived for her entire life. She has recently been diagnosed with stage 4 Gastro-Intestinal cancer and now has a large, baseball-sized, tumor that needs to be removed. She also needs blood transfusions and Chemotherapy. Enedina has been admitted into a public, state funded medical center instead of a private hospital. The service and treatment in this facility is slow due to the physicians being overwhelmed with the sheer numbers of people crowded into the small rooms. The room Enedina is in has 8 other patients and the cleanliness of it is far below what most would call acceptable. Enedina's bed is small and she has said it's uncomfortable. Dried blood was seen on the floor of the room during the last visit and looked as though it had been there for some time. As of now, the process is very slow and frustrating because Enedina is continually losing weight and needs surgery and Chemotherapy as soon as possible.
Enedina is wonderful, charismatic woman who has raised four beautiful daughters and as a mother and friend has always been willing to help when she can and go without so others wouldn't have to. Things have never been easy financially for the family, but she has always  kept her head up and a smile on her face during difficult times. She has always thought keeping her family healthy and happy has been more important than how much money is made.  Enedina's husband, Candelario, and she have been together for over 45 years. He is a quiet man who, as an electrician, is frequently looking for work to help pay the bills and put food on the table.
 Enedina's daughter, Brenda, and I live in Fort Collins, Colorado. Brenda has left her job and has gone to Guadalajara with our 11 month old daughter, Maya, to do anything she can to help her sick mother. This is the first time Enedina has seen her newest grandchild. I have stayed behind with our 3 year old boy so I can try to make a little extra money to help out as well. Brenda has two other sisters who are also doing everything possible to contribute to their mother's medical care. 
The medical costs, even in the state run medical center, are far above what any of us can afford. Chemotherapy, for example, runs approximately $1500 per treatment and she needs a minimum of six treatments. Brenda is beside herself every time she calls to give me updates on her mother's progress. She knows she has to return to the United States soon and only wants to see that her mother is recieving the proper care for her illness before she has to leave.
We would be more than grateful for any donations received which would be directly forwarded to Enedina to help with the medical costs incurred. Thank you in advance for your kindness and generosity in helping us during this extremely difficult time.
                                                                                             John

story:
This Fund is to Help Danny Move

Daniel's Moving Assistance Fund

 

When I started Daniel's Power Chair Assistance Fund I had been fighting with Medicare vendors for EIGHT MONTHS. My doctor had been fighting right along with me, and all I was thinking about was getting a power chair before I feel and hurt myslef bad. 

I failed to consider HOW I would get the power chair OUT of my apartment...

I failed to consider HOW I would get the power chair INTO my apartment...

ALONE


            When the fund hit $5,000.00 I was overjoyed! In addition, I started thinking. I started thinking about what I was going to do next. It quickly became very clear I didn't think this through. I live alone, and only have help a few times a week. 

            Now I would have a way to get around town, but no way to get the chair down stairs. I cannot depend on others in the building. I worked, hard, to get people moved out of the building (because they brought 'unsavory' traffic into the building) and those left were cautious to mad at me. There was no way I would get help.

            As well, I would be a target in my new power chair, for anyone that had a problem with me helping get people evicted. So, my situation has become untenable, and I need help affording to move. This is when I realized my horrible mistake, and became scared and concerned.

 

The Story

            When I became disabled, I was working as a property manager for Domino Realty of Beverly Hills. I was unable to work, but I still lived on the property. The residents knew where I lived, and the management company did not hire anyone competent. They went through two managers in just one month. After that, all the residents would call me, or come by my apartment when something went wrong.

            One night, at Two AM, I had a knock at my door. I opened it to find one of my residents. She was 22 years old and had just got off her shift at the UCLA hospital. She was a med student. She had lost her keys, and was locked out of her apartment. UCLA was having a problem with a rapist, on the campus. She did not want to sit outside the building (it was a secure building) and wait two hours for a locksmith to show up and let her into the building then her apartment.

            I helped her. I was not supposed to work but I just could not leave her alone in that situation. I let her into the building and then unlocked her front door. Two weeks later a fire alarm went off, in the building. I was watching as three fire trucks pulled up. But they could not get into the building. The management company forgot to put a ‘Knock Switch’ on the front gate. This ‘knock switch’ allows Police and Fire departments a way into secure buildings.

            I walked up and let the firemen into the building. The fire chief, who was there on the property, told me

“You just saved your company a $5,000.00 fine. They should give you a raise!”

            Instead, the following Monday I was fired. Fired for “Insubordination and Working While Disabled”. When I was fired, I was also given an eviction notice. I was not given the chance to live there, I was given Three Days to move. I contacted the U.S. Department of  Labor and told I had a “case” for wrongful dismissal and they would help me because my employer was not offering FMLA leave for me or other workers. I was told to “fight the eviction, we will have your job back before you go to court”.

            The Department of Labor did not help me; they helped everyone else at Domino. All future employees had to be covered by FMLA, but my case was dropped. I ended up getting evicted in October 2003. Now, when I go to try and rent, most property managers do not want to rent to me, and those who will want “Double Deposits and extra security deposits” just to rent to me. I have not been able to afford those steep costs, and have stayed where I am.

What I Need

  • $150 Electricity Deposit (I have not had electricity in my name for many years. This is what they require for me to get electricity in my name)
  • $2,200.00 Rental Deposits – This is equal to ‘First and Last’ month’s rent. Average rent is $1,100.00 a month for a Bachelor to One Bedroom.
  • $750 - $1,000.00 – For a ‘Security Deposit’. This would be on top of the ‘First and Last’
  • $875 - $1,000.00 – For Moving me. I am incapable of moving anything beyond myself. I can try to find people, but I have few friends here, anymore. (Being disabled does that to friendships)

That equals $3,975.00 - $4,350.00. I will set the funding goal of $4,000.00 and hope for the best.

 

Conclusion

            I had a hard enough time, starting the first campaign and coming to people asking for assistance. This is no different. I don’t want to ask for help, but if I don’t or if I fail? I will have a power chair but; no way to get in and out on my own and in the building I am currently living in I will be a slow moving target in a $5,000.00 power chair. Most of you have seen the video of my abusive neighbor. She is one of the nice neighbors!

            I would not be safe, here, in my power chair. There is no building security and no elevator. I need to be able to move to a Senior Building. Not an “Assisted Living” building, I am not asking for that much help. Just a senior building, something with an elevator and an older and more mature population, where I can be safe and get in and out on my own.

            The building I was looking at, and have talked to the manager, is just about two blocks from a small mall with a Wal-Mart and a Sears. This will help a lot with getting prescriptions and food and sundries. It also has a movie theater, and it has been more than eight years since I have sat in a theater and watched a movie.

            I am sorry. I am sorry that I didn’t think about everything I would need when I started Daniel’s Power Chair Assistance Fund. I am sorry that I have to ask for your assistance, again. I am sorry, but I do need your help, again. I have every intention to:

  • Provide documentation of HOW all monies from BOTH  campaigns are spent
  • Continue to keep everyone updated on my condition 
  • Keep writing the stories I am sharing well into the fall… and beyond
  • Never EVER forget what everyone has done to help me
  • Use any extra money JUST for medical needs or things like pots and pans

IF you decide to assist me, I will be forever in your debt. I will never forget what people  have done for me, and I promise to ‘Pay it Forward’.

Thank you. Thank you for reading. Thank you for caring. Thank you for your kindness. Thank you for your support. Thank you for your contributions.

From the bottom of my heart “Thank You!”

story:
For this Indiegogo campaign, we have teamed up with BirthWays as our fiscal sponsor to give you the benefit of making your donation tax deductible.  

Starting in December 2012, birthing families in the Bay Area will be able to enjoy a safe and welcoming birth space at Pacifica Family Maternity Center.  In order to make this possible, we need your support.  Our dream is for Pacifica to feel like a home to the families we serve, and your tax deductible donation will help us furnish the birth center with furniture and supplies needed to achieve this.  Pacifica is the only birth center in the East Bay that accepts MediCal and we need your help in making out-of-hospital births and midwifery care an option for women and families in all socioeconomic groups.

Who we are...

Pacifica Family Maternity Center is a community supported birth center committed to offering midwifery care to Bay Area women and their families during pregnancy, birth, and the postpartum time. We offer individualized care focused on the unique needs of each family in a safe, home-like environment.

We understand that having a baby is a very important life experience and transition for a woman and her family.

Our goal is to provide personalized, safe, and professional care throughout the child-bearing years.  We understand the importance of informed decision making for a woman and offer our support to ensure that our services are addressing her needs and desires.  

We are committed to serving all birthing families regardless of ethnicity, age, gender, sexual orientation, economic status, immigration status, or physical ability.

 

 

What we need...

Your tax deductible donation will go towards buying homey furnishings and supplies necessary for the births. Once the renovations are complete, there will be two complete birth rooms, one overflow birth room, a classroom, a family room, a room for pre-natal appointments, an office and a living room area.  With over 2500 square feet to furnish, we have plenty of space to lovingly transform with your help.  A safe and home-like environment is integral in putting women at ease and aiding in the birthing process. 

Why it is important...

Pacifica provides an opportunity for women and families of all socioeconomic groups to gain the benefits of midwifery care and out-of-hospital birth. Where to give birth is a decision that should be in the hands of women and families, not insurance companies.  Pacifica gives women a choice. Pacifica understands that birth can be a natural and joyous experience and does not view it as a medical procedure to be feared. Pacifica provides women a place to birth that has fewer risks of medical intervention, greater freedom and increased sense of satisfaction.  All women deserve this option and now, with Pacifica, women and families have a choice. 

How Indiegogo works...

Indiegogo is a crowdfunding platform where people who want to raise money can create fundraising campaigns to tell their story and get the word out.  People all over the world are using Indiegogo—both to raise money and to contribute to other people’s passions.

Our passion is safe and empowering births for women and their families. We believe birth center births and midwifery care should be an option for all women.  

We are offering mutiple perks to thank you for your support.  Please look at the column to the right and choose from a variety of healing arts sessions, vacation getaways and other gifts. 

Other ways you can help...

We understand that not everyone will be able to make a financial contribution, but please know that every dollar counts towards us reaching our goal, and every effort you make to promote the project will help us reach more potential backers.  

If you could help promote this project on facebook, twitter and to your contacts, we would be incredibly grateful.  Please utilize the Indiegogo share tools to ease your promotion efforts. 

We are also accepting in kind donations of furniture.  Our wish list includes, lamps, rugs, plants, beds, bedding, kitchen supplies, a sectional coach, an office chair, a filing cabinet and more.  

The contribution of time, skill, inspiration and constructive feedback are essential to the gestation and birth of Pacifica.  

Please contact Rebecca at pikahusband@gmail.com if you have items to donate or you are interested in volunteering.  Your support is appreciated in any form.

 

With sincere gratitude,

Sonja Cahoon and Cindy Lara Haag

The Midwives of Pacifica Family Maternity Center

story:
Oh, come on, you remember Tom! 

Tom Saffle is an alumni of Whitehall Yearling High School, Class of 1978 (the greatest EVER!)

Tom was diagnosed with Stage 4 Prostate Cancer last year.  Against all odds, he is still among us!  (told you he was awesome!)  However, in the past couple of months, he isn't doing very well.

At the end of this year, Tom will no longer have the health insurance that he needs in order to keep fighting.  (thanks Obamacare)

We are kicking off this campaign in an effort to help relieve some of the expenses that are being incurred.

Details will be posted on facebook, and we hope that you will help Tom & Connie with your contribution.

story:
Short description

According to law everyone has a right to get a medical treatment. Because of the language barriers, many immigrants cannot make any use out of this right. With our project „Understanding can heal“ we want to help the refugees to understand German doctors and get a proper medical treatment faster. These people are struggling for their life and suffer from physical and psychological issues. And they need help. With this funding we will be able to give 1330 hours of medical interpreting to support refugees.

Our company specializes on medical interpreting and translating. German government is overloaded with paperwork and amount of people they try to help out. Interpreters are urgently needed and we have them!

What makes our project unique?

MedLango team members are immigrants and know which problems people are facing when they move to another country. When it comes refugees, there are no more difficulties or problems we are talking about – there is pain.  Each one of our workers used to be medical interpreters and gained a lot of experience by accompanying foreign patients to German doctors. There so many important details like knowing the difference in cultures and finding the right way to explain what is going on to a foreign person. 

Because of the miscommunication between a patient and a doctor, there are 34.000 medical errors in Germany only. We can decrease this number. We want to help surpass language barriers. Moreover, we want to help refugees to feel safe and give them opportunity to get a high-classified medical treatment.

Our goal

We want to raise 30.000€ to give 1330 hours of medical interpreting for refugees in Berlin.

Important for all the funders: we are a company, but this is our non-profit project. It takes too long for governmental organizations to find an interpreter and then to arrange an appointment, and then to send out the payment. We launched this campaign in order to start helping people right now and not 6 month later. We calculate about 2 hours per person (or in some cases for a group of people), so that with 30.000 we are able to help 665 refugees. The money we raise is going to be used to pay the interpreters  (including VAT and little processing fee). It’s a lot of work that is why 4 team members dedicate themselves to this project completely: they contact refugee camps, ask what languages are needed the most, coordinate the whole process etc. 

Help as much as you can and have a look at our big plans:

·  30.000€  for Berlin;

·  60.000€  for Berlin, Munich;

·  90.000€  for Berlin, Munich, Hamburg; 

·  120.000€ for Berlin, Munich, Hamburg, Dortmund; 

·  150.000€ for Berlin, Munich, Hamburg, Dortmund, Dresden; 

·  180.000€ for Berlin, Munich, Hamburg, Dortmund, Dresden, Leipzig.

story:
Hey there, I'm Krtin Nithiyanandam, I'm 15 years old and I live in Epsom, UK. I'm very interested in science and I have been doing a lot of science projects in my spare time. 

Last year, while I was off school for three months after fracturing my hip, I got the chance to work on a project for the earlier diagnosis and treatment of Alzheimer's disease. I ended up creating a bispecific antibody conjugated to a quantum dot, which has both diagnostic and therapeutic potential. This is an antibody that is specific to two different antigens (targets) and which is also bound to a nanoparticle that shows up on an MRI and fNIR scan. The nanoparticle also immobilises the toxic Aβ protein and displays therapeutic potential. 

I received international recognition by winning the Scientific American Innovator Award at the Google Science Fair.  


About Alzheimer's Disease

Alzheimer's disease is a debilitating disease that impairs memory and it is notorious for the fact that there are no drugs to stop or even slow down the progression of the disease. Alzheimer's disease is becoming increasingly relevant due to our growing aging population. We have made breakthroughs in the treatments of cardiovascular diseases, cancer, diabetes and now people are living longer than ever before, which is incredible! However, it also means that the cases of dementia are on the rise.

There are approximately 8 million new cases each year and this disease affects over 44 million people worldwide, with that set to triple in the next 30 years - therefore it is so important that new discoveries are being made in the field to find new treatments for this disease. This disease costed society USD $604 billion in 2010 due to the lack of treatments available. Additionally, immense amounts of pressure are put on carers and this disease has a broad impact on society because it affects the patient but also the people caring for them. 


My Research 

Current diagnostic approaches identify amyloid beta (Aβ) plaques, which are present during the later stages of Alzheimer's disease after the onset of symptoms. I realised there was a necessity for an earlier diagnostic tool and decided to investigate further.
Aβ oligomers are the precursors to the plaques and are present in much higher concentrations in the brains of Alzheimer’s patients. This increase appears during the earliest stage of the disease, making Aβ oligomers an attractive biomarker. However, there are other species of Aβ, many of which are present in cognitively healthy people, therefore it is important that only the oligomeric Aβ  is detected to avoid misdiagnosis. 

A major problem is that most diagnostics and therapeutics cannot cross the blood-brain barrier. The blood-brain barrier is a protective barrier that restricts the substances that are allowed to enter into the brain. To overcome this, current drugs are administered through a lumbar puncture (spinal puncture) which is very invasive and risky. One technique being developed to cross the blood-brain barrier is to use transferrin receptors. Their normal function is to get iron into cells, and because the brain needs iron too, they are able to get through the barrier.


I engineered a molecular 'Trojan Horse' that binds to Aβ oligomers and transferrin receptors so it has the potential to cross the blood-brain barrier and bind with the toxic Aβ oligomers. This is the bispecific antibody section of the compound. I also synthesised a quantum dot which would be bound to the bispecific antibody, ultimately creating the therapeutic compound. 


I performed surface plasmon resonance to estimate their affinity to Aβ oligomers and to transferrin receptors (TfRs). The molecular compounds' cross-reactivity with various other species of Aβ was also determined.                

The molecular compound exhibited optical properties that were suitable for non-invasive imaging by means of fNIR and MRI, allowing for multimodal diagnosis. These molecular 'Trojan Horses' have the potential to cross the blood-brain barrier and be used as a sensitive, minimally-invasive tool for the earlier diagnosis of Alzheimer's Disease. Additionally, the synthesised molecular compound displayed therapeutic properties by immobilising the toxic Aβ oligomers and increasing the viability of surrounding neurones. 

I am  also developing this molecular compound so it can potentially be used for the minimally-invasive diagnosis and treatment of other neurodegenerative diseases such as Parkinson's disease which begins with amyloid abnormalities and thus could help millions of people worldwide.  

The images above are from my patent application, with my research being patent-pending. 


Reception

The research I had been carrying out was received by an international audience of academics and the public and the research was commended by different organisations and researchers. (http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/science/science...)
The research won me a place at the finals of the National Science and Engineering Competition (2016) and the Scientific American Award at the prestigious international Google Science Fair (2015). Since then, I have presented this at the World Extreme Medicine Conference and it received a positive response from doctors and industry experts.  
I have also been looking at developing this project and taking it into trials and this is where I need your help! I feel that your contributions would be  important because I want to see the project through and take it as far as possible so that one day, it could actually help doctors to save lives!  


What We Need


The majority of the funding for my drug to move forwards has already been secured however I need to raise £30,000 to ensure that all the necessary costs are satisfied. 

The funding will be required for the chemical synthesis of the drug and also some of the money will go towards the purchase of antibody samples and cell cultures, which are inevitably expensive due to their extraction and purification procedures. Additionally, funding will be necessary to prepare solutions and buffers required for the synthesis of the quantum dots. All the necessary preparations required before and during trials also require funding because the bispecific antibody conjugated to quantum dots will need to be synthesised on a larger scale than they were being synthesised previously.  By helping to progress my project via funding, I can bring it to trials sooner and you will be playing a part in ensuring that my drug could be helping patients sooner.  

Additionally, computer software will also need to be used for the simulation of drug interactions in an in vivo model and to collate the data in appropriate formats, such as a non-linear curve regression for affinity analysis. Computer software with such capabilities also have attached costs and some of the funding will go towards the purchase of the software that will enable us to conduct research. 

I am asking for this through crowdfunding so all the proceeds can go directly to my project as opposed to applying for a grant where I only receive about 50%-60% of the funding. The funding will go to ARUK. 

Any extra funding would mean I do more research however if the funding goal isn't reached, I will still put the money into carrying out the research but the research I can carry out will not be as substantial as it could be and it will take longer for my research to reach trials.
The Impact
Alzheimer's is a cruel disease and anybody who has had a loved one struck by this disease will understand its truly cruel consequences. Alzheimer's disease affects people on a global scale, with over 44 million people affected right now. This disease is considered to be one of the greatest medical challenges of the 21st century and more research and awareness of this disease is important in the fight against it. By helping me to take my research into trials, it means that you will also be a part of the fight against dementia and ensure that newer discoveries are being made at a faster rate, to ensure that people have the best chances of survival from this  disease.


Risks

As always, there will be risks with the project. The research so far has been acknowledged by different professionals and has been presented at international conferences, with the general consensus being the research is very valid. Health and safety is a key priority and that is why I will always have to undergo substantial health and safety training and be supervised by a researcher.

We will not be sure that the drug works until the trials begin; I need your backing for this! Nevertheless, the results achieved so far have opened a gateway for new neurodegenerative research and will pave a way for the development of neurodegenerative drug design. These results will feed into other work being done by scientists around the world so we can develop better tools to fight dementia.


Media Reception

This project received international media recognition. Below are some of the most significant articles concerning my research:

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/science/science-news/11734666/15-year-old-schoolboy-develops-test-for-Alzheimers-disease.html

http://www.vsointernational.org/news/blog/9-young-people-who-are-changing-the-world

http://blogs.scientificamerican.com/budding-scientist/teens-tackle-alzheimer-s-disease-vaccine-shortages-at-google-science-fair/

http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/british-teen-develops-groundbreaking-test-alzheimers-disease-1510729

http://www.sciencetimes.com/articles/6970/20150714/british-boy-may-have-found-the-way-to-detect-alzheimer-s-disease.htm

http://www.medicaldaily.com/alzheimers-diagnostic-test-developed-15-year-old-brit-may-both-diagnose-and-prevent-342840

https://uk.news.yahoo.com/schoolboy-15-creates-test-dementia-102007430.html

http://www.suttonguardian.co.uk/news/14091209.International_recognition_for_Sutton_schoolboy_who_developed_test_for_Alzheimer_s/

https://tedxgateway2015.wordpress.com/2015/07/24/krtin-nithyanandam-15-year-old-who-has-developed-a-test-of-alzheimers/

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/07/13/teen...

Hey there, I'm Krtin Nithiyanandam, I'm 15 years old and I live in Epsom, UK. I'm very interested in science and I have been doing a lot of science projects in my spare time. 

Last year, while I was off school for three months after fracturing my hip, I got the chance to work on a project for the earlier diagnosis and treatment of Alzheimer's disease. I ended up creating a bispecific antibody conjugated to a quantum dot, which has both diagnostic and therapeutic potential. This is an antibody that is specific to two different antigens (targets) and which is also bound to a nanoparticle that shows up on an MRI and fNIR scan. The nanoparticle also immobilises the toxic Aβ protein and displays therapeutic potential. 
I received international recognition by winning the Scientific American Innovator Award at the Google Science Fair.  




About Alzheimer's Disease

Alzheimer's disease is a debilitating disease that impairs memory and it is notorious for the fact that there are no drugs to stop or even slow down the progression of the disease. Alzheimer's disease is becoming increasingly relevant due to our growing aging population. We have made breakthroughs in the treatments of cardiovascular diseases, cancer, diabetes and now people are living longer than ever before, which is incredible! However, it also means that the cases of dementia are on the rise.
There are approximately 8 million new cases each year and this disease affects over 44 million people worldwide, with that set to triple in the next 30 years - therefore it is so important that new discoveries are being made in the field to find new treatments for this disease. This disease costed society USD $604 billion in 2010 due to the lack of treatments available. Additionally, immense amounts of pressure are put on carers and this disease has a broad impact on society because it affects the patient but also the people caring for them. 


My Research 


Current diagnostic approaches identify amyloid beta (Aβ) plaques, which are present during the later stages of Alzheimer's disease after the onset of symptoms. I realised there was a necessity for an earlier diagnostic tool and decided to investigate further.


Aβ oligomers are the precursors to the plaques and are present in much higher concentrations in the brains of Alzheimer’s patients. This increase appears during the earliest stage of the disease, making Aβ oligomers an attractive biomarker. However, there are other species of Aβ, many of which are present in cognitively healthy people, therefore it is important that only the oligomeric Aβ  is detected to avoid misdiagnosis. 



A major problem is that most diagnostics and therapeutics cannot cross the blood-brain barrier. The blood-brain barrier is a protective barrier that restricts the substances that are allowed to enter into the brain. To overcome this, current drugs are administered through a lumbar puncture (spinal puncture) which is very invasive and risky. One technique being developed to cross the blood-brain barrier is to use transferrin receptors. Their normal function is to get iron into cells, and because the brain needs iron too, they are able to get through the barrier.



I engineered a molecular 'Trojan Horse' that binds to Aβ oligomers and transferrin receptors so it has the potential to cross the blood-brain barrier and bind with the toxic Aβ oligomers. This is the bispecific antibody section of the compound. I also synthesised a quantum dot which would be bound to the bispecific antibody, ultimately creating the therapeutic compound. 



I performed surface plasmon resonance to estimate their affinity to Aβ oligomers and to transferrin receptors (TfRs). The molecular compounds' cross-reactivity with various other species of Aβ was also determined.                


The molecular compound exhibited optical properties that were suitable for non-invasive imaging by means of fNIR and MRI, allowing for multimodal diagnosis. These molecular 'Trojan Horses' have the potential to cross the blood-brain barrier and be used as a sensitive, minimally-invasive tool for the earlier diagnosis of Alzheimer's Disease. Additionally, the synthesised molecular compound displayed therapeutic properties by immobilising the toxic Aβ oligomers and increasing the viability of surrounding neurones. 
I am  also developing this molecular compound so it can potentially be used for the minimally-invasive diagnosis and treatment of other neurodegenerative diseases such as Parkinson's disease which begins with amyloid abnormalities and thus could help millions of people worldwide.  


The images above are from my patent application, with my research being patent-pending. 

Reception



The research I had been carrying out was received by an international audience of academics and the public and the research was commended by different organisations and researchers. (http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/science/science...)


The research won me a place at the finals of the National Science and Engineering Competition (2016) and the Scientific American Award at the prestigious international Google Science Fair (2015). Since then, I have presented this at the World Extreme Medicine Conference and it received a positive response from doctors and industry experts.  
I have also been looking at developing this project and taking it into trials and this is where I need your help! I feel that your contributions would be  important because I want to see the project through and take it as far as possible so that one day, it could actually help doctors to save lives!  




What We Need




The majority of the funding for my drug to move forwards has already been secured however I need to raise £30,000 to ensure that all the necessary costs are satisfied. 



The funding will be required for the chemical synthesis of the drug and also some of the money will go towards the purchase of antibody samples and cell cultures, which are inevitably expensive due to their extraction and purification procedures. Additionally, funding will be necessary to prepare solutions and buffers required for the synthesis of the quantum dots. All the necessary preparations required before and during trials also require funding because the bispecific antibody conjugated to quantum dots will need to be synthesised on a larger scale than they were being synthesised previously.  By helping to progress my project via funding, I can bring it to trials sooner and you will be playing a part in ensuring that my drug could be helping patients sooner.  



Additionally, computer software will also need to be used for the simulation of drug interactions in an in vivo model and to collate the data in appropriate formats, such as a non-linear curve regression for affinity analysis. Computer software with such capabilities also have attached costs and some of the funding will go towards the purchase of the software that will enable us to conduct research. 



I am asking for this through crowdfunding so all the proceeds can go directly to my project as opposed to applying for a grant where I only receive about 50%-60% of the funding. The funding will go to ARUK. 



Any extra funding would mean I do more research however if the funding goal isn't reached, I will still put the money into carrying out the research but the research I can carry out will not be as substantial as it could be and it will take longer for my research to reach trials.

The Impact

Alzheimer's is a cruel disease and anybody who has had a loved one struck by this disease will understand its truly cruel consequences. Alzheimer's disease affects people on a global scale, with over 44 million people affected right now. This disease is considered to be one of the greatest medical challenges of the 21st century and more research and awareness of this disease is important in the fight against it. By helping me to take my research into trials, it means that you will also be a part of the fight against dementia and ensure that newer discoveries are being made at a faster rate, to ensure that people have the best chances of survival from this  disease.

As always, there will be risks with the project. The research so far has been acknowledged by different professionals and has been presented at international conferences, with the general consensus being the research is very valid. Health and safety is a key priority and that is why I will always have to undergo substantial health and safety training and be supervised by a researcher.
We will not be sure that the drug works until the trials begin; I need your backing for this! Nevertheless, the results achieved so far have opened a gateway for new neurodegenerative research and will pave a way for the development of neurodegenerative drug design. These results will feed into other work being done by scientists around the world so we can develop better tools to fight dementia.

story:
Hey everyone! 

As most of you may know, Im a single mom of three beautiful girls. My middle daughter, Alex, who is 14, was diagnosed in Oct with Chiari Malformation 1, but has been suffering since May from a head injury, which they think kickstarted her symptoms. Recently we went to a Neurosurgeon and she did in fact confirm it. She then sent us to have her eyes examined and they found that she has pressure from the Chiari causing swelling in her right eye. She will in fact have surgery, we are just now waiting on the NS to get back with us on when. I had recently been hired on as a preschool teacher with our local school district, full time with benefits, which I had been fighting for for months. Now I had to put in my resignation due to the fact that Alex cannot be left alone for very long. Part of her symptoms shes been having is memory loss, black outs, balance issues, pressure pains in the right side of her head, etc. Since I cannot work due to needing to be home with her, her constant appts, and the surgery (the estimated time according to the NS), I am having a hard time with travel expenses to and from her appts, which is over an hour away. Medical expenses and paying bills. The only income that we currently have is the childsupport and fd stamps. I havent even been able to do any Christmas shopping and its 9 days away. If anyone would like to help us, it would be much appreciated at this very stressful time for us. 


Thank you!

story:
The Amber Jewel

Our goal is to expedite the process of locating a missing child and to deter criminals and lowlifes from snatching kids in the first place.

Upon activation, the Amber Jewel will send you (the parent) an update every few minutes with the coordinates of your child.

You can also view you child's location anytime in real-time.

Or, using our simple App, you can quickly set up "Safe Zones" with times and locations and Amber Jewel will notify you if your child leaves the designated zone when they shouldn't.

The Amber Jewel and our App makes it easy for the police to quickly find your child and rescue them from possible harm or worse…

By joining this Indiegogo project at any pledge level, you could help save a child.

Who is it for?

Parents and Grandparents who want to significantly reduce the risk of their (grand)child being abducted.

Why?

According to the statistics, by the time you finish reading this Indiegogo, approximately 4 kids will be taken from their families...

...About now, a parent has discovered their child is missing and is going through an emotional roller coaster of terror, fear and worse…

Our goal is to make it next to impossible for people like Ariel Castro to get away with abducting, sexually assaulting and beating children, or worse. Had the technology existed just a decade ago, we’re confident those poor girls would have quickly and easily been rescued and Ariel sent to jail then.

How Amber Jewel Works

Amber Jewel is easy to use and set up. Disguised as a necklace or a watch, or even hidden in your child's clothing, the Amber Jewel can be triggered in a number of ways:

  1. If a perpetrator tries to pull the Amber Jewel off.
  2. If a kidnapper attempts to cut the Amber Jewel off.
  3. If the child activates the device via the special SOS button.
  4. If the battery dies (it warns you when the battery is low so you can recharge it).
  5. If you have remotely triggered the device.
  6. If a parent has logged into the secure website to report an abduction.
  7. If your child has left the “safe zone” you’ve created in the App.

Once the Amber Jewel has been activated, the device’s location is “pinged” and within a matter of minutes, your child’s coordinates will be relayed to you with ongoing updates in real time to give to your local police.

By radically speeding up the location process, an abducted child has a better chance of being returned unharmed thanks to the Amber Jewel device.

How the App Works to Help Keep Your Child Safe and Give You Peace of Mind

The Amber Jewel “Safe Zone” App offers you complete flexibility and control in setting up real-time alarms to inform you when your child leaves a safe zone (like school, the park or a friend's house) when they shouldn’t. You will also be able to set time-based rules for when your child should be inside or outside each zone.

The App also provides you with other valuable information and alerts such as low battery life alerts.

Example of setting up your child's safe zone using our App - It's easy!


My Story

A few months ago I was in a business meeting where I had turned my ringer off. After the meeting was over, I checked my messages as I normally do to discover a voice mail message from my 8-year-old daughter saying mom was sick so she was walking to school on her own.

I immediately jumped into my car and headed toward the school hoping and praying I’d find her walking to the school.

Fortunately this story has a happy ending and I found her a mile down the street from the house. She had still crossed a major six lane intersection before I could get to her. But the stress… the scary, horrific thoughts and scenarios wouldn’t stop running through my mind. And that’s what got me thinking:

“What if there was a way for me to keep track of my daughter’s location and if she went ‘out of bounds’ or left the “safe zones” I set up, I would get a text notification right away so I could check up and make sure everything was okay?”

Like every good parent, this would give me so much peace of mind in a world gone crazy.

But after scouring the Internet I couldn’t find anything that was remotely good enough. Everything I found was either outrageously expensive or worse, easily recognized and quickly removed by a kidnapper, thereby defeating the purpose of the device.

Enter the Amber Jewel.

We all know time is of the essence when it comes to rescuing kidnap victims.

I shared the idea with a few of my friends and they all agreed – it’s a brilliant idea, but if the Amber Jewel became popular; then would-be abductors would eventually figure out a way to remove it and get away with the child.

So I went back to the drawing board and came up with what I believe to be a brilliant solution:

What if the Amber Jewel was small enough to be put into a shoe?

Or hidden or sewn into a piece of clothing? Etc…

This would mean the only people who would know about it would be you – the parent!

Or better yet, what if the necklace or watch wasn’t easily removable by force? Or if it was removed, you immediately got a text alert along with GPS coordinates?

All my friends agreed that I’m on the right track with the Amber Jewel.

So I’ve turned to Indiegogo to help me realize this idea and bring it to market so we can help put an end to child abductions once and for all.

Where are we in development?

Once I got the idea, I sat down and drew some sketches of what I thought it should look like and how it would work. I also turned to several of my software programs that we've developed in-house for my business and looked at how we could re-purpose some of the code and technology for this project.

The great news is one of our past projects incorporates much of the code and technology we would want and need for the Amber Jewel App.

This has saved us months of App development time and allowed us to create a "bare bones" basic version of what will eventually be the final Amber Jewel App. We're now focused on the following:

  1. Finalizing the engineering schematics for the product.

  2. Refining the user experience in the App as well as the App itself.

With your help, we will soon begin the process of:

  • Designing the packaging.
  • Getting product certifications
  • Designing the supply chain process
  • Tooling
  • Materials procurement
  • Production

When will it be ready?

I estimate approximately 6-8 months to fully finish fleshing out and testing everything properly. This timeline includes programming the App for both Android and iPhone compatibility, building physical prototypes, making improvements as needed, testing, tooling and manufacturing along with negotiating with major phone carriers.

Production – Where?

I’m currently researching and talking to various manufacturers in China and Taiwan along with interviewing manufacturing experts to help avoid as many mistakes and delays as possible.

Perks for our Indiegogo Supporters

Here's a breakdown of the perks you can choose from when you support this campaign (select your perk from the sidebar at the top of this page). All perks include a shout out on our website as well as a Facebook Hero Avatar to show your support in our project.

*All pledges of $100 or more will get full access to the Beta version of our "Safe Zones" App.

*Digital rewards will be given to backers immediately. Physical rewards (except Amber Jewels) will be shipped out 1-3 months after the campaign is over.

**Final physical perks may not be exactly as pictured.

***Picture of Amber Jewel is NOT of final product and is only shown to demonstrate it as a physical product.

****All pledges of $100 or more will also get full access to the Beta version of our "Safe Zones" App.

Why we need your support

We've come a long way in very short period of time but now we need your help. Your support will allow us to initiate tooling and manufacturing so we can make the Amber Jewel available to you and the millions of kids out there who are in danger. Together, we can make the world a safer, better place to live in, one child at a time. 

Please share this Indiegogo with your friends, co-workers, neighbors and people you know with children – you may in fact be responsible for saving their child from horrors no one should ever go through.

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us and ask.

FAQ.

Q. Can you have multiple safe zones at once?
A. Yes.

Q. When the Amber Jewel is activated, who is notified first?
A. You have the ability to set multiple people as first to be notified. This way both parents can be notified at the same time in case one is running errands or is unavailable like I was during my business meeting.

Q. Is the Amber Jewel an actual jewel or piece of jewelry?
A. No. The Amber Jewel is actually an electronic device. The name came from the "Amber Alert" system and we thought if we can make the device small enough, we will be able to fit it into a necklace or some other piece of jewelry or other commonly worn item.
