story:
Developed with running and walking modes, WalkingPad R1 Pro accommodates your daily exercising needs at the place you prefer. WalkingPad R1 Pro is 90% space-saving than the traditional treadmill and can be easily folded and stored with the help of double folding design and smooth-rolling wheels.

 

Conventional treadmills are huge and occupy unnecessary space. The WalkingPad R1 Pro incorporates a unique dual folding mechanism, the deck and handle can be easily folded up for compact and simple storage.

WalkingPad R1 Pro is your perfect exercise buddy that allows you to stay healthy under different scenarios.Learn from the feedback of our previous customers, we redesign the WalkingPad with the capability to serve your running need. We also reshape the WalkingPad by adding a balancing handle and prolonging the deck for the better running experience.

With smooth-rolling wheels attached, the WalkingPad R1 Pro is guaranteed for easy transport. 

 

WalkingPad R1 Pro can be easily folded up for compact and simple storage.WalkingPad R1 Pro can be controlled in three ways. Under manual mode, it can be controlled used the remote control or the KS Fit APP. Alternatively, it can be controlled by feet under the auto mode to provide greater convenience. 

By using an aluminum alloy frame, the durability and stability of WalkingPad R1 Pro are significantly enhanced. We improved the power of the motor but also reduced the noise level at the same time. Additionally, the EVA cushioning softens the impact on your knees and the anti-slip running belt will provide a better grip.

We designed a dedicated slot for phone and tablet on the handle, so you can always stay entertained and connected.

The WalkingPad R1 Pro has a newly added safety clip and front handle to keep you safe while you exercise. The handle provides additional balance while the safety clip acts as an emergency stop button. 

The LED panel sits at the front of the WalkingPad R1 Pro helps you to monitor your speed, distance and workout time.

WalkingPad R1 Pro can be controlled via KS Fit APP in which has a variety of training options. 

Here is a WalkingPad R1 Pro demo video. We will be releasing more videos like this soon. Stay tuned and find out more!

 
 

Production Updates

Who is WalkingPad Team?

WalkingPad was created by a group of professors, sports scientists, engineers. Through extensive research and discussions, we developed the innovative features of WalkingPad with the customer' s needs in mind. 

By specializing in solutions created uniquely for the home and workplace, WalkingPad is helping to empower individuals to find better health regardless of the setting. With WalkingPad exercise equipment, you're free from the sedentary lifestyle. 

 

More details: https://www.facebook.com/Indiegogo/videos/3070840686265646/

Over the year, WalkingPad has grown to be a brand trusted by many users worldwide. Here is a photo of our happy users of WalkingPad A1. 

From now until the end of the WalkingPad R1 Pro campaign, you can refer your friends to get WalkingPad amazing prizes through 2 ways. Please note that your friend can only use one referral link for one order. 

Option 1:

  • Copy your unique sharing referral link​​​​​​​

  • Share your unique sharing referral link with your friends and ask them to join the WalkingPad family by placing an order for R1 Pro on Indiegogo
  • You’ll receive FREE referral prizes including shipping! Types of prizes vary depending on how many referral orders are tracked via Indiegogo.

 

Option 2:

We've teamed up with Kickbooster. For every backer you refer to the WalkingPad R1 Pro project, you will receive an 5% of their pledge amount.

Sign up on Kickbooster. You'll get a personal link to share through social media, email, or any other platform you like. 

 

A Message From Us

In WalkingPad, we value our customers and we hope to constantly improve our product to provide the best exercise experience to our valued customers. Over the past year, we have pushed boundaries and devoted ourselves in creating the best home exercise product, the WalkingPad R1 Pro. 

Our WalkingPad A1 has been loved by users around the world and also ranked No.1 for 28 consecutive weeks under treadmill sections on JD, the largest retailer in China, a member of the NASDAQ100 and a Fortune Global 500 company. Hence, we can guarantee all of you the credibility and reliability of our product. We are also actively searching for the best logistic partner to deliver the product to all our backers. 

All in all, we would like to seek your kind support towards this campaign. Thank you very much.

Additionally, the EVA cushioning softens the impact on your knees and the anti-slip running belt will provide a better grip.We designed a dedicated slot for phone and tablet on the handle, so you can always stay entertained and connected.The WalkingPad R1 Pro has a newly added safety clip and front handle to keep you safe while you exercise. The handle provides additional balance while the safety clip acts as an emergency stop button. The LED panel sits at the front of the WalkingPad R1 Pro helps you to monitor your speed, distance and workout time.WalkingPad R1 Pro can be controlled via KS Fit APP in which has a variety of training options. Here is a WalkingPad R1 Pro demo video. We will be releasing more videos like this soon. Stay tuned and find out more!

 
 
Production UpdatesWho is WalkingPad Team?WalkingPad was created by a group of professors, sports scientists, engineers. Through extensive research and discussions, we developed the innovative features of WalkingPad with the customer' s needs in mind. By specializing in solutions created uniquely for the home and workplace, WalkingPad is helping to empower individuals to find better health regardless of the setting. With WalkingPad exercise equipment, you're free from the sedentary lifestyle.  More details: https://www.facebook.com/Indiegogo/videos/3070840686265646/Over the year, WalkingPad has grown to be a brand trusted by many users worldwide. Here is a photo of our happy users of WalkingPad A1. From now until the end of the WalkingPad R1 Pro campaign, you can refer your friends to get WalkingPad amazing prizes through 2 ways. Please note that your friend can only use one referral link for one order. Option 1:Copy your unique sharing referral link​​​​​​​
Share your unique sharing referral link with your friends and ask them to join the WalkingPad family by placing an order for R1 Pro on Indiegogo
You’ll receive FREE referral prizes including shipping! Types of prizes vary depending on how many referral orders are tracked via Indiegogo.
 Option 2:We've teamed up with Kickbooster. For every backer you refer to the WalkingPad R1 Pro project, you will receive an 5% of their pledge amount.Sign up on Kickbooster. You'll get a personal link to share through social media, email, or any other platform you like.  A Message From UsIn WalkingPad, we value our customers and we hope to constantly improve our product to provide the best exercise experience to our valued customers. Over the past year, we have pushed boundaries and devoted ourselves in creating the best home exercise product, the WalkingPad R1 Pro. Our WalkingPad A1 has been loved by users around the world and also ranked No.1 for 28 consecutive weeks under treadmill sections on JD, the largest retailer in China, a member of the NASDAQ100 and a Fortune Global 500 company. Hence, we can guarantee all of you the credibility and reliability of our product. We are also actively searching for the best logistic partner to deliver the product to all our backers. All in all, we would like to seek your kind support towards this campaign. Thank you very much.

story:
Who We Are:

Jessica Kotnour:I am a high school student from the lovely land of Central Florida and have lived with OCD throughout my middle and high school careers.  After working through and beating my OCD, I began to turn my focus on how I can help others going through the same thing.  I can't wait to start working with kids with OCD in a professional setting, but I realize that I don't have to wait in order until I'm older to help others. I started this project in May, but it really didn't take off until I met Katie who agreed to come on board and make this dream a reality.  It is so remarkable to see something that I've only thought about becoming concrete. 

Katie Strang: I’m an Honor Roll student at Hobart and William Smith colleges. I have a job in the Dean’s office at school, as well as a part time job at a retirement facility when I’m at home. I’ve volunteered with kids for a long time, coaching middle-schoolers for a science competition for seven years, leading a Sunday school class for two years, and assistant teaching at a dance studio. The next step for me is being open about my own struggles and doing something to help others. When I met Jessica at the IOCDF conference this July (where we both spoke on panels) and she shared this idea with me, I knew I had to get on board. The last couple weeks of getting things rolling have been exhilarating, and I can’t wait to see where we will take this with your support!

Alyse Schacter: I am a Pre-Med Student at the University of Ottawa in the cold and beautiful city of Ottawa in Canada! I am working towards my dream of becoming a pediatrician and that goal keeps me going! In high school I had the opportunity to organize city-wide leadership camps and I had always wanted to have a chance to be involved in organizing camps again so this is really a dream come true! Working with kids has always been one of the greatest joys in my life- whether it is volunteering at a school, daycare or camp. When I met Katie and Jess and heard about Camp Audeamus at the recent International Obsessive Compulsive Disorder Foundation Conference, I could not wait to get on board.  Growing up I was blessed to go to overnight camp every summer even when my OCD was very severe. It was thanks to my amazing family, the camp staff and my incredible group of camp 'sisters' that I was able to attend even when I was facing a lot of challenges. The memories I made at camp still bring me so much joy and I am beyond excited to make that possible for other kids. I believe that through providing love, strong, support, and a fun environment, we can make each camper's experience special and unforgettable.

story:
I'm Carlee Myers, Founder of  APOP, a.k.a. “A Piece of Positivity." APOP is the online organization I founded in April, 2015 whose mission is to encourage, support and inspire others to live healthy lifestyles, obtain happiness and achieve personal and fitness goals via three methods: Art, Fitness & Blogging. Traditionally trained in Fine Arts and non-traditionally trained in wellness, I have developed a business that allows individuals of all backgrounds and walks of life to come together and make the world a better place, one person at a time. Through my practice as a fine artist and fitness nerd I have learned that improving the world is about revitalization of the mind and body. Whether I am using art as a form of moving meditation to revitalize my positive state of mind or fitness to transform my body into one that can live life to it’s fullest, I am completing my mission of improving the world one mind and body at a time.


Developing deeper and stronger relationships with APOP’s surrounding communities by hosting art and fitness classes is a primary goal of this fundraising campaign. As of yet,  APOP has begun developing relationships with the online community by producing inspirational and motivational blog content including: Fitness Nerd Vlogs, #APOPFNF profiles a.k.a. success stories and Workout Wednesdays and Rest Day Recipes (APOP’s call to action content). In addition, I launched a membership drive in October 2015 to begin developing more interpersonal relationships between APOP and the wellness community, but a membership drive is just the beginning. There are many more opportunities of which APOP would like to take advantage and today I hope to take another step in that direction by offering members more such as access to not only myself as wellness success story, but also as a certified personal trainer (and eventually certified wellness coach) who is on call to answer any question a member might have about one’s mental or physical health journey. In addition to financing my personal training certification-- a prerequisite for my wellness coaching certification-- the funds raised will also give APOP a home to invite it's surrounding community in for classes on art as a meditative practice and personal training.  Having a newly branded and inspiring home for APOP will not only allow me the opportunity to entertain all of APOP’s virtual friends, colleagues and followers in a higher quality, improved capacity via online content, but will also allow me more opportunities to begin developing more interpersonal relationships through hosting classes that focus on mindfulness & art as well as physical health and fitness.

Still from APOP's YouTube Channel, "FitnessNerdVlogs"

What APOP Needs

KEY DESIGNATIONS: Peronal Training Certification, Website Upgrade, Equipment, Space


All money raised for APOP and it's services, will be allocated to each item below:


$250 -Miscellaneous Registration Costs for Official Business Start-up

$600 -ACE Standard Personal Training Certification

  • Includes: ACE Personal Training Manual, ACE's Essentials of Exercise Science for Fitness Professionals, Certification Exam, ACEAcademy (Study Coach Email Series, 1 practice and Exam Review, Access to ACE Resource Center)

  • Impact: APOP can start to build positive, lifelong relationships that can improve the physical in addition to mental well being of APOP’s clients.

$250 -ACE Personal Training Liability Insurance

$300 - Wordpress Business Plan

  • Includes: No Ads, Custom Design, Built-in Google Analytics, Unlimited Space, eCommerce where members and others can sign up for classes and purchase inspirational merchandise without even leaving the site!

  • Impact: Having a beautiful and easily navigated website is key for the success of any online operation. With this important upgrade, APOP can have more control over how its site interfaces with the world. We will be improving lives by making everything as easy as a click of the button and preventing Wordpress from spamming apopfitness.com with irrelevant ads.

$1200 - Equipment

  • Includes: Computer, Lighting, SD Card, Camera, Video Editing Software, Office Chair, Miscellaneous Office Supplies

  • Impact: Equipment Upgrades such as a new laptop and lighting system are another way to improve the viewer experience. Less headaches for staff means more and higher quality content for APOP’s viewers--more relatable, funny, heartwarming and inspiring videos along with written daily and weekly content.

$3400 - Studio/Office Rental (12 months)

  • Includes: Temporary rental space to be used for APOP's variety of Mind & Body classes. 

  • Impact: It’s a fact of life that one needs shelter to be happy and healthy and APOP is no different. Once APOP has a home, we’ll be able to host our wellness classes not to mention our members and other professionals in our space. 

$6000 - Total Amount Needed to Fuel APOP’s Future


What You Get

APOP offers perks ranging from a handwritten thank you card to a free art class to twelve free personal training sessions! There are perks for all contribution sizes ($5-$5000+), so make sure you check them out on the column on the right (website browser) or above (mobile). 

Original Artwork by APOP's Art as a Meditative Practice Instructor

Original APOP Fitness Merchandise 



The Impact

Perfect Yourself, Perfect the World -- that’s our motto!

By making your gift you will help APOP perfect itself, so that it can in turn help others achieve self-betterment. As the founder, I personally like the word ‘perfect’ because it’s unachievable, thus forcing the users of the word to live in the mindset that once you achieve something there is always more to be done --more goals to work toward.

As the founder, I began my journey to self-improvement or ‘perfection,’ if you will, with this goal in mind when I created the YouTube Channel, FitnessNerdVlogs. Now that I am well into my own journey, I want to help others achieve their own goals and dreams. By expanding my dream from a simple YouTube Channel to a fully-functioning blog filled with daily content and, now, to an online and in-person business, I am taking the first steps in making my dreams of helping others discover their best selves come true. I do, however need a little bit more than just ideas and determination to improve the world; I need like-minded individuals like you to stand up and help me make a difference by giving a gift today.



Other Ways You Can Help

I realize not all of us, myself included, are made of money, so if you don’t see yourself making a gift, that’s totally fine! I’d be flattered if you simply did one thing:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about APOP’s campaign. Indiegogo makes sharing super easy with it’s build in share tools, so go on and spread the positivity one piece at a time!

And don't forget like us on Facebook! www.facebook.com/apopfitness

I also realize some of you are business professionals who may be interested in another type of gift: Sponsorship. I’d love for APOP to partner with organizations that’s mission aligns with my own; if you are interested in sponsoring some of APOP’s online content and receiving additional publicity in return contact me directly at: carleemyers@apopfitness.com.


Thanks for reading and remember… “Perfect Yourself, Perfect the World!”


Sincerely,


Carlee Myers

Founder, APOP

E: carleemyers@apopfitness.com



PS: Do you want to get involved? Do you have any questions? Ask way!

story:
NOTE: Indiegogo makes the minimum goal be $500. We just need $40-50. I'll donate any additional money raised to charity (or send more boxes over - your call).

Jose Mourinho's Chelsea side has suffered greatly ever since their tragic loss to the "Mickey Mouse" team that are the Shield-winning New York Red Bulls in late July 2015. They find themselves in 15th place in the Prem table after 10 games, probably due to the lack of energy they've found themselves with after losing to a team composed mainly of Red Bulls Academy players (including 16 year-old Tyler Adams, who found the back of the net).

I've always been taught to give back to those who need it the most. After winning the Supporters' Shield, I think it's time that RBNY fans give back to Chelsea and Mourinho. Let's send them a box of Red Bull to help make things better for those poor souls.

I leave you with this snippet from an article written recently about Chelsea's woes: 

"... While Mourinho has retained the confidence of the majority of Chelsea’s players, there remain concerns within the dressing room over his perceived draconian methods and harsh treatment of certain individuals, a resentment that has its roots in the manager’s reaction to his side’s first pre-season friendly of last summer, a surprise 4-2 defeat by the New York Red Bulls.

In the immediate aftermath of that match in New Jersey, in July, Mourinho initially ignored his team after watching them concede four second-half goals to a side comprised largely of Red Bulls Academy youngsters, but brought the game up during a team talk several weeks later, in which he turned on his players and accused them of losing to a "Mickey Mouse team". This outburst infuriated several players, as they had moved on from that defeat and did not appreciate being castigated for it long after the event."

story:
Short Summary

Camp MARC has been of service to the mentally and physically disabled of Kentucky, Tennessee, Indiana, and beyond for over 50 years. The concept for Camp MARC began with a few pioneering parents who wanted to offer their mentally and physically disabled children an opportunity to experience summer camp like other children. Thus, Camp MARC was formed. 

In the beginning camp was two weeks every summer but as time went on, and expenses rose, camp had to be cut to one week. Each year there is a waiting list for both campers and volunteer counselors. Currently, the campers consist of adults who have intellectual disabilities as a primary diagnosis, while many also have some physical disability as well.

On average, Camp MARC serves about one hundred campers a year from Western Kentucky.  While there, campers participate in music, nature, sports, arts & crafts, swimming and boating.  They also have the opportunity to be part of such activities as a Cabaret, Camp Olympics, an Award Ceremony and a Dance.

*Camp MARC was founded in 1962 as a non-profit 501(c)3 orginazation and is staffed by a team of 14 Core Staff and 50 volunteer counselors*

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help. Each year camp costs more and more to operate. We rent the facility that we hold camp at, we purchase insurance, we rent golf carts to aid campers with mobility issues, purchase medical supplies, rent a pontoon, and the list goes on and on.

We have set a goal of $1,500.00 to help cover the thousands of dollars that camp costs to operate. These funds will help purchase supplies for programming areas, medical supplies, and golf cart rental.

As a thank you for your contribution we have some fantastic perks to share with you!

  • $5.00: As a Bronze Level Doner you will receive our heartfelt Thanks and your name is listed for all to see on our 2013 Camp MARC Wall of Honor!
  • $15.00: As a Silver Level Doner you will receive our heartfelt Thanks, your name is listed for all to see on our 2013 Camp MARC Wall of Honor, and you receive a special thank you note from our campers!
  • $25.00: As a Gold Level Doner you will receive our heartfelt Thanks, your name is listed for all to see on our 2013 Camp MARC Wall of Honor, a special thank you note from our campers, and a one of a kind Camp MARC friendship bracelet!
  • $50.00: As a Platinum Level Doner you will receive our heartfelt Thanks, your name is listed for all to see on our 2013 Camp MARC Wall of Honor, you receive a special thank you note from our campers, a one of a kind Camp MARC friendship bracelet, and a special flower planted in our Camp MARC Memory Garden!
  • $100.00+: As a Diamond Level Doner you will receive our heartfelt Thanks, your name is listed for all to see on our 2013 Camp MARC Wall of Honor, you receive a special thank you note from our campers, a one of a kind Camp MARC friendship bracelet, a special flower planted in our Camp MARC Memory Garden, and a 2013 Camp MARC t-shirt.

The Impact

Camp MARC is important. For many of our campers this is the one week out of the year that they are more than a patient number. For others camp is where they go for their summer vacation. Camp MARC is a place where the priority is our campers, after all, that is why Camp MARC exists!

Not only do the campers have a great time but our staff does too. Camp MARC is a family. Not only do our counselors come back year after year they do it for FREE. That’s right. Our counselors are all volunteers. Collectively our staff has over 400 years of service to Camp MARC. These amazing people have dedicated years of their lives making one week the best week of the year for our campers!   

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone can contribute financially but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! All you have to do is help us spread the word. It’s as simple as emailing a friend or sharing our campaign on Facebook and Twitter!

With your help we know we can reach our goal and keep Camp MARC going for another 50 years!

The Impact
Camp MARC is important. For many of our campers this is the one week out of the year that they are more than a patient number. For others camp is where they go for their summer vacation. Camp MARC is a place where the priority is our campers, after all, that is why Camp MARC exists!
Not only do the campers have a great time but our staff does too. Camp MARC is a family. Not only do our counselors come back year after year they do it for FREE. That’s right. Our counselors are all volunteers. Collectively our staff has over 400 years of service to Camp MARC. These amazing people have dedicated years of their lives making one week the best week of the year for our campers!   
Other Ways You Can Help
We realize that not everyone can contribute financially but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! All you have to do is help us spread the word. It’s as simple as emailing a friend or sharing our campaign on Facebook and Twitter!
With your help we know we can reach our goal and keep Camp MARC going for another 50 years!

story:
"My sweet little baby, you we're so close to being able to survive, but your lifeline wouldn't hold up.  Only if we'd had more time things might've been different, but they are what they are and now I miss you so. I love you Nellie." Mom

 My name is Ann, Im trying to raise money for my Sister Kristina Adams and her Fiance Carlos Porcel. Last month April 21st 2013 Kristina Adams and Carlos Porcel brought baby Nellie into this world. Sadley my beautiful Neice died minutes after being born.

   When it started to rain it began to fall on the family. Less then 3 weeks before Nellie died Carlos was laid off and the family was unable to pay the morgage for this month. Kristina found out days after Carlos was laid off that her Father whom she had recently reconnected with had died unexpectedly after being released home from surgery.

    I'm trying to help Kristina and Carlos raise enough money to have a nice memorial service for Nellie and to get caught up on they're morgage. I know they had to borrow $300 to help with cremation services and the morgage is $1200, It also costs $450 to have a service at Sequim Valley Funeral Chapel. Sequim, WA.

    If you have finished reading this thank you for your time and for caring. I just hope they can get help from this campaign. I know their is no amount of money  that can replace loved one's, but a little help towards this tragedy would be so appreciated & REALLY needed. Thank you and may you have a blessed day.

story:
Why DNA Life Bars?

DNA Life Bars were created out of a love for well-being.

HI- my name is Brian Layne, founder and CEO of DNA Life Bars.   I created these whole food protein bars after my wife Elizabeth was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis in 2010.  With this life change, she took the non-traditional approach to her well- being and choose an alternative method of healing that excluded medication and included whole food eating with no gluten, diary or sugar.  

Being an active couple  all our  lives, we could not find a protein bar that Elizabeth could eat after a workout, a hike, or just for a snack.  I have always been the cook  in the family and thus began experimenting with different ingredients until I created a protein bar that met her high dietary standard, and tasted amazing.  Elizabeth loved them so much and felt great eating them that she knew the bars had to be shared with the world!   

Three years later, Elizabeth has not had a relapse and attributes her good health and healing to a clean and healthy lifestyle.


What We Need & What You Get

DNA Life Bars is at a critical point to take the business to the next level.  We are seeking your generous support of $15k  for pre-printed roll packaging that will allow us to transition from a commercial kitchen to a certified gluten-free co-packer. 

Currently we manually prep each package with three labels- which is very labor intensive and time consuming!  With your help we will be able to purchase  pre-printed packaging  for each flavor.   And lastly, make the move from our three man baking operation in a rented commercial kitchen to a local co-packer partnership which will allow us to focus our time and energy to creating new flavors, on-line marketing strategies and be able to fulfill larger orders to mainstream retail stores. 

The Impact

DNA Life Bars are the only protein bar on the market that is fresh BAKED and that not only taste amazing, but are made to support gut health. Using whole food goodness, we believe we are making an impact on how  "healthy" protein bars are made and make us feel.  

     Gluten, Dairy, Soy & Corn Free.  No Refined Sugar or Artificial Preservatives!

• Egg White Protein- (14 grams)- Unlike whey protein, it's dairy free. 

• Organic Coconut- despite being high in ‘saturated fat’, this good fat is now known to offer many unique health giving properties.

•Organic Pumpkin- loaded with Vitamin A, fiber, and vital antioxidants such as carotene.

•Organic Sweet Potatoes- high in Vitamin B6, Vitamin C, D, Iron and Magnesium.

•Gluten Free grains and flours-Tapioca and Rolled oats.

• Xylitol- used as a sweetner, it's derived from the fibrous part of the North American Birch tree.  Tastes similar to sugar, but with low glycemic index and 35% less calories it is even safe for diabetics.

•100% Organic Cocoa contains flavonols and phytonutrients found in nature and of course tastes incredible.



Other Ways You Can Help

Please donate and pass this video along to your friends!  Press the share buttons! Let people know about  these amazing and delicious protein bars.  The more people who visit our site, the more chances we have to reach our goal.  

Imagine, just a few short months from now you'll be able to say "I helped grow a thriving, unique protein bar company that not only is good for you but tastes amazing too! 

                 Remember:    "THEY ONLY TASTE LIKE YOU'RE CHEATING!"

story:
Short Summary

We are 'Don Kihot', an equine-assisted therapy association. We care for five riding horses and have more than twenty regular riders, who include children with developmental disabilities and disabled people.

Because of a combination of extremely bad conditions, wetland area and small capacity at our former farm, we were forced to move. The new farm is perfect for us and seems straight out of a fairytale, but there is a problem. When we inspected the stables we were met with old and run-down beams and worn out roof tiles which may collapse and thus pose a threat for the horses. That is why we need your help: renovations are necessary to get them functional as soon as possible. The remaining funds will be invested in building a new riding manege. The amount of donations needed is extensive, but any help is welcome and appreciated.


Why is equine assisted therapy extremely important for children with developmental disabilities? 

  • Horse gait is three-dimensional and similar to human gait.
  • Children sitting on a horse feel as if they are walking on their own, while riding strenghtens their muscles, makes them work, and improves their entire bodies' motor movements, along with navigation and coordination between objects. 
  • Confers a psychological benefit by lifting their self-confidence and brain centers' activity, while making them extremely happy and motivated.
  • Since two people are working with the child on horseback, it is also motivated to communicate and work together with others.
  • They are taught from a young age about animals, their feelings, needs and behavior, but also about the importance of environmental care and its sustainability.


We are working on making life better for the entire society:

  • equine assisted therapy for children with developmental disabilities and disabled people 
  • spreading the word on equine assisted therapy 
  • promotion of volunteering 
  • education of young people and their mobilization in projects and volunteer labor
  • workshops on socialization, return to social values, environment and animal care
  • helping children with developmental disabilities and disabled persons to integrate into society
  • cooperation with other NGOs and humanitarian support with projects



What We Need & What You Get

The most important thing is to get our horses to a safe and warm place during the winter. The money would enable us to buy materials to refurbish the roof and the interior of the stable, and it would provide a starting point for building a new riding manege. Volunteers are always welcome, but we do all the reparations ourselves in order to save on wages for hired workers. Work has never been a problem for us.

Apart from our immeasurable gratitude, we will gladly welcome all our donators from Croatia and accessible countries at our farm in Šimunčevec. If you ever come along to our farm as a tourist, we will be your hosts and introduce you to our association and give you a place to stay for the night.

We will personally thank all the donors in writing, we will send you hand-made artwork created by our children with developmental disabilities, and we will put your names at a visible place at our farm. The happines which you will provide to our children cannot be put into words.


The Impact

The activities of our association affect the entire community. We are one of the few NGOs in this region that seriously focuses on equine assisted therapy. By donating, you would enable us to expand our capacity and to include in therapies children who are currently on hold, you would enable better and safer working conditions, and thus make us work harder.

We give young people a place to volunteer, to use their free time, and a way to change the world.

We are situated at a new farm characterized by the traditional values of Zagreb's surroundings. The house and stable were built at the beginning of last century, and their refurbishment keeps the old traditional look of the farm, while adding modern techniques of working with animals.

Our NGO has been supported by other NGOs dedicated to helping children from Zagreb, such as 'Krila' and 'Anđeli', and the Šibenik NGO 'Pegasus'. Croatia's Ministry of the Interior has provided us with employees who help out with manual labor at the farm, as well as a psychologist for the children.

We have been active since 2009 and over 150 volonteers have participated in our association.


Other Ways You Can Help

Money is not the main way in which you can help. Share our story, tell your neighbor, your friend, your work colleague. The story of us, of volunteering, of humanitarian activities, that always matters. If you ever come to Croatia (or are here already), volunteer help is something we can always use.


Our horses:

  • Feniks: a young and curious horse, who opens jacket pockets with his muzzle, looking for carrots. As soon as you open the stable doors, he is out and cantering in the yard.
  • Sokol: Called after the falcon (Croatian: 'sokol'), but a completely different sort of animal. Tender, quiet, sensible, reliable and safe for children. Maintains a tough front so it doesn't show, but he adores being stroked and cuddled.
  • Nacika: Our oldest guy at the farm, a retired police horse. He has a 15-year experience in therapy with children, and he is so used to people that he is most likely to put his head into your lap as soon as you approach him.
  • Shani: The only lady among the horses, which really says it all about how difficult it is  for her. She posesses all the traits of a woman: she is often angry, likes to be allowed to do everything and to have it all her way. She is the best horse for learning riding basics.
  • Maro: The best horse in the world – in short. He adores people, constantly shadows you and the worst thing for him if you don't pay attention to him.

Sokol: Called after the falcon (Croatian: 'sokol'), but a completely different sort of animal. Tender, quiet, sensible, reliable and safe for children. Maintains a tough front so it doesn't show, but he adores being stroked and cuddled.


Nacika: Our oldest guy at the farm, a retired police horse. He has a 15-year experience in therapy with children, and he is so used to people that he is most likely to put his head into your lap as soon as you approach him.


Shani: The only lady among the horses, which really says it all about how difficult it is  for her. She posesses all the traits of a woman: she is often angry, likes to be allowed to do everything and to have it all her way. She is the best horse for learning riding basics.

story:
Our Story

Dear friends.

On 29th Of January 2012, one of my childhood friend and fellow gurukuli Shakshi Gopal Pande met with a life threatening motorbike accident at Juhu, Mumbai, INDIA. Shakshi and his wife were run over by Tata Manza driver who drove recklessly. They sustained major injuries and were lodged in 2 different hospitals in Juhu, Mumbai, India. His wife had surgery operation done and has returned home to recuperate.

Shakshi Gopal is still in ICU (Intensive Care Unit) in Criti Care Hospital as he has sustained major life threatening injuries such as:

  • Brain Swelling
  • Skull Fracture
  • Multiple Ribs Fracture
  • Hip Bone Fracture
  • Foot Fracture

One of his main blood vessel which is pumping blood into his heart is to be replaced URGENTLY.


The Impact

Hearing news about his accident has shattered me and our friends around the world. I wish I was there personally to help Shakshi Gopal recover. His family is completely in need of financial, physical and emotional help at this time. I have created this campaign to help his family to cover the medical and other cost.


What We Need & What You Get

We are requesting anyone and everyone to help us in taking care of Shakshi Gopal and help financially, so that he will one day come back to normal life like all of us. Please extend any kind of support you can offer, financially or by providing any assistance in his long list of medical surgeries. In exchange, we will offer your prayers to respective deities for you and your family's well being.


We are keeping goal of $6000 to be raised for taking care of his emergency medical bills. Anything beyond that would help his family cover the cost of his and wife's other hospital bills. 


For those who cannot come forward for any assistance, we request you to kindly keep Shakshi Gopal in your prayers and pray for his speedy recovery to normal life.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us (me and Shakshi's family) by sharing this information via social media and encourage people you know to come forward and HELP a fellow Gurukuli!
